text:
We came to eat to celebrate our anniversary (this as one of our first dates 14 years ago).  I called over a month ago to make the reservation and explained the purpose of our visit and asked if they could do anything for us when we came.  We arrived that night and were seated quickly.  Very crowded, very loud.  I didn't remember that from the last visit several years ago until we sat down and it came back to me very quickly.

The Waiter seemed distracted, but we managed to get our order.  The fried crawfish were great as a starter.  We then decided to get a few more appetizers and one entree to split.  When the gumbo came, we both decided it tasted like spicy water.  There was no flavor at all.  Even the shrimp had no taste.  It almost tasted like it was diluted to make it last the night or had just been sitting in the pot way too long.  I mentioned it to the waiter and he commented that he has never had it and that the main items are made in such large quantities, he didn't expect it would be very good.  What?!  Why would the waiter say that instead of "I'm sorry sir, can we get you something else?"

The rest of the meal was okay.  The Diane had more chicken than anything else (about 2 shrimp and 2 crawfish to go with three chicken breasts).  It lacked any flavor either and was kind of mushy.  The oysters were good and the crawfish scampi was good, but a bit on the greasy side.

The waiter never asked if we enjoyed our meal and never even said thank you for visiting.  He dropped off the ticket, picked it up and brought it back without saying word.  Customer service is just as important as the food, so that rates 0 stars.  He looked like we were in his way since we were only a 2 topper and he was losing money with us when he had other larger tables in his section.  The manager even walked by us several times and didn't even ask about our meal or acknowledge us.

Overall, we were very disappointed at the experience.  It seems like they are running on their reputation and haven't done much to maintain or improve over the years.  We have eaten here since I arrived in Charlotte in 1996 and have had events there, etc.  This visit will change my mind of a repeat visit.

Oh, by the way, no one even mentioned our anniversary when I specifically asked when I made that reservation a month ago.  That is a big no-no.

We went for early dinner yesterday shortly after 5:00 pm. The place was empty and the hostess tried to usher us to the back of the building to a corner as we admired the gorgeous fireplace and the empty room. We put the brakes on and elected to occupy the best table in the house. We then witnessed a small parade of people refusing to sit in the "back of the bus" also. 

It was down hill from there. The waiter had the personality of, well, actually he didn't have one. The service could be described in one word, horrible. We had a groupon to rid our selves of and that's the only reason we didn't casually get up and walk out immediately. We ordered and within two or three minutes, our food arrived. Thankfully the bowls were warm and it was the only item that was warm. The food had very good flavor but the temperature was cool at best. We waited for a moment to see if Mister Personality would at least peek in on us to see if everything was satisfactory. Unfortunately, not to our surprise, he never checked on us the entire cold food meal. Normally, i would have insisted on a manager for some type of explanation but we decided to count our losses and endure it and never, ever return. 

Considering this is a service industry and the waiters depend on tips as a return for excellent service, we wonder how he makes a living. My wife constantly reminds me of how I tip above and beyond 20% even when it's not warranted, but i took pride in giving this waiter exactly what he gave us.  

I can only hope he was having a bad day and we found him in a moment he was not ready for our company. Maybe it was the electric blue shirt i was wearing, maybe? See where this is going? I'm not going there totally but it made us wonder what his issue was with us. Did we fit the "stereotypical they don't tip" profile? Well, guess what, we gave him the results it appeared he was looking for. Parental Tough love is what he was shown. "Son you must treat everyone with respect or you will not be rewarded!!

Our experience versus some of the other revues here makes us wonder how the service industry has fallen to mediocrity being accepted as the normal standard. Sad, very sad.

The "Complimentary Valet" came with the complimentary attitude as well. The entire experience of the restaurant starts the second you get out your vehicle. We were greeted with, "You can just park your car right there" - taking away for the service that we are supposedly getting "Complimentary". Fast forward to the food - the choices & portions attached with their magical seasonings are amazing! The service took a bit longer than expected and two tables were served and received their food before we did & we had a reservation. W elect the waiter a minimal tip mainly because we felt as though our orders & the items we needed prior to receiving our food were not met within a timely fashion. Secondly, we asked a guy who was just walking the floor to see if he had an idea of how long our food would take. He said he had no idea; not offering to even check. My friend then responded, "Do you think you can go & find out then....?" He then came back & stated that it was on its way. The "on its way" comment was followed by an additional 15 minute lag time. After dinner, we were met in the parking lot with a different Valet Attendant & I proceeded to hand him our ticket for my vehicle. I told him, "I can actually go & grab it myself because it's right there", (pointing about 10 feet to the right). He stated, "That's not your car" & before he could even hand me the keys, the car horn sounded notifying that it was my vehicle & all I exited the conversation with was a "Thanks". I left him a tip mainly because he was light skinned and cute. Overall, I'd go back there. I could just do without the Valet & possibly a more socially conscious waiter.

The crawfish scampi and Tilipia with crawfish topping was awesome as always, extremely consistent, exception being the gumbo, it is not typical Louisiana roux based gumbo, I will not order again. I also only give 4 stars, as Brandon, our Server, must have had something or someone else on his mind as he barely had us on his mind. Next time we will ask for Samantha, or Sam, best server in the house.
The food is awesome. The fried clams were fresh and were the best 'Ive ever had.  Great neighborhood. Perfect for Sunday brunch

A delish Sunday brunch! I didn't think prices were high for what we enjoyed (okay, maybe a bit steep on the beignets, but those are worth it). My partner's banana bourbon french toast was a sugar bomb in the best way, and I could actually taste the bourbon in the ooey gooey syrup. My crab cakes benedict was perfectly cooked. The crab tasted fresh, not stale or dry, and the eggs were just right. It also came with a nice side of fruit. Overall, for $12 it my benedict was a bang up brunch plate.

We went there on a Friday without a reservation. We were told that it could be an hour wait. But the hostess was very unfriendly, it was our first visit there and did not feel welcomed at all. We ended up no eating there. I don't care how good your food is if staff is unfriendly I  am not going in there. We drove back to our go to place Razzoo.

The service was great!! Olivia was quick and friendly. She suggested the Diane for me since I've had some bad time with Etoufee at other restaurants. And that was MARVELOUS. I love mushrooms and the spice is off the chain. If you are on a diet, don't get the Asian, let's say BUTTER! My boyfriend had the Creole and he liked it with the Shrimp, it could not top my chicken. The Crawfish Scampi for appetizer I could have ate with rice as a dish!!!! The food was great and FREE VALET, but they work off tips so tip well. I definitely will be coming back until I learn how to make the DIANE sauce

The fried oysters appetizer is super yummy as is the Diane with rice, shrimp and crawfish. Great atmosphere. Made reservations and were good to go as soon as we arrived, which has always been the case when I've made reservations here. Highly recommend it !

We had to visit Charlotte's best cajun joint before we headed home to NYC. 4 stars for the haunted black magic atmosphere of the restaurant. Even in broad daylight, the dining hall had a dark shrouded vibe going on. The beignets let me down a little bit but the shrimp & grits more than made up for it. The fried popcorn shrimp was also very well done but the highlight for me was the shrimp & grits.
Nice place, great food, what more can you ask for, just to let you know this is fine dining so be prepare to pay a little

When I came to Charlotte in 2009, Cajun Queen was one of the first restaurants I visited.  The food was amazing!!!  When family and friends came to town I took them there. They all raved about the food.  The past three times have been very disappointing!  I went there yesterday for dinner. The service was good the food not so much.  I ordered the Etouffée with all three my sister ordered the Diane with chicken and shrimp.  We both were unhappy with our food and the basket of biscuits that were rock hard. I don't know if there is new management or they're cutting back on seasonings to cut cost.  Either way I will not go back. Sad, I really liked this place!!

This place was a classic, like so many others that have just run out of steam. Lost their mojo so to speak. (Maybe cause the tree out front is gone.) 

My advise, drink up in the bar and in a few hours it want really matter if the food is great or just okay.

This was my favorite joint in the CLT.  I have never been to New Orleans, and because of Katrina, I probably  won't for awhile, but I imagine that this is a pretty good joint even by looziana standards.  I always get the blackened platter with chicken and the fish special with one of their rotating toppings, usually  one with crawfish and corn and a side of gumbo.  MMMMMMMMMM

It was more than a good meal, it was a great experience. We recently visited New Orleans and loved the culture and food.  Cajun Queen perfectly seasoned / spiced dishes made us feel like we were back there again. A gem without a doubt in Charlotte with impeccable attentive service.  We will be back and refer them to others.
I am only in Charlotte occasionally, but I must come here every time. The crawfish is as good as any in New Orleans. The staff is great. I wouldn't change a thing.

We had our first visit last night. Fun, jazzy band, great atmosphere, but the food was the star of the show. Fried green tomatoes, BBQ shrimp, shrimp and grits, fried oysters... all excellent. Fast, polite, unobtrusive service, too. We'll definitely be back. A+

When you're running out of date night locations and your significant other is getting tired of Domino's cheap weekday carryout deals, it's time to treat her to a fancy restaurant. Preferably one that constantly offers $20 for $40 online coupon deals like Cajun Queen does.

The location is very nice - it looks like a converted home with outdoor patio seating and an enclosed back porch for when the weather is nice. There's live music most nights and a bar upstairs if you just want to sit and enjoy a cocktail or two while you wait for a table.

The food was excellent - we got the Cajun BBQ shrimp as an appetizer and couldn't stop raving about it. Save your dinner rolls to mop up the delicious juice! Ask for another basket when they drop the shrimp off! We ordered gumbo too just to splurge but it seemed bland in comparison to that excellent BBQ shrimp juice.

I always feel bad waiting sitting through a waiter's shpeel about the daily specials and not ordering one so I ordered a steak special and my lady got chicken Diane. The steak was cooked medium rare as requested with craw fish etoufee and hearty mash potatoes riding shotgun. The chicken Diane's gravy was rich, flavorful and tasted fantastic. The portion sizes were enough to feel full and take enough home for meals the next day.

The service was excellent as well - our server was very personable and friendly. He make jokes, answered our questions about the menu, and never kept us waiting long when we needed something. 

The entrees at Cajun Queen are around the $20 range which makes it really easy to blow your Groupon for a date night. In addition, there's a $5 charge for splitting an entree. I'll definitely be buying another coupon for Cajun Queen. The prices are a little beyond making it a regular spot (even with a coupon) but it's perfect for a memorable date night.

I had not heard of this place until I saw the Groupon for it and purchased it to try something new.  I had no idea what to expect after I went on their website, oddly I didn't read Yelp reviews first (which I normally do).  I went with a friend and we split the fried oyster appetizer, suggested by our waiter and I got the shrimp diane, also a recommendation of our waiter. We ate upstairs and the bar area wasn't too busy since we went during a week night so we had very good and attentive service. Everything I ordered which I finished off with bread pudding dessert was extremely tasty, so much that I am still thinking about it today which is why I am leaving this review! I have already recommended this place to others and can't wait to go back.  The Groupon deal they run for $25 worth of $40 makes it a great deal too.  However, I don't need a Groupon to go back!

I was quite excited to finally come here after purchasing the Google Offer, and overall, I think I got my $15 dollar's worth. The appetizer (crawfish scampi) was tiny, but delicious. The fried shrimp was very nicely done -- not battered to death. Shrimp "Diane" looked yummy, with plenty of onion and mushrooms. My entree, Crawfish Etouffee, was really good (though I should have tried it with some of the spices on the table), but later on, didn't quite agree with my stomach. I don't typically eat shellfish, so that is most likely the reason. I would have tried one of the fish entrees, but they're pricey. Our server Bob was okay, but kind of standoffish sometimes.

The most disappointing part was that NONE of the seafood is domestic. Bob was amused that I asked, but considering seafood is their speciality, you would think they'd take sustainability and safety seriously. http://www.montereybayaquarium.org//cr/SeafoodWatch/web/sfw_factsheet.aspx?gid=18
Food was very flavorful. I had the Diane with shrimp and my husband had the salt and pepper catfish. Both dishes were great!!

We made reservations online for 7:15; arrived around 7:00 and were seated within 10 minutes. Service was outstanding! We never waited for drink refills; the staff was always on top of it, even though the place was packed. Fried Green tomatoes for an appetizer was perfect! We split the Chicken Diane - delicious! Bourbon pecan pie for dessert. Great dinner, great music, atmosphere was on point. We did sit in the same room as the band (which we requested) so it was a little loud to be having conversation but we enjoyed the music very much. Definitely recommend and will be back!

Went to the Cajun Queen this weekend and I really enjoyed the Shrimp Étouffée it was just spicy enough and was a really big portion.  My wife does not like Cajun food and had the steak it was probably the worst steak I have ever had, the spice on it tasted funny.  Overall I was happy I had a groupon and would only go back for takeout.

Super good food. The BBQ shrimp is to die for. Make sure you get the bread to soak in the juices! I could eat that as a meal. The etuffe was very well done and my husband couldn't keep his hands off my entree  (no pun intended!). The bread pudding is the real thing too! Go ahead of time and hang out for a while. We enjoyed the love music but they only played for 30 min per hour. Was hoping for a more continuous roll. But can't complain. Great experience overall.

Parking sucks. First time here and our waiter forgot literally everything. Ordered a beer and asked for a chilled glass, never came out. Told us all entrees came with salad or soup, never came out. Never was offered bread and didn't realize it until we were leaving. Every time we had to ask for something, he never gave us a chance to ask or talk because he would whisk away quickly. Also the hostess asked if we had reservations... Lol, it was 3 o'clock on a Sunday? Food was okay.

This was my favorite restaurant in Charlotte 20 years ago.  Many new restaurants have come to town since then...and this is still my favorite.  The food is authentic, the ingredients are fresh and high-quality, the service is friendly, and the atmosphere is great.

The food, at least what we had, the chicken diane and the biscuits and gravy, were excellent!  Full of flavor, fresh, great portion size. Really delicious!  The service was great too. The décor and atmosphere however, leave a lot to be desired. Very tired, worn out, drab, old. I would go back though, the food was awesome.
One of the best go-to Cajun restaurants in Charlotte. Terrific gumbo.  I go for the crawfish etouffee every time!

Good music, great atmosphere, and awesome food!! If you haven't been to New Orleans this place is the closest you will come to it in this city. The blackened fish with rice and beans  is my favorite. The drinks are on point.. I always have a great time here!!

I went to cajun queen with some friends from work a while back. I had the Diane, which people seem to be raving about on yelp. It was okay. I found the favors to be very mild and uninteresting; there was no spicier or complexity to the meal. The live music was nice but makes me wonder if this place would be appropriate for a quiet, romantic dinner. I will probably give cajun queen another try just in case it was an off night.

The food and portions were great!  In fact,  a wonderful evening out with my husband during restaurant week was perfect until my vehicle was sideswiped while dining.  There servers were polite and very accomodating.

The vibe was really nice.  There was a jazz band there that was awesome and not over powering while eating.  And our waitress was totally awesome.  The best server I've had at any restaurant in a long time.  I will definitely recommend to friends and family that ask for such type food and good service.

I am not a big Cajun Food connoisseur but I know what a good étouffée tastes like after a few visits to New Orleans and having eaten it at other places.  We wanted to try this place as the reviews were really good. The service was just good -  the live Jazz music OK and the food was disappointing to say the least. 3 stars for the ambiance.

My wife and I haven't checked out to many cajun restaurants since we moved to Ft. Mill several months ago.   The problem is we've been to Nawlins on at least three occasions and sampled low country food in Charleston, SC on several visits, so although the food was pretty good, it doesn't compare to what we have experienced in NO.  We are still glad we gave it a try.

After waiting and waiting this week me and my spouse finally went to cajun queen and in my opinion it was just ok. We had the barbque shrimp which was ok fresh shrimp in a spicy sauce. My boo did save his dinner rolls for the juice. He had the fried shrimp which was good i had a steak which was ok with potatoes that were ok and bland broccoli. I alsohad gumbo which was not very good. Overall it was ok but fo
r 80 i have had better
One of my favorite restaurants! Food is always good and service is always great! Fun atmosphere!

We love the Queen and once again we were not disappointed. Outstanding all the way around. One of the best ambiance restaurants I have ever been in. Highly recommend the crawfish scampi appetizer and blackened or fried catfish. Their complimentary valet parking is the icing on the cake. Great place!

Very enjoyable dining experience.  The service was friendly and timing was good.  Food was very good quality and taste.  Serving quantities was adequate.  Nice menu selections and drink offerings.  Highly recommend dining here.
Service was quick from the valet to the seating and food. The food was just right! The blackened catfish was awesome.

Terribly busy during the weekend evenings and the service seems to suffers. But not their fault because they seem to overbook themselves to the point of having customers wait for a while at the upstairs bar. We waited about 20 minutes for a reservation to be ready. The bar was packed and had only one bartender, so it was also very slow.

That said, the food was really AMAZING. Best Cajun place outside of New Orleans, by far. Definitely worth a visit. The Diane and Etoufee dishes are really great. Went there again on a Sunday afternoon and the service was much better.

The drinks are outstanding too!
Delicious food, warm atmosphere and delightful jazz band playing as we ate!  It's nice to have Cajun food so close to home.
Fantastic Sunday brunch...Alex is an awesome server who knew everything about the items on the menu.  Bananas Foster French Toast... Best. Ever.

This place is awesome! I bought a groupon spend $20 get $40 so a few of us went to check it out.  They had a live jazz band upstairs which was great.  We shared fried green tomatoes, calamari and chicken/shrimp creole.  It was all fabulous.  Definitely a great girls night or date night place!  I took my husband there last week and he loved it!
Cajun Queen was everything the reviews said it was.  The food portions were huge! The service was excellent.

Great Brunch on a very rainy morning. Wait staff was friendly and helpful in every way. And food was excellent. Don't skip the Benet's that come with a strawberry sauce as a starter for all to share; they were delicious! As were the Fried Green Tomatoes appetizers. The eggs Benedicts were great and famous shrimp and grits. No complaints. Very delicious food, prepared to perfection. Will definitely come back. Thank you Cajun Queen.
I love this place.  Went with my gf on a random Monday.  The food, service, and live music was all great.  Drinks were beyond strong.  The seating is a little close, but I still loved it.

My favorite restaurant in Charlotte, bar none.  My wife and I have been at least a couple dozen times over the years.  The crawfish scampi is my favorite appetizer/side dish I've ever enjoyed, at restaurants ranging from greasy spoons to upscale steakhouses.  Savory, delectable, and delicious.  It's the kind of dish I could eat every single day.  Make sure to soak up the remaining sauce with your bread. 

I believe we have had every entree on the menu at one time or another, but my favorite has to be the crawfish etouffee.  Generous portions of crawfish paired with a perfectly spiced roux over rice.  It never disappoints. We just got back from New Orleans and had this same dish at 3 or 4 different well-reviewed restaurants, and none of them, in my opinion, bested Cajun Queen's.
. Great live music and food and drinks , a must go back to restaurant in Charlotte asap , watier was Very good and food was alsome.

I used to go to this restaurant quite often several years ago when I lived here in Charlotte. The service was always great, the food was delicious, and the atmosphere and music were very enjoyable. Needless to say, my expectation level was high. The complimentary valet is a plus as it used to be a nightmare to park there. The hostesses weren't very friendly nor was the front of the house manager when we walked in. We were taken to our tiny table shoved up against the wall. Our two top was VERY close to a 5 top with barely any room to move. Our waiter came over pointed to the restaurant week menu and walked off. I should have foreseen then how the evening was going to go. The waiter finally came back and abruptly took our drink order. He brings my wine and walks away without saying a word and then comes back 5 minutes later with my husband's wine. We ordered the exact same thing so why it took so long for the other glass is beyond me. The waiter comes over and rudely asks what do you want! I ordered the Caesar salad which was straight out of a bag with dried out lettuce and croutons hard enough to break a tooth. My husband got the gumbo and thought it was good. I ordered the etouffee with shrimp and crayfish as my entree and my husband ordered the shrimp and grits. The sauce was tasty and not to spicy. There were probably 5 tiny overcooked shrimp pieces , 10 tiny crayfish pieces, and a plate full of rice. The rice overpowered the entire dish. The shrimp and grits had very well done shrimp and bland grits. A guy came over and removed my wine glass without asking if I was finished or if I would like another glass. Our waiter never once checked on us while we were eating to see if we needed anything or how our dinner was. After someone else clears our plates without asking, our waiter comes over and says he guesses we are ready for dessert so what did we want. He brought the desserts out and let's say they didn't look very appetizing. The bread pudding did not look appealing but it tasted ok. The key lime pie crust was greasy and awful tasting. The filling itself was ok but didn't have much of a key lime taste to it. The waiter brings over our check and lays it on my husband's napkin and walks off. We hadn't asked for the check yet and he surely didn't ask if we wanted anything else before he dropped it off. We are excellent tippers as I used to wait tables myself and my husband worked in the restaurant industry. Our waiter did not deserve a tip of any kind other than to find another industry to work in as food service is not for him. We felt rushed the entire time and we were in and out of the restaurant in less than an hour. The area we sat in had 6 tables total and all but 1 of those tables was still occupied with people that were not eating or drinking when we left. They had already finished their dinner and drinks and a couple tables even had their to go boxes on the table. We were looking for a nice, relaxed dinner and that certainly didn't happen. We don't plan on returning that is for sure. We received better service from the valet attendant than we did in the restaurant itself. The guy ran over and got our car right away because he said he didn't want me to stand out in the cold for to long. He was very kind and considerate and was well tipped. There are so many great restaurants in Charlotte but unfortunately this is no longer one of them!

This place is pretty good.  Cajun food is my favorite, so I'm a pretty harsh critic when it comes down to it. 

I started off with a BBQ shrimp appetizer, which had a great flavor, but the shrimp was a bit overcooked.  I also got a cup of gumbo, which I was very unimpressed with. Something was off with the flavor. Maybe I caught a bad batch of it, but I won't be ordering that again.  

For my dinner I had the etouffee trio with crawfish, chicken, and shrimp.  The chicken was amazing.  Perhaps the best I have ever had.  It was very tender and the flavor was awesome.  The shrimp and crawfish were pretty darn good too.  I also tried some of the blackened catfish, which was cooked perfectly, but the seasoning on it was nothing special.  Luckily they had two of my favorite beers to wash it down with, Abita Golden and Purple Haze.  

I like how the restaurant is laid out.  It has a nice ambiance to it, and looks great both inside and out.  The prices are a little expensive, but you do get a good amount of food, so I would say overall it's worth it.  If I had the option, I would have given it a 4.5 / 5 rating, but they definitely have some things to improve upon if they want to reach 5/5.

The Sunday brunch menu offers reasonably priced items that are so delicious. We had some beignets (so good) and the crab cake eggs Benedict (amazing). 

TIP: When making your reservations ask to be seated upstairs or away from the downstairs bathroom. We were seated near the downstairs bathroom and kitchen entrance. My chair kept getting hit by servers and guests who were walking to the kitchen and/or bathroom. A small change that could probably make a big difference in your experience.

Interesting concept, having a restaurant in a kind of living family house, but that is common for the upscale Elisabeth area in Charlotte. Very good food, not quite Southern as in Louisiana but very close. Very friendly staff and quick service. Had to visist my hometown to go there, shame on me since I lived 5 years in Charlotte and never went eating there. We had a great time and can recommend it to everyone!

My husband has been trying to get me to go for ages. I made reservations for roof top but as the weather was unpredictable we were seated upstairs. We had a great time, the live music was great, food delicious and service was excellent! Would definitely recommend a visit!

Food was very tasty. Service was timely. The Restautant is so loud you can't hear yourself think let alone carry on a conversation. If Cajun food is your goal, it's perfect. If you are looking for social interaction with friends, you will be disappointed.
BBQ shrimp app was amazing!  Our first time and requested upstairs to hear the jazz band. Great experience and food was true to the cajun experience.

In Charlotte for a quick business trip, I found this gem on Yelp. My waitress Hanna seemed genuinely excited that this was my first time there and recommended several dishes, all of which didn't disappoint. Started with the BBQ shrimp, spicy yet tasty; sop the sauce with the bread. Next up, blackened pork tenderloin with fried plantains. 3 good sized medallions with an interesting bean chorizo sauce. The plaintains were battered with cornmeal and were very good. I also asked for a single filet of the salt and pepper catfish, which was very good also. Ended the meal with key lime pie. Overall the dining experience went well. I would come back next time in town to try other menu items.

I have been to Cajun Queen Twice and have enjoyed my meal both times. The portions are enough for two to share. I ordered the fried catfish last night and got two big pieces of fish which was way more than I expected. It was well seasoned with a lightly fried coating which didn't flake. My husband order a dish (Diane something) which consisted of crawfish, shrimp, and chicken) which was amazing. We both had plenty of leftovers to go. Our server Justin was on point and very attentive. I usually don't remember names but he was awesome. I love the quaintness of this place. The Groupon deal is awesome. Not sure how long they plan on running this deal but I would go back despite the deal.

Lovely atmosphere, staff and food. Beau, our waiter, was extremely knowledgable about the menu and the wine. I suggest what Beau suggested...the pork medallions with pineapple pico and plantains. Amazing!  We sat on the upstairs patio and had a perfect evening.  Can't wait to eat there when we visit Charlotte again!!

Went there for the 1st time- heard its like new orleans food. Nice and spicy which im not a huge fan of spicy but i tried their chicken diane and ate the whole thing! Good portion for price!!!

Sat in the sunroom with only a few tables filled was a great atmosphere with a few friends. they have their own parking lot so its easy access. Theyre always on groupon too!

i looked over their Living Social coupon. It said good only Sunday-Thursday, which was fine because I was going on Sunday. I read the fine print, and it said the usual jargon, but that it was excluded on Fat Tuesday, and Valentine's Day. Since today is neither of those days, I bought the coupon, and drove the 30  minutes to the restaurant. I get there and there is a huge sign on the door say they won't be taking the coupons during Restaurant Week, which is still going on. Would have been nice had they listed that on the actual Living Social coupon, as it only said just Fat Tuesday and Valentine's Day. I didn't even bother going on. I was so annoyed about the lack of communication on the actual LivingSocial form I just requested a refund.

I love the cajun queen! It is in my top 10 faves in Charlotte. The service is not always the best but the food more than makes up for it! It can be a little pricey but the portions are a good size and full of seafood!

My husband and I went here for dinner on a Thursday night. Atmosphere was nice. Nice and cozy.  Although, It was very dark, so dark that I had to use the flashlight on my phone to see the menu. The band was a disappointment. Pretty dull much older gentleman playing. The fried green tomatoes were delicious. The fried catfish and the red beans and rice were bland and lacked seasoning. My husband had the blackened catfish which was very good. Service was excellent. Overall it was just an ok experience. We probably wouldn't go back

Went here for our anniversary. The atmosphere was nice. I ordered the chef's special cajun pasta and was pleased by the large portion. Making a reservation as the place was really crowded on a Thursday evening. I recommend eating here to people who enjoy creole food.

Visiting Charlotte from Los Angeles while husband is in town for business. 

The good: The upstairs dining room has a live band and lively atmosphere. People are talking loud and enjoying themselves. Have a drink before your dinner comes for an even better time. We each had a glass of wine. The sauce from the barbeque shrimp was the best part of our meal. Not the shrimp, the sauce with bread dipped in.

The bad: Food is mediocre. We had the Cajun popcorn, which is fried crawfish that comes out partially covered in a remoulade sauce. Good, but on the salty side. Tell them to put the sauce on the side when you order so you can dip instead. The sauce took away from the dish and the ones that were smothered in the sauce remained on the place, uneaten. We each had a cup of seafood gumbo, There is no meat other than seafood in the gumbo (yay!) but it was bland and the rice seemed undercooked and flavorless. We ordered a large order of the barbeque shrimp and I got a side order of grits. The sauce in the barbeque shrimp was spicy and delicious; dip the bread from your bread basket in this tasty broth. The shrimp were on the small and limp side; not memorable at all as far as texture. 

The final insult: the grits. Grits are a favorite food of mine. I'm a southern girl and make real deal, bomb-azz grits at home. The grits at Cajun Queen were those instant, "add boiling water to reconstitute," grits. Culinary blasphemy.

I will not return. If you want real grits, go to Mert's Heart and Soul.

Ambiance, atmosphere, service, food... all exceeded expectations. The complimentary valet also add a nice touch. Making reservations on an early Friday evening should allow you to capture the experience at its best. ciao!

It has an amazing atmosphere and very unique. Our server was very polite and was on top of everything, even the hostess was great she found us seats upstairs near the live music and the food was everything I expected and more. It makes you feel like New Orleans in Charlotte...we're already planning our next dinner here, I definitely recommend the restaurant as a must visit

One of my all-time favorite restaurants! Everything is always so good, staff is friendly and service is great! I usually order the barbecue shrimp dinner and my husband gets the étouffée. We have ordered other things off the menu and were not disappointed, but there is just something about our normal order that we can't get enough of. We have tried other cajun restaurants in Charlotte and they pale in comparison to the Queen. Don't waste your time going anywhere else!
My wife and I always have a wonderful time at the Queen.  This time we took a friend of mine from Indy out for dinner and as usual the meal and sevice shined.
Mmmmm, great ambiance, band and food.  We especially loved the BBQ shrimp. Our server told us we had to order and then brought out extra bed to mop up the amazing sauce. Will go again and again!

I'd probably give 3 1/2 if I could but I'm going to give 4 stars for excellent service... love the live music every night, great drinks, outdoor patio.  I like the old house. It feels like going over an old family members house but better. 
The food was good overall.  Appetizers Bbq shrimp sauce is great with bread and the Crawfish ceviche was flavorful and spicy!  So when my gumbo came it tasted blah to me. Not very flavorful.  So my dad ate it and liked it. My shrimp and grits were ok but the shrimp was bland and the skin on my sausage was hard. My sister had the dish several times before and said it didn't taste the same. Liked the grits though. tasted the blackened catfish... moist and delicious. Tasty desserts, but nothing to write home about. I do think it's a bit overpriced. 

The restroom paper towel machine was broken. And no other dryer or towels available. I know is out of their control but maybe need a backup.  It's quite annoying.

Great place for appetizers, live jazz and drinks.

The food was delish. The service was great. Complementary valet parking.The app crawfish bbq was my favorite.  I would give it 5 stars if there was not so much sauce on the entree. My husband got a porkchop and i got fish and both were just drenched in sauce. Overall delish and i will be back. wine and beer selection wasn't amazing but good enough to please the masses.

The Cajun Queen is probably one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. Their crawfish etoufee is amazing, and their creole shrimp/ chicken is mouth-watering! I also love going their when they have live music.

I travel to Charlotte frequent for business and must say that all of my Business Associates and I truly enjoy the food at the Cajun Queen.  The craw-fish scampi and barbeque shrimp are excellent as starters.  The daily specials are usually phenominal.  I recently had the mahi special which I have ordered on multiple occasions.  The Duck special is also great...well prepared and very flavorful.   The environment is somewhat noisy at times and with the tight spacing can be a distraction.  I would highly recommend a visit if you are in town as I don't believe that you would be disappointed.  Enjoy
MB
My first time. Good good good atmosphere but I only gave 4 stars because the live Jazz band only plays 10 mins at a time and then takes 20 to 30 min breaks constantly.

Me and my friend went here for her birthday weekend and it was great. I was a little hesitant because I'm not real big on spicy/cajun food, but surprisingly I enjoyed everything about this place. The place is a house turned into a restaurant and has that cool New Orleans french quarter feel. 

The fried pickles are AMAZING!! The Diamond watch out!! I had the blackened catfish with mashed potatoes and it was delicious. I was shocked that I had two pieces of fish as well which was even better. My friend had étouffée and she enjoyed her meal as well. I will definitely be back here again for some more yummy spices!!

Poor showing from the the Cajun Queen last night.  Haven't been in several years, and I won't return after last night.  Service was good, food and drinks where unacceptable. 

Gumbo caused indigestion for all a that indulged. Entrees looked like they had fallen victim to severe budget cuts. 

Ordered call brand liquor, would bet I received well liquor. 

Entertainment dollars could be better spent dining elsewhere.

First visit to a Cajun Queen, definitely not the last. It was restaurant week and they had a great deal on their meals. I had the gumbo, blackened tilapia and bread pudding. Oh and a glass of Chardonnay...all for $30. Soooo good! My husband had the shrimp and grits the Nate as of tilapia. The atmosphere was great. After the meal we went up to the bar. If you want strong margaritas, you will definitely get it. I'm looking forward to our next visit.

OMG -  love love love this place!  Been to CQ a minimum of 15x.  Never had a bad experience.  Staff, music, and food is great!  The blackened catfish in ridiculously good!!
And the fried green tomatoes are a great starter!

Awesome, delicious food!  My favorite place to eat when I have the money.  Love the cajun popcorn and the dinner specials.  If they ever have the mahi-mahi as a special, get that! So good, I wanted to cry! Also ask your server about the ghost.  I heard some cool stories!

Nothing fancy, just good food and good service, great value.

I had the crawfish etouffee.  Deep flavor, good portion; chased with a Louisiana craft beer.  It hit the spot.

I also had a crawfish scampi that was a little too garlicky for me, but I ate it with a dinner roll and it was fine.  I was able to order a Caesar salad for just $3.  It was simple, but pretty good.

The restaurant itself looks like someone's house, and you do get a southern neighborhood feel when you step in.  

Evidently they have live jazz some evenings, so if I'm back in town I'll check out.

We went for brunch. Service was a little slow and food was just okay. I ordered shrimp and grits which was okay and my partner ordered French toast which was tasty but burned a little on edges and needed a little more sauce.

I would absolutely recommend anyone wanting to visit to make prior reservations. It's an intimate environment set up in a converted home.  We ordered appetizers consisting of cajun popcorn((crawfish tails), fried green tomatoes, and Nawlins BBQ shrimp. They all were delicious! The BBQ shrimp was the all time best!  The sauce that they are made in is great for dipping the complimentary rolls into.  It's spicy but not too hot even though we typically enjoy hot and spicy food.  Entrees... Fried Catfish and red beans and rice were the only downfalls. The red beans and rice lacked seasoning. The catfish was not cooked crispy. It was extremely wet and flimsy. I returned it and it came out hot and crispy! Crawfish, shrimp, chicken Diane was amazing and Extremely flavorful!  All in all I will be visiting this restaurant again when in Charlotte.

Well.i was highly disappointed, because I heard such good things.  I've spent years in new Orleans,and this place was far from being anything like it, in the food sense.I had the seafood gumbo, and it was like someone dumped the rosemary spice box in it. Terrible.. service was good except, just got the gumbo and the main course showed up 1 minute later. So of course, I refused it. So after 15 minutes under the heat lamp..you get the picture. .the etouffe was bland anyway. Trying cajun yard dog next. . If that's a bust, so much for cajun in charlotte.

This is one of our favorite spots.  HIGHLY recommend the fish specials and the crawfish scampi.  My husband has also enjoyed the blackened ribeye and the pork.  Note, however, that some things are sub-par, namely: the dinner salad, the gumbo and the bread.  While dinner ranks as outstanding in my opinion, these items are surprisingly unsatisfying.  Wine list could be better, too.

Wow - definitely wanted to like this spot, but it was an incredible disappointment.  The popcorn crawfish was way off - over-breaded with a bit of a funky taste (and I generally love crawfish), although the shrimp appetizer was decent.

My friend ordered the Shrimp Scampi despite my objections, and paid the price.  It was completely bland.  Even the steamed broccoli was poorly cooked.  My 4 way Étouffée was a little above average.  We finished with the bread pudding, which was also unexceptional.

To top it off, our service was efficient, but certainly not friendly.  With tip, our bill was $95, and a poor value.
Excellent food, impeccable service as always. One of our favorite places. We took friends for their first time and they raved about it. Said it was rhe best restaurant they'd been to in Charlotte!

It's Sunday, upstairs and the 7th St Gator band is playing. Sounds and feels like you are in New Orleans. 
Three for brunch and we decided to split all three entrees. Wait, let's get some beignets. Perfect and they have some strawberry dunking sauce that is perfect. 
We order French Toast, Shrimp and Grits and Egg Benedict over crab cakes. The Chef crushed it. Literally, each dish was fantastic. But watch out for the French Toast. Simply the best I have ever had. Fresh Texas Toast made that morning with this bananas foster maple syrup glaze. Each bite made you call for more. You can't go wrong with either of the three dishes but you have to get the French Toast. 
Also, the waiter offered great service and made the experience that much more enjoyable.

20 years since last visit. I liked the crawfish appetizer and fried green tomatoes. I should've ordered something other than Étouffée for an entree. I have never had it before. Not for me. 
In the past the more mainstream Cajun dishes have been fantastic. 
My kids are too young to appreciate it so will probably go elsewhere when we are out. Great atomosphere!

Enjoyed the creole with chicken. Great spices snd flavors used in dish. Waiter was very knowledgeable and helped with picking the right entree especially it being first time eating Cajun food.  Ended our meal with the toll house cookie pie...YUM!

The food was incredible, I got blackened catfish and my fiance got Diane with chicken, shrimp and crawfish and a side of andouille sausage and everything was great. The "steamed" broccoli on my plate was more dipped in hot water and still raw but it still tasted great. We also both got desserts, the key lime pie (my all time favorite dessert) and that was incredible and the bourbon pecan pie, which my fiance said was also amazing and was served warm. The reason for 3 stars is the service. Our waiter, Brandon, acted like he couldn't care less that we were there, just kinda threw the food down and walked away, checked on us only once and honestly just didn't even try to offer good service. The bus boy who refilled water, brought bread and took our plates came around more often than he did. However, when a group of older people came in he was so attentive and pointed out everything on the menu to them, went over where the seafood was from and took all the time in the world as he probably assumed they had more money than we did. Needless to say he got the tip that he earned for the service he gave us. I would absolutely go back for the food, just hope I would get a different server.

The good was good. We started with the Wash Day Blues, which was excellent!  The gumbo was a disappointment. I'm not sure if they ran out and had to make another batch real quick. The veggies were on the crunchy side which was surprising. We had the duck breast and the shrink and grits for our entrees. Both were quiet tasty.
Great atmosphere!  Located inside a Victorian house with outside upped deck.  Live music and tasty food!!

We were looking forward to eating at Cajun Queen. We had heard good things about it. We had a reservation. Upon arrival, we did not feel welcome. We were seated very close to the entrance. It was noisy and dark. The waiter seemed very busy and did not have much time for us. We were unimpressed by the food: there was nothing special. We used to eat at "Yats" and "Gumbo a Go Go" while living in Indiana and those 2 cajun/creole restaurants were a lot cheaper and the food was a lot better. We felt going to Cajun Queen was a complete waste of our time and money.
Cajun Queen was great.  It is overpriced for cajun food, but the food was great.  I had mahi mahi with some crawfish sauce and vegetables over it.  Excellent!

This was my first visit to the Cajun Queen. It will not be my last. The service was excellent and the food was superb. I loved the ambiance as I enjoyed my meal by the fireplace. 
The bread pudding was "The Bomb". That alone is worht the trip back to the Cajun Queen.

Two thumbs up!!!!!!!

Took my hubby (whose parents and grandparents all grew up in Mississippi, super close to Louisiana) to the Cajun Queen for some cajun food! 

We entered into the foyer (lobby) and were greeted by two cheerful hostesses. They told us it would be about 15 minutes for a table and steered us upstairs to the bar while we waited for our table. We ordered two drinks and were quickly called for our table. We were seated in the small dining room to the right of the foyer. The rooms are all full of dark furniture, paintings, and dark wood. There were many people seated on the downstairs patio, and it looked to have been cooler than the small (packed) dining room. However, the cocktails we ordered when we were seated at our table quickly cooled us off. 

We started our dinner with the fried green tomato appetizer. The tomatoes were artfully displayed with a creamy sauce. The sauce, in combination with the tomatoes, was fabulous! Both dinners came with our choice of gumbo or salad. The waiter highly suggested the gumbo, and it was really good. For entrees we ordered cajun shrimp and grits and crawfish etouffee. Both dinners were full of flavor and were large in size. 

The upstairs dining room, adjacent to the bar, features live jazz music 7 nights a week. Definitely worth a listen while seated at the bar, or eating in that dining room. 

Be sure and pick up some mardi gras beads in the front foyer, and have a sit on the front porch while you let your delicious dinner settle. Grab a photo with the giant queen gator in the front yard as a souvenir!

Disappointing dinner at Cajun Queen.  Been dining at Cajun Queen for many years and wanted to enjoy Mother's Day meal at this restaurant.  Unfortunately, the food was quite bland.  The fried oysters were cold in the middle.  My favorite New Orleans Platter lacked flavor.  The restaurant was not crowded so they have no excuse for such bad food.  No one at my table had a delicious meal.  
The server was not too good either.
Normally enjoy this place...but not too much on this visit.

This place is different. Its not the best food I've had in the world, nor is it the worst. I had the creole. It wasn't bad, but the only option to give the meal a kick of spice was texas pete or their own special jalapeno sauce. The service didn't exist, as that I ate at the bar. 

The parking is badly setup. The parking lot is small, and forces people to park at other businesses or on the side of the street.

One of our favorite restaurants in Charlotte.  Food is excellent.  Sometimes it gets a bit loud inside when dining (reason for 4 stars not 5), so we ask for outside patio seating, weather permitting.  Service always good, food always excellent.  I have dined there dozens of times and never had a bad meal.  Highly recommend.

Last night was my first time going to Cajun Queen and it was Awesome! The atmosphere ambiance was great and the food was Ah-mazzing! I ordered the Diane with chicken, shrimp, and crawfish and it was EVERYTHING! My boyfriend ordered the blackened chicken...his food was really good also. The service was great and our waiter made great recommendations for appetizers and drinks. We will definetly be back.

Tasty Entree..

First visit to the restaurant. I will most definitely be back!! The gumbo was just ok.. lack of seasoning however my entree was excellent. I had blackened chicken with andouille sausage over tortellini in a cream based sauce!!! Yummy

Fortunate enough to return during Restaurant Week. I elected to order off the special Restaurant Week menu that was a great deal for $30: wine, shrimp gumbo, blackened Mahi Mahi with crawfish & sun dried tomatoes, and key lime pie. The Mahi Mahi was huge and out of this world good. My wife ordered off the menus & went for the dinner salad, 8 oz filet mignon & veggies. Her steak was superb. Live jazz, fun place, excellent service, delicious food.
If you love cajun food, you'll love cajun queen. There is a reason they have been a hot place in Charlotte for a long time...great consistent food. I have been a customer for 17 years.

I have never been disappointed at the Cajun Queen.  The old house, renovated into a restaurant makes the experience very unique.  The food is fabulous.  I ordered the special salmon with crawfish topping and it seriously is one of the best seafood dishes I have ever had.   The rolls are hot and fresh, and the gumbo is also really tasty helping to build the appetite for the main course.   I didn't get the bread pudding this time I went, but I have had it before and it is very good.   I'm always impressed with the service and the food.

So I wanted so bad to enjoy this experience after reading all of the reviews, but I was not impressed. I guess if I preferred bland food or had never experienced authentic creole food I would have enjoyed myself or maybe not. It all started with a bad hurricane (not the storm, the thing the waitress brought out purporting to be a drink). This would be a one star review, but the fried crawfish was actually pretty tasty. Other than that my main dish was not seasoned well and they should be ashamed of themselves for using baby shrimp in $18.00 dishes. Even the rolls sucked; very dry and tasteless. Maybe I just happened to catch Cajun Queen on a bad day, but I will not be returning to find out if it gets better.

I've been to this restaurant many times! The food and service are great! I love the shrimp Diane! Previously parking was a nightmare, but they now offer complimentary valet! Definitely worth checking out!
Came here when visiting Charlotte from Philadelphia. Great food, great atmosphere and our server Bo was awesome! The Cajun pasta is amazing and the fried scallops speak for themselves!

We had 6:00 reservations on a Friday night. We arrived at 5:35 and were happy when our table was already available (holiday weekend so maybe not as crowded as a normal Friday night). We sat in the back which is a sunroom. We loved it and it seemed a little quieter than the rest of the restaurant. 

Bread- good but not spectacular. Side and Caesar salads- also decent but nothing special.  Great beer, wine, and mixed drink selection. They have a small kids menu and there were kids in the restaurant but it was more of an adult place in my mind. I don't think you can overdress because it's a nice (and pretty pricey) restaurant, but you can also come in with a nice pair of jeans. 

For appetizers our group split the BBQ shrimp and fried pickles. The shrimp was wonderful, spicy but bearable:) it was large, juicy, and cooked perfectly (not rubbery). The broth is amazing especially using it as a dip for the rolls. Fried pickles were typical fried pickles with ranch dip. Nothing unique, but still delicious.

Everyone loved their meals with the exception of one person in our party. First, the good. I ordered the special for $25- blackened tilapia over rice with a sauce of crawfish, sundried tomatoes, lemon, and artichoke. HEAVEN! Huge piece of fish (I brought 1/2 my meal home) and it melted in my mouth. The mixture of flavors was on point. 

Now, the bad. One man in our group is obsessed with steak and got the ribeye. The cut of meat was GIANT but it was pretty flavorless. It was cooked correctly but not what any of us would call worth $30. It came with a side of very dry, almost inedible, broccoli. But, it wasn't my meal (I just tried a bite!), so not knocking my review because of it. :)

The food was good. The service sucks!!! The staff is unfriendly and rude. I had a reservation for a big party and we were treated like unwanted guest. If the staff was on point including the valet parkers who were also rude then I would give it a 4 but honestly we will not be returning back!!!

Being a Louisiana native who grew up eating authentic cajun/creole dishes, I hesitated to try this. Everyone insisted so I tried it one day. I had the crawfish etoufee and it had very little flavor and it was quite runny. I didn't even finish after about 4 bites. The shrimp and grits were good. The portion sizes are great for the money.  The desert wasn't worth the time. we got it delivered through a 3rd party service and had to warm it up so maybe that was part of the problem. I'd try it again but not the etoufee.

The  Etouffe with the crawfish at the Cajun Queen is the best!  There are very few things I find myself yearning for, but the Crawfish Etouffe at the Cajun Queen s definitely one of them.  The crawfish are so succulent, and chewy, and they give you so many, that you can't help but chew on two or three in each mouthwatering bite.  I think the deliciousness is a combination of the crawfish, and this amazing rich buttery,  sauce they cover the crawfish and rice in.  Really Really good.  I also really like their fried oysters, they were fried perfectly and each oyster was big and meaty, and they gave me a ton of oysters with my order, so I was a very happy man.  Yeah baby Fried oysters and plenty of 'em, that's what I'm talking about.  The restaurant can get a little crowded on weekends, but seven  nights  a week they  do have live jazz upstairs.  The rest of the menu is decent, but if you go to the Cajun Queen make sure to try one of their special dishes,  with the Crawfish, you will be glad you did.

Went here for my wife's birthday.

Made a reservation arrived early and was seated after waiting 30 minutes after the reservation had passed. We came for the Jazz but wound up sitting in a room with no band and canned music.

The food was ok - and if we'd been seated earlier and able to actually hear the music I would give this place a 4 star review.
So authentic! Felt like we were back at Mardi Gras! What a pleasant surprise that they also had New Orleans cocktails too! So glad this Charlotte staple is still thriving!!!

Cute restaurant! 
Valet parking has a long wait sometimes but that won't stop us from coming here!
Our server was super friendly and nice and the place is pretty clean!

The chicken etoufee is so good!
Also, their in house made oreo cheesecake is the BEST cheesecake EVER!
I am drooling just thinking about it!!!

If you haven't already done so, definitely give it a try =)
Wonderful Cajun cuisine, great live jazz music, and fantastic wine selections. Such a treat for date night!

We had always loved the food at Cajun Queen, but it had been years since we went there.  It was my husband's birthday and I had a Living Social coupon so we decided it was definitely time again.  It was restaurant week also.  We ended up getting one of the restaurant week specials and it was fantastic.  I usually don't like to go during this time because, in my experience, this week has not given me a good representation of the restaurant.  Not so here....the food was excellent and plentiful, and our waiter, Taylor couldn't have been better!  This dining experience made me realize I shouldn't wait so long to come back here!

My husband and I have eaten here several times and always have a good experience. This time, I ordered Shrimp Etouffee which was very good and not dry. My husband ordered the Fried Shrimp and said it was better than usual. 
In the past we have ordered the Cajan Pasta which is very good and the gumbo which is just okay.

Excellent food! The seafood was cooked to perfection, grits were creamy and tasty and the bread pudding was delightful. We dined on the level with live music and it took me back to my days in NOLA! Artwork displayed celebrated the culture and art of Cajun country. Service was laid back, but embodied the southern charm of the venue. Valet parking available and reservation made via Yelp allowed us immediate seating. I would definitely return upon any future visits to Charlotte.

We went there last night to celebrate hubby's birthday - and they made our experience really beautiful ! 
Fernando C was our server and he was very warm and friendly and always helped with our requests! We have been repeat customers and will continue to be so!

Before I went to Cajun Queen, I made sure to read a few reviews and noticed that either people loved it or had a mediocre experience. Because I had a Groupon, I decided to give it a try. Unfortunately, my experience was not the best. The waiter was attentive and my glass of water was never empty. I got the BBQ shrimp as an appetizer and it was fantastic. Full of flavor! However, my entree was bland! I got the Shrimp Diane and I had such high hopes that fell flat. If it wasn't for the Groupon, I would've been upset to have paid full price. Not sure if I will return.
My husband and I ate here. I had the Blackened Pork Tenderloin and it was great. The waiter was attentive.
Excellent crawfish ettouffe and service. An added plus was the jazz trio upstairs. We had the fixed price dinner for Restaurant Week. Perfect dinner.

Food was EVERYTHING!!! If you're looking for good cajun cuisine with tons of flavor, Look no further. This is a must try "Hidden Gem"!!!!
The BBQ SHRIMP was Amazing... be sure to get extra bread to sop up that broth. The service was great and nice cozy atmosphere. Did mention I'm in love with this place!!!

This is my first time in Charlotte and only here for a few hours omw back to NY. Recv'd a list of restaurants and we chose Cajum Queen. The food here is some of the best New Orleans based Cajun I've had outside of New Orleans itself! Absolutely worth every penny! The staff  were very nice and attentative without being annoying. Definitely want to return to Charlotte just for this place!

Great location and ambiance !! My food could have been hotter and my drink could have been
Stronger but overall a great experience.

I was looking forward to dining at the Cajun Queen from hearing about their authentic New Orleans cuisine to seeing their Best Cajun Restaurant in Charlotte status. It wasn't horrible but it wasn't memorable. I wish I could write about the service or the exact taste of the food but it was simply meh. I got the Blackened Catfish Filet with mashed taters (which I do remember and were fabulous) but I think they forgot the blackening on it or don't know what blackening means. I had to put some hot sauce on there just to get a kick.

It's a charming place however they had some live music which I personally found loud (and this moment right here is when I turned old).If you're looking for authentic New Orleans style food like I was, I would pass.

Out of town business group tried it out. The Creole was good but the Mahi mahi special was delicious with large serving.  The New Orleans beers were a nice touch.  The key lime pie was very good.  Neat atmosphere in old house.  Seating on the roof was great way to enjoy a beautiful day.
First time here, The Diane was amazing, big enough to share and very tasty!!! We got all the meats added! Superb!

I came to Cajun Queen with my team from work on Tuesday, May 22nd, 2018.  There were five of us... several of whom had never been to Cajun Queen before.

I made the reservation and was first to arrive.  The prompt and readily available complimentary valet parking is invaluable to guests in an area where parking can sometimes be a nightmare, so that's awesome!  I was seated immediately and asked if I'd like a beverage upon being seated.  The service really was snappy, well executed, and given with a big smile!

We ordered fried oysters and fried green tomatoes as apps which everyone loved, and then our meals themselves were just lovely... a perfect touch of cajun spice!  

I wish I could write more, but all I can say is that if you like Cajun Food and a live band, you can do worse than to try out this Charlotte staple.  I've come here to eat several times (often with large groups) and the service and food are always a delight!

What to say about the Cajun Queen..Hmm??? OK I got it..Its not a bad place at all, but I wasn't to impressed with the gumbo, to me it seemed like something was missing. I decide to have the Diane Chicken and it was simply amazing, it seemed to just melt it my mouth and what can i say about the fired green tomatoes( hold one second while i wipe the droll of of my mouth) lol .....The staff is great and the jazz band was awesome and played a over all large selection of music...so over all i would put them on my top ten

Ok, so the 1st time was incredible! Amazing & authentic! My first thought at least. My 2nd time, they worse than mediocre. 

·Bread & butter- ok, the meal had been the best part.

Appetizer:
·Fried Green Tomatoes- Incredible!! So delicious! These are still my favorite here! 

My meal:
·Tortellini & cream sauce plain & comes with a salad that has carrots, cabbage, romaine, cucumber w/ ranch dressing.
··1st time - Everything was so yummy! 
··2nd time - The salad was the best part! They over cooked the pasta where it was mushy. 

·French Fries- delicious!

·Grits- watery and clumpy. Terrible! 

·Garlic Mashed Potatoes- Dry and had a disgusting smoked or meat flavor to it.

My friend's order:
·Diane- her absolute favorite. Lick the bowl clean type of good!

·Shrimp etoufee- not good! Not the right seasoning, just like hot sauce was dumped into it.
The food was bland. It's hard to obtain good cajun food outside of New Orleans. I had to add old bay to my Gumbo and shrimp creole. Bread pudding was good.

I love, love, love it here! Wonderful flavors in a cozy home like setting.  The etouffee was delish mix of shrimp, chicken, and crawfish in an amazing spicy sauce.  I will definitely be come back here

Cajun Queen serves up consistent cajun food in a fun environment.  It's not exactly what you would find dining out in NOLA, and it's a bit pricey for what you get, but if you have a craving, it will fix that.

The one thing that makes Cajun Queen stand out is the rooftop dining.  It's a great place on a nice night.  There is also live jazz in the upstairs dining section.  

Word of warning - if you order a cocktail, you only need one.  ;)

We had BBQ shrimp as an appetizer and blackened catfish which was also excellent. Excellent quality food for the price.  Restaurant is on and old house, lots of character and very charming. Upstairs room with jazz band can be very loud, if you are looking for conversation, you will want to be downstairs.

We enjoyed a very nice dinner upstairs in the jazz room. The musicians are great and really add to the neighborhood ambiance of the space. The food was delicious and our server was so thoughtful and attentive.

Once upon a time in a city FAR FAR AWAY (from HOME = Chicago) a Beautiful young woman and her handsome husband were toying around on Groupon while house hunting  (The Queen City = Charlotte) and low and behold a deal for this place by the name of Cajun Queen.

Considering that we met in New Orleans, LA and my great grandmother is from the French Quarters and cooked Cajun food regularly, we have a distinctive taste bud for AMAZING to Moderate Authentic Cajun Food.

When you approach you would not expect the crowd that this place draws, I ALWAYS make a reservation on Open Table before going ALWAYS. It's a HUGE house that was transitioned into a restaurant and a HUGE house it is in order to fit that many people at tables inside for brunch, lunch and dinner. It's not that large but considering that it was a HOME it's HUGE.

The day we decided on land to build our home on we decided to go celebrate and have dinner using our Groupon. 
THIS WAS ONE OF THE BEST GROUPON DEALS WE EVER OBTAINED mainly due to the Southern feel, the TASTE, the SERVICE, etc...

I am not a FIVE star type of woman by far, I have to be pretty impressed and Cajun Queen has been VERY consistent. We've been more than 20 times now and I am just writing my review because I had to wait to ensure that there was consistency with the service, taste and feel of this place.

Cajun Queen is our GO-TO restaurant when we have family or friends visit. We like to take them somewhere that they can't go when they are back in their perspective cities that is also AMAZING and leave a memory in their mouth and mind. 

We've had everything from craw-fish appetizer, fried green tomatoes, Fried Oysters, etc.. to Entrees including the Blacken Salmon topped with craw-fish and artichoke & sun dried tomato, Shrimp & Craw-fish Diane, Chicken Diane, Gumbo, Seafood Etouffee', New Orleans Platter (Fried Everything) etc..

All items mentioned are AWESOME, there are ALWAYS deals on Groupon however we go with or without a Groupon because it's WELL WORTH IT.. Be sure to make a reservation and if you don't be prepared to wait, however the bar area is small upstairs but a good time to say the least.

Happy Eating
Parking sucks. Food is high for no reason. Downstairs tables are too close. Not a fan.

This was our first visit to this restaurant. It boasts a Louisiana  style menu. However this dish ( cajun platter) lacked any type of cajun spices. You can't serve red beans and rice with no gravy  and consider that to be a  Louisiana style dish. My husband ordered the New York strip and had to put salt on it because there was no flavor. I certainly have had better and I would not visit again. Overrated!

I wasn't quite sure what to expect from this place.  Seeing some of the patrons walking into this place dressed up and at the same time seeing a giant alligator statue sitting in a throne in the front yard.  Once inside it's actually a really nice place.  The service is great, the waitresses are very friendly and attentive and really cared that we had a good time.  There is live music on some nights which always makes for a good time.  Looking at the other reviews, I think the food is kind of hit or miss.  I guess I was lucky with the red beans and rice, it was really good by my standards at least.

Very nicely seasoned Cajun chicken pasta but hard to taste the sausage. The cheese pasta was good. Barbecue shrimp was a bit more spicy than I have had several times in NOLA but good. Sazerac was fabulous and the best bread pudding. Just enough sauce and the edges crispy and sweet. Yum!!

Very good restaurant. 

Appetizer - BBQ shrimp just ok. 
Seafood gumbo - just ok. 
I just think there tomato based broths need a little more seasoning. 
  
Entree- Shrimp Diane very good full of  flavor.

Free valet, live jazz, nice ambiance

I absolutely love the food here. With the perfect mix of fresh, delicious cajun food and eclectic decor in an old, historic house turned restaurant, you really can't go wrong. The parking can be a pain on weekend evenings and the quarters can be quite tight, for these reasons I typically visit Cajun Queen on weekday nights. The fried oysters are my favorite - and I typically don't do fried!

BBQ shrimp...
Fried oysters...
RBR...

All brilliant.

Good food and some things are the menu are so much better than the others. The gumbo was not as good as I expected but the BBQ shrimp, shrimp and grits and fried green tomatoes were awesome. Do yourself a favor and buy the group on $25 for $40 worth of food. Nice little Cajun gem in the QC.

Had a groupon, so wasn't sure how this was going to go. Walked in on Sunday night and got pleasantly surprised with a live jazz band. The tables upstairs are very close together, but add to the close feel of the place! We ordered the gumbo to start, nice big shrimp and okra in it! Dip the bread in it, add a little hot sauce and you are set!  We split the blackened Mahi and chicken, wow! Fantastic blackened flavors, yet not charred! Flavors exploded in your mouth! Red beans and rice on the side were good also! Had to over indulge and order the pecan pie also. Came warm, way too sweet but delicious crust! Overall a fantastic date dinner!

We've been in Charlotte for about 6 months, transplanted from Long Island, and quite frankly, we're sick of chain food! We wanted something different, and that's exactly what we got at Cajun Queen.

We were seated quickly, and offered the choice between inside, inside upstairs where the live jazz was playing, or outside. (We went with outside, why not?)

Our waiter was attentive without being over bearing, and our drinks refilled without having to ask. He explained not only the specials but the "house favorites" as well.  We both chose something off the regular menu, wanting to see standards rather than one offs for our 1st visit, and we were not disappointed at all! We both enjoyed food that had flavor, and character, and didn't taste like everything else. I suppose coming from NY, we we're a bit spoiled by the variety and quantity of food choices, and it was nice to see with a little bit of poking around, it can still be found in our new home.

The food and the service were wonderful, and the prices were very reasonable for the amount and quality of the food we received. This is definitely a place we will return to, and will recommend to others.
Food was good all of us got the same dish The cajun chicken pasta. The waitstaff was on point with service and refills. Only 1 downside was the parking.

Visited today for Sunday brunch(party of 2)....Had a reservation, seated right away, were given our choice of seating area..We chose the back room(?) with all the fleur-de-lis pictures on the wall..There was a slight "odor" in the air, most likely from the mop water but soon forgot about it once the food came..Our server was Erin(correct spelling?) and he  was very good in explaining the Brunch menu,  etc..We didn't order adult beverages so I can't comment on the bar..We decided to go with the large order of the fried oysters and the barbecue shrimp and a bowl of of seafood gumbo... not  bad but nothing special...would not order in the future...But the fried oysters, WOW!! can definitely say they are some of if not the best we ever had!! Huge, perfect amount of breading, juicy and so tasty!! The barbecue shrimp were just about as good, sopped up every drop of broth with the complimentary bread(warm rolls) provided..And for dessert if you may,  Beignets  !! They looked great, and tasted just as great , still hot from the fryer with a perfect dusting of powered sugar and a strawberry compote(jam?) dipping sauce..Delicious!!  On the way out, we both used the restrooms(madame and monsieur) and both very clean ..And a big bonus, dined with a groupon..I definitely recommend the Cajun Queen and will be back, hopefully for dinner to catch the live jazz band playing there nightly..

Now Ive never been to New Orleans but I love this place!!! Its perfect for my boyfriend and I to go! We love the drinks and the free entertainment oh and the fried oysters!!! I would recommend the Hurricane Drink so good! 

The Service is always good and friendly!
A little overpriced but the food is really great! And the restaurant has a fun New Orleans feel to it. Great date place!

The vibe was just what I was looking for. Laid back but not too quiet or isolated. It said it was jazz night but maybe they left, we arrived at 9:30 & it close at 10:30. We had the BBQ Shrimp & Bayou Platter. I don't mind spicy but when I was half way through, I wasn't sure I could finish it bc my taste buds were disappearing. Spicy! The Bayou Platter was very spicy. However the waiter said we could've asked for mild spice. Overall, awesome vibe & if you can handle spicy food this is your place. 3 stars bc of the heat...no dig at the restaurant. Just a preference thing.

Food was bangin. I got the sirloin special with mashed potatoes and etoufee with just the right amount of kick. 

We requested to sit upstairs thinking we would have a nice date with some soft jazz in the background. Oh man was I wrong. The music, in combination with a table of like 20 people, made it almost impossible to commuicate. We literally texted a couple times, it was bad. Overall it was nice and I would go back, perhaps on a weeknight, and will most definitely be sitting downstairs. Enjoy!

This was my second visit. I love the atmosphere and the waiting staff is very friendly. I ordered crawfish etouffee and it was delicious. The only change that I think they should make is to have corn bread or garlic bread instead of the rolls.

This was my first time visiting Cajun Queen though it's been a staple in Charlotte for years. 

Cajun Queen is set in a cozy home located off of 7th St. While this gives great appeal, it makes for a very challenging parking situation. They offer complimentary valet. I also recommend making a reservation, as the space is small and often packed.

The shrimp étouffée was very good. Slightly under-salted but great flavor with the right amount of heat.

The service was friendly, fast and attentive. All 3 of the attributes that I seek at a quaint spot like Cajun Queen.

I absolutely love William Julius Kellam The Third!!!!! But the sloppy manager is a different story. The Swamp Water is always good, as well as, my medium ribeye!!!! #noneedforchange!#leftovermediumribeye&eggd

I'd had this place bookmarked to try for a lonnnng time! So when my friends suggested it for Restaurant Week I was obviously elated. Finally!!! 

And they did not let me down!!! It met all of my expectations and more. 

I like that their menu for Restaurant Week includes all of their classic dishes and a glass of wine! 

I decided to go with the seafood gumbo, étouffée with all three (chicken, shrimp and crawfish) and the key lime our for dessert. 

The seafood gumbo was classic. It was warm and hearty with just the right amount of spices. The étouffée was nothing short of amazing!!! I'm basically a fan of this dish for two reasons....one they are not skimpy with any of the meat selections and two it's sooo spicy! I definitely recommend sopping....(yes sopping) up some of that delicious sauce with those rolls. Yum. 

Not to be outdone the key lime pie was a great way to end the meal. 

Add to an amazing meal a live band and complimentary valet....this place is definitely worth a visit!

After reading reviews I was expecting so much better from Cajun Queen. Compared to the cooking in New Orleans every dish we had at Cajun Queen was a disappointment. We had BBQ shrimp, talapia with crawfish and etouffee. It felt that every dish had been rushed to be put together. Not enough time had been given to let the spices and flavors blend and develop. I recommend the owners concentrate more on quality rather than turning over the tables as fast as possible.
Absolute best service EVER.  The food was divine.  Atmosphere was cozy and romantic.  Good for families as well.

Friendly staff, average food, and limited parking.  I had the gumbo and shrimp and grits. My boyfriend had the blackened chicken.  
I really felt that the food needed some salt, and there was none on the table. Honestly I can make better shrimp and grits than they were serving. His chicken was very juicy.
The atmosphere is very cozy. We went on a Sunday evening not too late. It seemed to not be packed at that time. I regret not trying the bourbon pecan pie.  Thankfully we had a Groupon for half the price!

Wonderful ambiance, fantastic food, and great service. I was in Charlotte and visited Cajun Queen for dinner. There was a small wait so our party headed up to the bar and decided to eat in the bar area. While the bar was busy the bartender was very attentive and delivered great service for both our food and bar orders. This being our first visit the bartender gave some recommendations that were fantastic. The bbq shrimp and fried green tomatoes appetizers were top notch. I had the Duck special that was wonderful and full of great flavor. The bourbon bread pudding was another great choice to finish out the meal. If you are looking for great cajun food in Charlotte this is the place.
