Best restaurant I've been too in Charlotte. I ordered the New Orleans fish platter and it was out of this world. The gumbo is so flavorful too! You get what you pay for here! Awesome jazz music too! I will defiantly be going back.

My favorite cajun restaurant in the Charlotte area. Actually, this might be my favorite period. The staff and service is top notch. The food is excellent. The key lime pie.... oh my (I understand this is actually prepared by a 3rd party so credit to them and CQ for carrying it). Always a great night out and a nice date spot for the wife and I.

The Cajun Queen was excellent and the service was fantastic and the food was incredible I highly recommend this place. I had shrimp Creole and my friend had the blackened catfish both were phenomenal.

This is (I mean WAS) my first time at this establishment. I purchased a Groupon that was expiring so decided to utilize it. I made reservations for myself, mom & son. Once we were seated, the server proceeded to tell us about the restaurant week menu. I advised that I had a Groupon and was not interested in the special. Well low & behold, I could not use my Groupon. I told the server the Groupon was expiring, thus the reason why we were there. Not my issue that it was during restaurant week. He asked me if I wanted him to speak to the manager about it & I stated "yes". He returns & informs me that the manager stated that I could use my Groupon. Great news or at least until the check arrived. Once I received the check, the amount of the Groupon ($45) is not deducted rather only $25. I inquire about this to now be told that only the amount I paid could be deducted or the manager would allow the Groupon to be extended a month...all of this after we have eaten. We drove an hour to this place trying to use the Groupon before it expired. If I was only going to receive the paid amount of the Groupon, there was not any need for us to drive this hour on a Friday afternoon in rush hour traffic. I am not sure what restaurant week is but we did not partake of the special menu being offered. In addition I would not visit a restaurant that is a permanent Groupon fixture during "restaurant week". I believe the point of restaurant week is to try out restaurants you may not normally visit due to cost but Cajun Queen is a Groupon regular that can be visited for an expensive amount anytime of the year. I patronize businesses that actually warrant my business. Unfortunately this will not be one of them.

I honestly love the Cajun Queen! From the cozy atmosphere inside (which offers the same fun and authentic feeling of any fine restaurant located on Bourbon Street), to the jazz band playing upstairs, all the way down to the blackened items listed on their menu, this place has made my trip worthwhile every time.  You can usually find a "Groupon" online before heading out which will make your visit a little lighter on the wallet -  or in my case allow for a few more drinks from their New Orleans style drink selections. That's just my two cents! i hope this review helps and I encourage you to give this big two story house with the large green gator out front a try if Cajun cooking sounds good to you.

Let me begin by saying that the food and the service here is amazing. Unfortunately we had a pretty bad experience with the valet parking and the restaurant manager.

Towards the end of our meal, I noticed one of the valet guys move my car out of the parking lot right next to the restaurant, and around 5 or so minutes later, return it back to the same spot in the same parking lot. After asking the valet why that would happen, I was told it was to move another car out of the way. When asked why the car would be driven around the block just to move it out of the way, he didn't have a good answer, especially when my car (a sports car), was the only one that was "strategically" moved.

After bringing my concerns to the restaurant manager, I was essentially told that he would have to trust that they had a good reason for moving my car. Needless to say, his answer and lack of action was very disappointing. I would expect the manager to take such matters much more seriously and at the least investigate the issue...

So if you're thinking of going here, enjoy the food but be careful with letting the valet park your car.

Needless to say.. I like it hot and I feel like Cajun Queen GETS me. There is definitely enough spice to be had here for all! My bf and I went this past weekend and I always can't believe that I don't come here more often. 

We started off with the BBQ Shrimp, which had decent-sized shrimpies swimming around in cajun tastiness and it was just enough to leave us wanting more. I had the 4-way etouffee, yes, 4-WAY ettouffee with chicken, shrimp, crawfish and sausage and it was just what the doctor ordered for my spice addiction! My man ordered the shrimp and grits and loved his so much that he ate it again at home the next night! The etouffee was obviously meaty and spicy, while the shrimp and grits were creamy and plentiful. I, of course, enjoyed my meal with a Dixie's Blackened Voodoo (spiced) lager. Spice, spice, spice!

Bonus while dining at Cajun Queen: LIVE jazz music every night of the week! If you sit  upstairs, you will have the pleasure of  eating and drinking to fun music that totally fits the Cajun cuisine. The band may be a little too loud at times to have a normal dinner conversation but this is what makes the experience fun! If you would rather a more quiet dinner, make a reservation for the downstairs area of the restaurant or for a table outside. 

Just a heads up: You may have to wait a few minutes before your table is ready for your reservation...  All the more reason to belly up to the bar while you wait. Duh. 
The service may be a bit slow as they are always busy and the servers sometimes get a tad overwhelmed. But most aren't in a hurry while enjoying what the Queen has to offer so it's never seemed to be much of a problem for me.
Unique restaurant located in a 2 story house. Food is really good. You can also visit the bar upstairs where you can to listen to live music. great place

I really enjoyed this restaurant.  The Jazz was fantastic!
Only drawback was that although we had reservations, it took about 40 minutes to get seated. We had to wait at the bar. The price for the amount of food was a little much, but it was excellent!!!  I can't wait to go back!

I've been to New Orleans many times and have experienced some great Cajun style food, so I have pretty high standards.  For the most part, from what I've ordered, CQ does a decent job.  I've been twice and ordered the Étouffée both times because it's very good.  It's got the perfect amount of spice that pairs well with an ice cold Abita.  The BBQ shrimp is a great app as well.  It's not so much about the shrimp as it is the sauce you dip the bread in.  Delicious.  My girlfriend was hit and miss with her entrees in the 2 times we've been.  The shrimp Diane was just OK.  It's a lighter consistency than the Étouffée and doesn't have the kick I look for when I'm in the mood for Cajun.  The shrimp and grits weren't good at all.  The grits were bland and the blackened shrimp didn't hit the mark.

Overall, I enjoy coming here, but the prices are a little high in my opinion.  They have a Groupon & Living Social pretty much all the time, so don't forget to grab one before you go!

VERY rarely do my boyfriend and I leave dinner completely satisfied, elated and already planning our next trip. Well, Cajun Queen happened to be one of those meals.

Neither of us eat cajun/creole very often so we were a little hesitant at first. After holding on to a Groupon for a few weeks we finally made the trip...what on earth took us so long?!

One step through the doors and you're immediately transported to a raucous, lively setting reminiscent of 1980's New Orleans. Tables are tightly packed; patrons share drinks and laughs; and sounds of jazz echo from upstairs. The walls are adorned by "Nawlins" inspired artwork and an appropriate purple, gold and green palette is interwoven throughout the house.

The Gumbo was the only thing that I wasn't completely impressed with. It had good flavor and an ample helping of shrimp but I felt it was missing something. The consistency was thinner and more watered down than I anticipated. Keep in mind I am no cajun aficionado.

The boyfriend ordered the pasta special: Two blackened chicken breasts over a heaping portion of tortellini in a spicy pesto cream sauce with peppers, Andouille sausage, peppers, and artichokes. WOWEE MAMA. This was one of the most delicious meals (yes, it wasn't even my meal) that I've had in a while.

My étouffée was delicious as well, thought admittedly, not quite as impressive as the pasta dish. It did kick some heat but it was good flavorful spice heat. Large portions seemed to be the theme of night and despite force-feeding ourselves to the point of pain, we both managed to leave with decent-sized leftovers.

From the camaraderie and excellent service to the food and drinks...everything seemed to be perfect and I cannot wait to return!

My boyfriend and I went to Cajun Queen for the first time last week for our anniversary dinner. We thoroughly enjoyed our appetizer (Cajun Popcorn) and entrees (Fried Catfish with broccoli and mashed potatoes). The service was good, but not great. The wine was delicious. They have live music in the upstairs room every night. The music was nice and not too loud. We will go back
Food good, manager was very much lacking in people skills and customer service. Will not be back. Too many places in CLT where you can get both

My boyfriend and I ate at Cajun Queen last Friday night . We had 7:30 dinner reservations. We pulled up and they had a valet service - nice touch! Parking can be very difficult over there. We were seated immediately at a very nice table next to a window. I ordered the Diane and my boyfriend got the Etouffe. Both were very good! My only complaint was, we felt incredibly rushed. We planned on having a nice, relaxing dinner. From the time we walked in the door to the moment our food came out, it was 14 minutes. A little too quick for me. I felt like our waiter kept trying to rush us out the door. We were finished with dinner (drinks, entree and dessert) in less than an hour. For the amount of money we spent, I am disappointed in their service, or at least the service of our particular waiter.
This is my second time at Cajun Queen. Services were much better than last time, but I got a dirty fork. Four stars for food, not for the rest.

Great place! I've never been to New Orleans, but my dad has and he is a huge fan of Cajun food, so I thought it would be nice to take him to brunch there. We were all really impressed. My mom and I had the Creole shrimp and grits and my dad had biscuits and gravy. We also got an order of beignets. The beignets are a definite must! 
The Cajun Queen is a great brunch place, we will definitely be back for dinner some time.

Let me start off by saying, I REALLY wanted to like this place. I have heard countless rave reviews. Of course, I wasn't expecting it to compare to my food experiences in Louisiana but I was expecting something. My mother and I ventured here on Saturday for dinner and we were both really disappointed. 

Fried green tomatoes- 2/5 The breading was really bland and they were topped with a gallon of sauce. They were very unappetizing. I prefer the ones I make at home.

Fried oysters app- really good and the only thing I enjoyed. I would highly recommend. 

Salads- Truly out of the bag salad mix. They could have added some tomato or something to liven it up. The blue cheese dressing was good though.

Crawfish etoufee- It was very average with way too much rice.

Service, however, was phenomenal. We simply didn't enjoy most of our food. I really wouldn't even go back to try it again.

Great place! Had a reservation for 6:30 and was seated at 6:30.  Location is an old house, very cute.  Had the fried oysters and fried crawfish tails as appetizers and both were delicious. The peach martini was great as well.  My husband had the blackened chicken and catfish along with the gumbo and he loved all of it.  I had the shrimp creole and it was tasty and filled me up so I had to take the rest to go.  I would recommend this restaurant for an awesome date night!

Food was just ok. I have eaten here in the past and it was much better. I had the blackened catfish and fried green tomatoes. The tomatoes were a bit hard but the catfish was great. My husband had the gumbo and etoufee 3 ways. Neither of them had good flavor or seasoning. Not sure if I would give this one another try or not. We may just have to make a trip to NOLA instead.

Had a tasty dinner here this evening. Average ambience, food came out quickly. It was tasty but not out of this world. Parking was a little annoying, required use of the valet (though it was "free"). Will be back.
Edit: we came back again. This visit was not as well. Service was sorely lacking. Food was decent. 

** dont waste your money coming here without a groupon. it's totally not worth it at full price!**
Cajun Queen was a great choice. Great atmosphere, live jazz. I had Salmon topped with shrimp, great portions. I left stuffed. Bread pudding was amazing, I will be returning soon.

Even without a Groupon I would visit Cajun Queen! The food is a taste of New Orleans, right here in the Queen City. The ambiance of this restaurant reminds me of the charm of the French Quarter.  A live jazz band plays during the week and adds that perfect touch to a wonderful dining experience. I always say I'm going to try something different, but I usually order "Three Way Diane": chicken breast, shrimp and crawfish sauteed with mushrooms, garlic, green, onions, and parsley served over a bed of rice. This dish has a hint of spice to complement the dish. The portion is perfect and depending on my mood, I have some to bring home or I eat every morsel.  Other visits to CQ, I've ordered the BBQ shrimp, shrimp etouffee and the fish of the day. I've just never written a review. The gumbo is good, but on my last visit I felt that it was missing something...just couldn't put my taste buds on it.

So thankful we made reservations here, folks were waiting at least 35 plus on a Saturday. :) Hostesses were nice. We really appreciated the staff being trained properly. Our server was personable, knowledgeable of the menu&gave good recommendations. He also did not hover. Cool and he got an A from us. We really enjoyed our drinks (get Planters Punch), salads, Shrimp etoufee' and Chicken Diane. We were unimpressed with BBQ shrimp's flavor. The broth was wonderful for dipping the ( cold) bread, yet the shrimp had no flavor. Maybe they can marinate the shrimp with the broth instead of just dropping them in?Also, the bread pudding was just okay. We figured the bourbon&peaches would pack a punch. The seating is tight like others point out, but manageable. Prices match well with portion sizes aka we did not feel cheated. We will definitely  come back for food&drinks only. We will then pickup some Mama R's bread pudding for dessert.

Very good food, great service, nice atmosphere. Free valet is a big plus in that neighborhood too.  I like the food at Boudreaux's a litlte better because I love their jambalaya, but Cajun Queen is very good too and a little nicer inside. A little more pricey too but on par for that part of town.

The wife has wanted to try this place for some time now, so when a living social came out, I figured that I would buy one.  Cajun Queen, like many restaurants, has fallen into the category of "why did it take me so long to try".

Our meal was a solid 4 star experience, and it started with great service. Both my bowl of seafood gumbo and crawfish etoufee were full of cajun flavor and spicy, just like I was looking for. The wife got some shrimp as an app and they came with another great spicy sauce.  For her main, it was her standard blackened catfish, which she thoroughly enjoyed, but took half of it home due to the hugeness of the portion. Not being a fan of catfish, I didn't taste it, but rather focused on finishing every last bit of my etoufee.

Cajun Queen is definitely a little taste of New Orleans in Charlotte, and we shall return again soon.

Cajun Queen is so good! Basically everything they have on the menu is filled with flavor!! The atmosphere is relaxing and the food is definitely well worth the price for good Cajun food. I recommend this place to everyone!

Cajun Queen wasn't awful, but it wasn't great either. If you've been to New Orleans and sampled the fare, then you will be disappointed with the cuisine. While not on par with New Orleans, it's not without charm. Still, not the Big Easy. 

For scale: 1- ingesting Old Bay seasoning, 
2 - a box of Zatarain's, 4 - Cajun Queen, 
10 - New Orleans.

The service was great, but we could tell our waitress was overworked even with the servers assistants refilling waters and removing finished plates. 

Everything arrived lukewarm; gumbo, the "all 3" (crawfish, shrimp, and chicken) étouffée, and even the broccoli side. And although the étouffée cautioned, "Spicy!," it was tame. 

One winning aspect was the Sazerac cocktail, and New Orleans beer on the menu (Abita). 

We'd go again for drinks.

Me: "Where do I PARK?! The salon next door is closed, can I park there?"
Hostess: "No, you'll still get towed even though they're closed."
Me: "Hmm, I guess I'll park somewhere in the streets" (circles neighborhood 3 times)
Me: "Where else can I park?
Hostess: "We have valet"
-__________________-

Me: "Sorry, but I ordered the Diane with Crawfish, not chicken"
Waitress: "Sorry about that. Did you want me to take that back?"
Me: "Umm.. I'm kind of starving."
Waitress: "Let me go see who's fault it is."
(..................)
(Waitress comes back)
Waitress: "I'm not sure how that happened"
-__________________- x2

I'm not a fan. Let be backtrack a bit. I used to LOVE Cajun Queen. 5 stars without a doubt. Over the years, the quality of the food and service has significantly decreased while the prices have risen. I've gone back maybe 3 or 4 times in hopes that each time was just a bad day.. no luck. I think I'll stick to Cajun Yard Dog for my Cajun needs.

Wow, I can't believe that I haven't written a review of the Cajun Queen before!  I guess because it is such a "Charlotte Institution" that I just imagined I would have written about it before!  Anyhow, this is one of my fav places to go when we actually leave the "Ballantyne Bubble".  

We recently purchased a Groupon and went to meet some friends there for dinner.  While I love saving the $$ associated with groupon-type specials, I really dread going to the restaurant when I know that they are going to be swamped with other customers who are also taking advantage of the savings.  It seems that most restaurants do not properly prepare for the increase in business that will result from offering the coupons.  Many times, we have noticed that there is not enough staff to handle the increased number of customers -- so the level of service and also the quality of the food suffers. But enough of that tangent...back to the Cajun Queen...

Since there were going to be 6 of us, we made a reservation.  David and I arrived before the rest of our party, so we went upstairs to the bar while we waited. The bar was pretty full and I must say, the service in the bar area suffered because of it. It took a while to get our beers and the bartender didn't bother offering an orange or a glass for my Blue Moon, which was disappointing. But I had my "big girl panties" on , so I got over it and just decided to try and enjoy the beer straight from the bottle sans l'orange.  

Almost immediately after getting our beers, the hostess announced over the loudspeaker that our party of 6 was being seated.  Yay, CQ for having our table ready on time!  And yay friends for not being late! :0

After being seated in a nice big corner table, we decided to order 3 appetizers for the table to share and went with the bar-b-cue shrimp, some sort of fried crawfish thing, and fried pickles. The bbq shrimp was definitely my fav of the 3.  I personally can live without fried pickles, but the other folks in our party seemed to really like them.  I am not normally a huge fan of crawfish, but this dish was really tasty.   Sadly, there were no oysters available for appetizers (although the waiter said they had a few in reserve for one of the entrees).  

For my entree, I went with the shrimp etouffee - one of my favorite dishes.  It was spot on!  David had the shrimp creole and I tasted a bite of it - it was very good as well but not as spicy as mine. (I like spicy!)   We ordered some desserts to share among the table and for some reason, ended up with 2 pieces of key lime pie and 1 of the tollhouse cookie something-or-another.  They were both good, but I wish someone at the table had ordered a bread pudding because theirs is delish! 

This would have been a 5 star review, except for the fact that there were several issues with the service thorughout our meal.  Nothing egregious, but a series of little things (mostly a lack of attention to detail) that detracted from making this a 5 star experience.  

But, all-in-all, we had a great time and everyone enjoyed their meal.  So, with another Groupon waiting to be put to good use, we will definitely be going back again soon!
This was a treat.  Loved their food and service.  The bbq shrimp was memorable.  Everyone loved our experience here.

We didn't try the food because we just wanted some wine, but it all smelled amazing and when we arrived at 4:30 we were asked if we had a reservation so I'm thinking they're usually pretty booked up! 

Service was good in the bar...definitely enjoyed our wine and the atmosphere. Great way to get that Southern feel! At 6pm their live jazz started up. I was hoping for some more lively music, but it was more easy listening which was understandable given the size of the restaurant and the close proximity of the band to diners.

This place is great!  The atmosphere is like a southern home in Louisiana.  The food was delicious; however, I give it four stars because our waiter wasn't the best.  I went with 2 of my friends (we're all under 30) and they didn't serve us the way he served the people beside us.

We first ordered the gumbo, which wasn't bad.  It wasn't as tasteful that I thought it would be.  However, using our bread with the gumbo, made it so much better.  The bread soaked up the gumbo and gave it a little bit of a buttery taste.

As for my entree, I ordered the etouffee four ways.  On the menu, it list three ways, but u can get four ways (which includes andouille sausage).  My friend ordered the shrimp etouffee. 

As close friends do, we tasted the other and we both found mine to be better because the andouille sausage gave it a little bit of a sweeter taste that mixes well with the spices.

I'd recommend this place!

FYI:  There's sometimes groupons that make it a cheap place to eat! Keep a look out!

Best Cajun place in town. The food is amazing. Right mix of heat and flavor. You will leave full but wanting more. The BBQ Shrimp is food for the soul. 
I highly recommend the Cajun Queen evenif your just passing through
#cajunqueen

The food here is phenomenal! The reason I gave them 4 stars is because our waiter needed reminded several times to bring out lemons for water. In addition, the gumbo tasted like a tomato soup with shrimp and okra added. I was not impressed with that at all! 
We started with crawfish scampi and it was super good. It has a little spice just so youM know but delicious with the bread...M y boyfriend had the pan seared duck (medium). It was cooked perfectly and the Flavors were tremendous. I had the Cajun chicken pasta and it was by far the best if ever had. Even great the next day which is hard to accomplish! I would definitely go back but do not recommend the gumbo unless you like it with a strong tomato soup flavor. I expected way more flavor after trying their various sauces but still a great experience!
PS: When a woman asks for lemons more than 3 x you're in trouble (haha).

Overall I love Cajun Queen it's usually the first place I think of to bring guests from out of town and for special events like birthdays.  The atmosphere keeps bringing me back I love sitting in this cozy house listening to the band and sipping on my dirty martini and the Mardi Gras beads just put me in a good mood.

I have had great experiences with the food and a couple just ok experiences - but I think now I know exactly what to order you can not go wrong with the appetizers the oysters are some of the best I've had and I love the crawfish scampi.  The BBQ shrimp are beyond tasty but I normally order that as my meal now it comes as an entree too. A couple of things on the menu I don't care for are the shrimp and grits if your thinking you'll be getting some southern shrimp and grits I will steer you away from this entree you will be disappointed. The gumbo was also a big disappointment to me where is the heat.

The fish specials are usually pretty good but can be bland. Stick to the dishes they are known for, etouffee, diane, creole, you'll be happy,

I have been wanting to try this place for while and happy that I finally decided to come. Very nice ambiance, we sat on the second floor where there was live jazz. We both ordered something different and loved each others meal. Our waiter was very attentive and our meals came out quick and hot. Ummm...almost forgot about the amazing Mandarin Martini I had.

We stopped by for Easter brunch however we were 15 min too late. I had the Diane shrimp which was tasty and spicy. They get a 3 from me because the portions were small and the sweet tea tastes awful!  May give this place another try based in its cool location and my friend said their fried food taste better.

Seated promptly at 5:30 right by the fireplace.  Staff friendly and helpful. Ordered fried green tomatoes. Good and the sauce on top tasty still like the ones from Tupelo Honey better. Next time will definitely try the bbq shrimp. I ordered the shrimp creole and salad my husband had the Cajun pasta and cup of gumbo.  Everything was great especially the Cajun pasta.  Next time I would skip the salad if ordering an appetizer because portions are very generous and the shrimp creole was full of shrimp. Only negative is parking. Which is pretty much non existent so make your reservations early.

So first have to disclose that I lived in New Orleans and worked in top rated restaurants.....so might be little biased.

Service was good....no issues.

Downstairs dining room.....no issues, but not memorable.

Food....well, NOT good Cajun/creole food.  Had the traditional NOLA foods.....Gumbo, Shrimp Etoufee, Red Beans/Andouille.  Gumbo was tomato based.....which if ever been to authentic restaurant in LA, never!  Shrimp in Gumbo were smallest over cooked I have ever had.  Etoufee flavor was good....they obviously used a roux.  Shrimp.....did they buy canned shrimp from WAlmart......ugh!   Beans....not cooked proper and while had heat, had no flavor.  Andouille was tough and just not good.

If you like authentic NOLA....don't go here.  If you want some NE Cajun flavored food......and can't find better......then might be worth a visit.

Why haven't we been here before?? We went for restaurant week. It was crowded and a bit noisy but I didn't mind because the food was absolutely wonderful! Out server was very knowlegeable and offered great suggestions. The food was some of the best that I have eaten in a long time. (And we eat out all of the time!) This is certainly going on our list of "go to" restaurants. The atmosphere is nice and it would be great for a date night out or girls night. Again....the food is GREAT!!

Our hotel suggested the Cajun Queen 7 years ago.  We enjoyed it so much that we
made a reservation for our first night in town and were not disappointed. We had the BBQ shrimp-hot but wonderful.  Would not have thought of dipping the bread in the sauce- until it was suggested and glad it was.   Then we had gumbo, also good and finished with chicken etouffee.  Ambience is welcoming and fun, jazz was great, staff attentive, thoroughly enjoyed  the evening.

The service is great, the food is great.  There's not really anything I can add that hasn't been said in the other reviews.

Other than:  If you don't order the beignets for brunch, you are seriously insensé.  (that's 'insane' in french.  i think.)

Try to eat here when schedule permits when in town for the race.  Had the blackened catfish for dinner as well as bbq shrimp appetizer and fried green tomatoes. Fish was plentiful and not overly spicy. Fried green tomatoes were the appetizer hit for the table.

Other dishes included salt and pepper catfish and bbq pork chop. Dessert included bread pudding and keylime pie.  Overall, another solid performance and prices are reasonable. Probably 4.5 stars.

Loved everything about this place!! The food was so delicious that days later my husband and I were still talking about it!!! The catfish was the best that I have ever had! This is hands down one of my go to restaurants! My husband loved his chicken as well! We can't say enough good things about this restaurant! Great job Cajun queen!
I love New Orleans and they're the closest thing in Charlotte. Love it!  I always get the new Orleans seafood platter.

I don't usually go for Cajun, but there's so much here that there's always something I'm "in the mood" for.  Plenty of food, so good value for the prices.  Service was fair, and probably the only thing that could be improved upon.  
Best shrimp and grits ever!!
Great atmosphere, Great food. The waiter Alex is the best at what he does. Truly had a great time!!!

He said:  Got there around 6 with no wait. Seated immediately. No Coke Zero. Fried tomatoes great, hot - roumelade tasty. Water glass never empty. BBQ shrimp good but not crazy good  nice heat to them only 6 shrimp tho.  Crawfish scampi quite spicy lots of crawfish.  Superior service - waitress knowledgeable about food - able to make recommendations. Drinks flowed. Added a star at end of meal because of service.

She said:  The restaurant is located in a neighborhood where many houses have been converted into businesses.  The statue of an alligator in front of the restaurant was sculpted from a tree.  I really wasn't sure what to expect, but boy, was I happy with what we walked into.  This restaurant was warm, inviting, and cozy.  The service was absolutely amazing.  Our glasses were always filled, as was our breadbasket.  In order to sample as much as possible, we decided to split four appetizers between us.  My favorite was the fried green tomatoes.  The remoulade sauce "made" this dish.  It was perfectly balanced and absolutely yummy!!!  If you haven't been a fan of Fried Green Tomatoes, you really should give these a try.  We also had the Cajun Fried Oysters, New Orleans B.B.Q. Shrimp, and Crawfish Scampi.  I've listed those in order of my favorites, though they were all good and I'd gladly have them all again.  This has been one of my favorite Yelp-finds, by far!!!

My husband and I decided to go on a day trip to Charlotte to see his mom since she is in town this week. I typically look at YELP for good places to eat. I was craving for some gumbo and I saw that Cajun Queen had some good reviews and I thought we should give it a try. 

I ordered Gumbo Diane with crawfish and shrimp. My husband got the shrimp and grits with salad on the side. While his mom got fried tomatoes for appetizer, 8oz filet steak, a cup of gumbo, and banana pudding. 
All three of us agreed that the food was delicious. I would highly recommend this place. 

The service was good. The facade reminds me of an old historic home, because it is in a converted house. They redesigned the interior and, with a fireplace, it feels warm and inviting. The only downside is the PARKING. We came around 12:30 pm and we had to park behind the restaurant on a side street. However, after 5 pm, there is complementary valet service.

Ok, I love this place.  Is that what you want to hear?  I really, honestly, truly love this restaurant.  "What makes this place so special?" you ask.  For me this place is the perfect marriage of great service and great food, and aren't those the very reasons we go to all these restaurants in the first place?  Service. & Food.  

The food was nothing short of pure, delectable bliss.  We (my dad and I) started with a few drinks and the New Orleans B.B.Q. Shrimp, "Sautéed with Butter, Garlic, Beer and a Variety of Cajun/Creole Spices".  It contained, 5 juicy, succulent pieces of shrimp; swimming in a small bowl of "cajun/creole spices"  for $8.95.  Very spicy + very tender = very good.  Don't forget to dip your bread in the broth!  

For the main course, my dad and I split the Shrimp Diane.  Now the Diane sauce contains, "Mushrooms, Garlic, Butter, Green Onions, Parsley and Queen's Magic Spices sautéed together. Moderately spiced and served over Rice."  They give you the option of splitting it for only $5.00 more bringing the entree price to 23.95.  Certainly not cheap by any means, but well worth the cost.  The best way to describe the taste, is to image garlic, butter, onions, and a bunch of "Queens Magic Spices" working harmoniously to perfectly marinate the shrimp with the rice keeping things from getting to sloppy.  Its Cajun food at its finest.  

At that point, things were so good we just HAD to get dessert, right??  We decided to order the pecan pie.  I mean, pick an adjective - amazing, spectacular, splendid, etc.  It was served to us warm and moist (that's what HE said - LOL), as if it was just taken out of the oven, with dab of whipped cream.

The service was on point from start to finish; from the valet to the host/hostess to the super friendly bartender upstairs.  Everyone was really kind and polite. What exactly separates the staff here from other restaurants?  Its all in the details...for example, every single person said, "be with you in one minute" or "be right with you".  No one ever ignored us, or expected us to wait until we could be helped.  My drinks (adult/H2O) were never empty. We didn't have to think/worry about parking.  There was a plethora of condiments, hot sauces, etc to satisfy even the most particular taste buds.  Bathrooms were immaculate.  They had live jazz.  ...See what I mean about the details?

I'm hooked.  I'll be back very, very soon, maybe even tomorrow!  I love this place.  There.  I said it!

Do not waste your money! The gumbo tasted like the roux had burned and there was no salt whatsoever. I ordered the blackened chicken to be safe thinking "no one can mess up blackened chicken".....I was wrong. None of the food (including the blackened chicken) were seasoned with salt and pepper. This was the most bland, overpriced food I'd ever had in the city. I ordered my toddler the chicken strip little gators meal. The fries were the best thing out of the entire meal. The service was as also dry and not very friendly or inviting from the hostess to the waiter, Brandon. Geez, I know it's a Tuesday night (we arrived at 5:30) but at least show some enthusiasm as I arrive to spend a whopping $123 (4 entrees, 4 alcoholic bevs, 1 kids meal) on a below average meal. It would've been more had we been charged for the uneaten cup of gumbo.

One word: Flavor.

I snagged a few Groupons for this place after reading other Yelp reviews, and I was not disappointed. The atmosphere is charming (even slightly upscale, in my opinion), the portions filling, and the food spicy and fresh.

I ordered the etouffée with chicken, shrimp, and crawfish. It was as delicious and mouth-scorchingly savory as I had hoped. (Warning: If you don't like a satisfying tongue burn, don't order the etouffée!) Most noteworthy of all, the chicken was fall-apart tender. Yum, yum, and more yum. My boyfriend ordered the blackened catfish by recommendation of the waiter, and it was just as tender and flavorful as my dish. Our waiter was also very polite. Seriously, I'm wondering if there's a way you can even go wrong at this place.

One thing: The parking is dodgy. Spots will run out, and you may get towed if you park in an adjacent lot.
I had the fried green tomatoes and chicken shrimp and crawfish etouffee. DELISH!!! I've had authentic Louisiana dishes many times before. This is it! Will come back.

We sat upstairs so we could hear the band, that was ok. What I loved was the atmosphere it reminded me of a spot in Brooklyn. The food was excellent I had the shrimp and grits, and the pumpkin cheesecake "LOVED IT".  We would definitely come back.

This was our umpteenth visit to the "Queen" but brought first timer friends. It is Queens Table Week and therefore the service, while efficient, was hurried. We all felt a bit pushed. 

Being a big fan of the Crawfish Etouffee my choice was easily made. We each ordered a different entree and seemed pleased with our choices. Did I mention the service was swift? We could have finished our meal in an hour flat. Our server assumed, correctly, that we were ordering from the special menu and removed the regular menu because "you won't be needing these". If you want return Customers you may want to allow sufficient time to peruse the regular menu to see what other choices are available. 

Food was good, as always, but wouldn't recommend visiting during this promo week. My usual rating is 4 's but not this visit. 
Sorry got to run.............
Best Chicken Diane ever. Great staff, service and atmosphere....and the band! Awesome jazz band!

This was my first time trying this particular restaurant.  I've visited New Orleans quite a few times, and was excited to get the opportunity to go there.  The atmosphere had a very intimate setting. However, I was looking forward to their catfish.  When the waiter stated that they ran out 10 minutes before we got there, we had to pay for an uncharge for a better fish.  Didn't quite understand that, since they were the ones that ran out of the catfish.  I'll go back there, but not anytime soon.

The flavors are so rich and the portions are awesome. Service was a little slow given there wasn't a big size. But the food made up for that. I would recommend this restaurant to everyone who enjoys fine dining. Also the ambiance makes it a great spot for a date night or anniversary. Throughly enjoyed my first experience. Can't wait to return.

This is a great place to meet friends after work.  But if you want to talk, pleeease ask to be seated on the main level!  It gets very loud upstairs when the jazz band is playing, because it's a bit small (especially on the side of the floor that's away from the bar).  The servers are friendly and the food has been good (e.g., crawfish scampi, many blackened selections and desserts).  However, they are a little bit of a hit or miss on the seafood gumbo... it had no seasoning whatsoever the last time I tried it?  The food can also seem a bit pricey, but I haven't found another Cajun place that beats this one yet?  In addition, they have complimentary valet, due to limited parking around the building... unless you don't mind parking on a side street across the street, which is usually what we do if the valet looks busy or unavailable.

My friend suggested this place when I was visiting Charlotte! First of all, it is located in an old renovated home!  It felt very cozy and felt-home like.  Upon arrival, the service was great and even asked us if we made reservation.  You can make a reservation through Yelp if you wish to!  

Another great thing about this place is I was able to find a Groupon deal which definitely helped($25 for $40 worth).  I got the Shrimp Scampi which was very well done!  The shrimp was soft and tender and the tail was still on!  I also got the fried pickles which were just delicious!   Overall, I had a great experience and would definitely recommend it if you are in the area!

This is "our spot". Our go to date night place. We've been coming here since we were in high school, class of '99, so...that's quite some time. Gosh, now I feel old. 

There are several reasons why this continues to be a favorite of ours. 

First, the neighborhood is utterly charming. An old home converted into a restaurant is adds a bazillion points to character of the restaurant. It's not brand spanking new. Nothing's been razed to the ground and rebuilt in that new minimalist style. I'm a big fan of repurposing without losing the original charm. I love love love that this place is still in a house. Take a chance to walk around the neighborhood if you like old historic homes. Some of the architecture will bring a tear to your eye. 

Second, live jazz band. Do I need to say more? There's something about a live band at a restaurant. It provides an old world elegance. I feel like I've taken a step back in time. Like I'm Dolly in the classic movie "Hello, Dolly" and Louis Armstrong is about to serenade me while walking to my table. 

Third, the upstairs bar and patio. One of my favorite things to do is get there 15 or 20 minutes earlier then our reservation and hang out at one of the tables in the bar. We order a plate of fried oysters with remoulade sauce, a couple drinks and just enjoy the atmosphere till our table is ready. We've had some of the best conversations just leaning against the counter sipping on sweet tea and munching on oysters. 

Fourth, is the bread. Once you make it to a table (be sure to make a reservation or you will wait forever especially peak times on the weekend) you will be blessed with a basket of hot rolls. These rolls are the perfect combination of crisp and chewy. I believe they come from Nova's bakery, or at least that is what I've been told by the waitstaff. It's rare to get bread service at a non Italian restaurant or chain steakhouse. Again, it's a throwback to old classics and deserves a hand clap! The only bummer is the butter. It comes ice cold which makes it difficult to spread. 

Fifth, is the food. I could say that food should be in the number one spot, but all these things listed prior are working together in its favor and is why this place is our favorite. The food here is a delight. I love heat and all things spicy. However, when they use spice, it doesn't over power the flavor. It isn't just spicy. It's packed full of flavor with a bit of heat that catches you at the end. One of my favorites is the chicken Diane. Sometimes I switch it up and get shrimp Diane or all 3 Diane (which is chicken, shrimp and crawfish). The Diane is rich and flavorful with mushrooms floating in buttery goodness. It is all things pleasurable. It is a mouthful of happiness and rainbows. Seriously, it's really good. If you are not a fan of garlic and mushrooms, then do not order this. Also, plan on smelling like garlic for a day or two after eating this. No vampire will want to come near you and your lover may avoid your kisses if you don't pop a mint. Trust me. Dragon breath is imminent. 

The blackened chicken is well seasoned and not dried out. It is hard to blacken chicken breast meat and still have it juicy but they nail it every time. The blackened catfish is a favorite and is a huge portion. In fact, almost all the dishes here are giant and unless you are The Rock (can you smell what The Rock is cookin'?), you might be taking home a box or two of leftovers.

Definitely try the fried oysters with remoulade. They are lightly breaded and fried. Every time we visit we just have to order them. They are tender and sweet. Perfect start to the meal. 

I've had the gumbo a couple of times as a starter. I love gumbo and the one here is good. It's not the best gumbo I've ever had but it's not the worst. I like okra and andouille sausage in addition to the shrimp and I don't think I've ever had a bowl with any of those in it. However, the rice is perfectly cooked every time. So, the gumbo might be a gamble. 

They do have a decent Ceasar salad for a starter. Nothing fancy. Just a good salad. 

I'm usually too full for dessert, but we have had the bread pudding and the key lime pie. Both are a great way to end the meal but I'd rather have the plate of oysters. 

For all the reasons stated above, this place holds the number one spot in our date nights. Cajun Queen Forever!! 

P.s. - I miss seeing queen gator. :*(
Great service and food! The shrimp creole was really good. We really wanted beignets but those are only served on Sunday.

Eh. I came in with high hopes for Cajun Queen after being somewhat disappointed with other cajun places in Charlotte. It was ok, but not something that I will go out of my way for again. I tried the shrimp and grits, as it is one of my favorite dishes. The grits were good. The shrimp started out good, but I grew tired of the seasoning by the end. The sausage was by far the best part.

Nice stop if you are in Charlotte. It is located in a beautiful home with an outdoor eating area on the ground and 2nd floor. 

Live jazz music permeates throughout however if you want the full experience ask to be seated on the 2nd floor.

The restaurant was relatively empty when my husband and I went (Thursday @ 2000 hours). Service was great with a very attentive waiter and busboy.

The food was hot and tasty but certainly not the best Cajun food I have had this far. The fried oysters were THE Best I have ever had. It was juicy and oh so tender.

I give this place two thumbs up and I will definitely  return.

FYI- THE 7TH STREET STUMBLER IS TRUE TO ITS NAME.

Well the food was just ok.  The service we received was like a wet dish cloth.   The waiter never smiled are anything.  I think he checked on us like twice and nothing more.    Please do not waste your time ordering the red beans and rice.  The beans are from the can ans have no flavor of cajun at all.   Highlu disappointed, this place use to be really good

We found the restaurant on a flyer within our hotel! Looked on Yelp, and saw the comment about make a reservation and get a Groupon, so my husband and I did just that. Called at about 6pm and still got a 9:15 reservation. Parking was a bit difficult, but we will know better the next time. However, they do have free valet, we just didn't want it. 

Once we got there, we were seated immediately. Tables are close together and you typically have to sit across from your company but that was ok. The waiter came to our table promptly, and we had water and bread in no time. We order and it was delicious! The food was prepared fresh, and cooked perfectly. We ordered the Duck and the Blackened Chicken and Fish! We literally ate every bite down to the sauce. We took home some Bourbon Bread Pudding and that was delicious as well! I suggest this restaurant only to people who love great food!!! Will be going back asap!!!!!

One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. I wish they were open for lunch! Always make a reservation or you will find yourself waiting for a table.

Great food, large portions, relatively reasonable prices. Blackened fish with the topping of the day is always a good choice! I also love the Diane with all 3 ($20.95) - Chicken, Shrimp, & Crawfish plus Mushrooms, Garlic, Butter, Green Onions, Parsley and Spices sautéed together and served over rice. This dish is huge so you won't leave hungry. Ask them to spice it up a bit if you like spicy food. The dishes are a little mild for my taste. Try, if you can, to save room for dessert. The warm bread pudding & the pecan pie are delicious. 

Cons: 
- awful parking. At least they have valet now, but who wants to wait on their car after stuffing themselves with Cajun food?
- seating is packed in way too close together. If you want an intimate date spot, this is not the place.
- drinks are tasty, but a bit watered down for the price. Not the place in Charlotte to go just for a drink or two.
- no ice cream. Seriously. How am I supposed to eat warm bourbon pecan with no ice cream???

If you're looking for a taste of Louisiana, it is here! Well for a place in Charlotte at least. The atmosphere is wonderful & the jazz music they play is fun! If you sit upstairs, it might be a little too loud.

Our favorite dishes that we try to get every time are the following:
1. Crawfish Diane with Mashed Potatoes
2. BBQ Shrimp 
3. Mahi Mahi with Shrimp Topping (Special of The Day)
4. Fried Oyster Appetizer 

They also have great drinks! We always get the 
1. Swamp Water
2. Gator Juice

I purchased a Groupon to use here.

I can't say I'm a good judge of Cajun food, or very adventurous to try many of the spices & flavors of the true Cajun food.  

I ordered the Creole Chicken which was not too spicy, lots of chicken and lots of rice.  It was definitely a two meal meal.  

They have free valet parking because sometimes it can be hard to find in the area.  There is also a live jazz band upstairs that can be loud - but also very good and entertaining.

The alligator statue out front is broken, I hope they fix it soon!

I want to like this place more but I can't give it more than three stars. Yes, it is different and they have good deals.  Colorful place, bar upstairs.  Frankly, just average though. Loud music that I just wasn't into.
Recommended Place.  The food was great and the staff equally great. A really nice place.

Yummy food and  fun environment.  Don't expect any new age, trendy, food here, they serve true to form cajun food.  Prepare to leave here stuffed.   However, the service can sometimes stink due to it's high volume of patrons.  Anticipate long wait times and mediocre service if they are busy.

We absolutely loved everything we had at Cajun Queen. I had the crawfish etouffee and it was fantastic. Just the right amount of spice, perfect ratio of rice to crawfish and nice portion size. My boyfriend had the cajun chicken pasta and oh my goodness, the sauce let me tell you...its out of this world!! I loved the veggies in his pasta as well. To finish off our meal we shared the bread pudding, it was great as well and fresh out of the oven. My only complaint is I would have liked more caramel sauce because it was that fantastic! 

Now onto the ambiance, this restaurant is actually an older house. I love how they have things split into separate rooms, it gives it a more intimate feeling. The place really gives off a cool vibe. 

Service was amazing, our waiter was super personable and friendly. He never let us run out of anything! 

We will definitely be back in the future and I recommend that everyone give this place a try!

Had a party of 10 here on Friday at 6:30pm. When i arrived, table was ready for us. I was the first to sit and wait for the others. 

Layout: 4/5 it can be a little confusing but with the hostess leading we were ok. 

Hostess: 5/5 the two hostesses were great and lead us to our table. 

Waiter: Brandon, 5/5 he was great. Make sure my water was filled. Never missed anything. 

Food: Gumbo soup 2/5. Very watery. And left a funny after taste in my mouth. I had a spoonful and sent it back 

Fried catfish w/mashed potatoes and broccoli 5/5. I truly enjoyed this dish.. it wasn't over fried. Fall apart and melt in my mouth that go perfectly with the mashed potatoes! 

With my surrounding, the food except the gumbo and the service. I genuinely enjoyed this place.

This place is defiantly done if the best New Orleans style Cajun food in the city! Everytime I go here I always have a great food experience. The atmosphere is homey...literally it's in a house! Unfortunately because of that not all seats are great seats, sit too close to a window in the winter you'll regret it! Also the seats could be too close for comfort. My favorite thing here is the etouffee! It has just the right amount of Cajun spice without it being overwhelming. 
Beware, parking sucks here with the potential of being towed or blocked is high! Pay attention to signs and try to find somewhere on the street.

The owner could care less about customers. He is the rudest man. The food is so so. Nothing Cajun about it. They did not use our Groupon correctly. That was fine with us, but why couldn't the server tell us. Not just toss the bill on the table and walk away. Save your money and dine elsewhere. The Cajun Yard Dog is far better, and far more Cajun cuisine.

Easy to get reservations, prompt service, and DELICIOUS food!  I had the crayfish etoufee - rich and yummy.  Others had the chicken creole, shrimp & grits, & fried shrimp.  All reported yummy!  Nice atmosphere, too.  Took a kiddo (18mo.) and it was fine for her.  I will definitely be back.

Great atmosphere so I have it three stars. From someone who has been to New Orleans multiple times I can say confidently that the food here is bland has no flavor. They lack the spices and seasonings that true authentic Cajun food has. I ordered the shrimp etoufee and my fiancé ordered the pan seared duck breast. Both looked decent but essentially lacked flavor and the comfort you get from eating good ol New Orleans Cajun food.

The best BBQ shrimp I've EVER had. The sauce is good for dipping the bread. Definitely going back again. Shrimp and grits are okay, but I've been to Hominy Grill in Charleston, SC and theirs is the best. Service was awesome, as our waiter was great!

Having been to NOLA and experiencing the amazing food scene it's hard to imagine anywhere outside of LA being able to match the quality of food; however, this restaurant is awesome.  The etouffe was spot on, shrimp and grits creamy, the Cajun popcorn was a delightful surprise and the scampi unlike any other ever tried. 

Great place to celebrate or just enjoy a great taste of new Orleans.

We took advantage of a $40 Groupon on a Tuesday night.  The evening was wonderful with good food, good wine, and good service (Thx Anna).  We were seated upstairs in a little corner and listened to the band while sipping an Old Vine Zinfandel--hard to top!

My wife took advantage of their 30 yr anniversary menu for $30; me, a 1 lbs. ribeye with Mushroom Diana on top.  There was so much food we split our entrees and doggy-bagged 8 oz of steak (yummy the next day, too).  The ribeye was cooked a perfect medium rare.  Cajun Queen is a great place with valet parking which is a no-brainer.  

PS:  Tried booking through Open Table that stated no openings.  When I called direct, no problem.  Great . . . table for two, please!

I went last Friday to celebrate my 5 year wedding anniversary. Our 2 year old daughter was with us as well. The place was alot busier than I was expecting. It was such an exciting atmosphere. We loved it! My daughter said to us "wow, were at a party". The music band plays upstairs and that is where we were seated. We had a short wait around 10 minutes and the manager seated us right in front of the band as if he read my mind. That is exactly where we wanted to sit. I'm not a fan of spicy food and the waiter recommended instead of blackened, I can order the fish or chicken to be grilled and it was amazing. The popcorn crawfish was excellent. Beers were $3, $4 The whole experience was great, fun and we spent only $80 including the tip. I had spent more than double that at Villa Antonio a few months back for my wife's 30th bday and did not have as nice of a time. I would definitely go back and recommend to anyone wanting to have more than just your average dinner at applebees :)

While visiting the Queen City, I stopped by with my cousin and one of my best friends who happen to live there. Upon arrival I was quite smitten because the place is housed in an old house that has been converted into a restaurant. It was cute and quaint with lots of photos and paintings of New Orleans scenery. We were seated upstairs in what was probably the old master bedroom with the band. The service was good, the young woman was friendly and very helpful.

For appetizers we ordered fried crawfish and gumbo. Both were okay, nothing to write home about. I chose the etouffee with everything for an entrée, along with a side of red beans and rice. My cousin ordered the New Orleans Platter, while my friend had the Diane. Both of my companions thoroughly enjoyed their meals and could not stop singing the praises. Again I thought my etoufee was just okay. I have had much better. I did, however, really enjoy the red rice and beans and thought to myself that maybe I should have just ordered that with some bbq shrimp and called it a day. 

Would I visit them again? Of course, I always give everything two chances. :)
We came here because of the good reviews but weren't impressed whatsoever. Very bland tasting food. Service was good though. Will not be back nor will recommend this place to anyone.

Loved it.  Loved, loved, loved it.  The shrimp and grits were awesome.  The gumbo was awesome.  The service was great.  The wine list was impressive.  I was totally won over, and want to go again.  Now.  Today.  Sigh.  Too bad I'm half a country away.
I really love the Cajun food here. Shrimp etoufee excellent. It's even better when there is live jazz too. It's an old house, so the place has a distressed feel.

My fiance and I went to Cajun Queen one night as a date night.  I was not impressed by the food nor the ambiance.  We booked a late night dinner due to his schedule  and when we arrived, the jazz band was already on break.  We were seated but our waitress appeared to not to want to be there.  I ordered the New Orleans ice tea and my fiance ordered sweet tea, it took a while before the drinks were delivered and let me tell you - It wasn't nothing to brag about.  The food was spicy not flavorful, just spicy.  Even the couple beside us was a little perplexed about it just being spicy (a little eavesdropping).  Needless, to say not a great experience.  So fortunate that I was able to get a group-on discount and not pay for a $70 experience that I didn't enjoy.  I wouldn't return or recommend this place.
Great place to eat... Food is excellent. Always enjoy.  Haven't found Cajun as good anywhere else in this area.

I do not know how this place and Boudreaux's has the same rate. Being a native New Orleanian I am spoiled by my roots. Cajun Queen is as close as it gets to the real deal. The only thing I just do not care for, but just my personal preference is the gumbo, tomatoe-based, so I am just not a fan. The brunch is amazing, and surprisingly I love the pork dish with bananas, yummo

Let me just say the only reason I am giving this place 2 stars is because my boyfriend liked it. We went here as our second restaurant for restaurant week. The wine (cabernet) was decent enough. For the appetizer we ordered the gumbo and the caesar salad. I can't rate the gumbo because I'm not a fan of what's in it. I was told it was good though. The salad was just a salad nothing great. For the main course we ordered the chicken etouffee and the cajun chicken pasta. The chicken in the etouffe was the same texture and taste as you'd get from takeout chinese food which my boyfriend said that's why he liked it. The sauce was okay but it didn't save the dish. The cajun chicken pasta was ehhh. It was eatable but again I'd never go back for it. Dessert consisted of bread pudding and key lime pie. The boyfriend liked his bread pudding but I wasn't a fan and my key lime pie was good but I would swear it was Sarah Lee!! I feel no need to ever come back to Cajun Queen, the food just wasn't great and really a spice let down considering it's supposed to be cajun and it's not a very comfortable restaurant.

Love NOLA? Then you'll love Cajun Queen. The atmosphere is beautifully inspired bu the best New Orleans has to offer. The food is AMAZING, seriously amazing. i had the gumbo and the New Orleans Platter and it was oh so tasty.
Cajun Queen is my favorite Cajun Resturant in the world by far!  The shrimp étouffée is to die for. The ambience and service are great as well.  A must stop in Charlotte.

Nice, down home atmosphere. The service is excellent. The food is well prepared.  My only complaint is that while the food was prepared well, it was somewhat bland and forgetful.  Overall, it's a nice place but judging on food alone, it's ok.

now, that's what i'm talkin' about! 
definitely one of the first meals i had after moving to the QC. a little on the expensive side, but worth it. 
it's in this cute house, with a small parking lot in the back. you can't miss it because there's a GIANT GATOR out front. 
i started off with the bbq shrimp app-- oh, man! soooo spicy my nose ran, i love it! i had the red beans and rice with andouille (both sides) as my entree (kind of like a create your own meal :) ) the shrimps were so spicy the red beans and rice cooled me down. 
can't wait to go back!

This place is awful!  Was with friends for a Birthday and it was 19 degrees outside that night.  The reservation was for 13 and 5 of us got there first.  The hostess said we could go upstairs to the bar. So we did. There was no one there and the chairs were already on top of the tables as if they were closing.  We went back downstairs and asked to be seated. There was only one table in the entire restaurant that had 2 people at it.  The hostess told us we would not be seated until our entire party was there. The birthday boy called the other people that we were waiting on and at the last minute they canceled. We told the hostess the reservation would now be for 5 and not 13. She rolled her eyes and looked at us and in a sarcastic demeaning tone said "so you're telling me now that instead of 13 there were only be 5?"  And we said yes. At that point I was ready to leave. But we stayed. The food was horrible and they included the tip without asking. I will never go back to this restaurant no matter what, even if they offer me free food three times a day for life.  I was so mad. I will never never never never never go back.  Horrible customer service and horrible food.

Stopped by Cajun Queen for a friends birthday, and the atmosphere was nice. We sat on the patio and enjoyed some wine and good conversation. I know my fellow diners had fantastic meals, however my 3 star rating is for their lack of vegetarian dishes. There wasn't anything on the menu (aside from ordering a plate full of sides and that get really old) so the waiter suggested the one item they had available for veggie friendly patrons. It was sufficient but not something I would normally order. Either way, I would certainly go back if there were a few more entree options for peeps like me.

I am new to Charlotte and was suggested by a local to try this place which she raved about, so for my birthday I decided to go. The food was great. For my appetizer I had the Cajun fried oysters. For my entree I had the Creole Shrimp with rice it was spicy, which I like. There was a live jazz band playing which was nice. The only con I had was it being a little tight. It's in a house which was made into a restaurant. I dined on the 2nd floor and it was 8 of us. The waiters had us sit directly behind a table that had all the utensils and drinks. So they'd constantly have to come up behind us to grab napkins, more water or lemonade, or utensils for other tables. Other than that it was nice. Not sure if I'll go back but if I do I won't go with a large group, most likely for a date night with my hubby.

The food was very good. The service was fast and our server was very friendly. I really liked the live jazz band that was playing upstairs it helped with the authentic New Orleans feel. The complimentary valet was a nice touch. We will definitely come back to the Cajun Queen in the near future.

It's safe to say the Cajun Queen is my favorite restaurant in all of Charlotte. I'm from Texas, so I grew up sampling a variety of Cajun dishes. Since I live within walking distance, I've had the pleasure of coming to Cajun Queen countless times. Sometimes I stray and try a new dish, but overall I usually go for the usual - bowl of seafood gumbo and a side of crawfish étouffée which is more than enough to fill me up. Their fried oysters are divine; perfectly juicy with light crunchy breading. If you go in the evenings, you'll be serenaded by the cutest old men band that croon most big band type hits. Great place!
Gumbo is disappointing if you're familiar with New Orleans food. Otherwise, they really kill it! Specials are always delicious, and the crawfish scampi is something else!

I went here last night with our neighbors for drinks and some spicy cajun fare. The ambiance was interesting...basically the restaurant is in an old school home. The downstairs was quiet but the upstairs was the total opposite. The bar and the live jazz band is upstairs. The jazz band is actually reall good but if you are going here for a good conversation then you might as well let them know upfront that you would prefer sitting downstairs. Personally our group liked the live music. Prices are decent and food is as well. The service was a bit slow mainly coz the place was packed!! 
I ordered the Spicy chicken etouffe which was awesome. I ordered it extra spicy and man they meant it. My hubby however said that his blackened catfish was "eh". Still this is a good place to chill out with friends on a Friday night.

Always a great experience! The live jazz music was delightful and the food was AMAZING! Get the BBQ Shrimp appetizer and Shrimp and grits for your entree! You will not be disappointed. Will be back again soon!!!
Food is just okay. Had a Groupon, otherwise don't think the food is worth it. Way overpriced for some rice and a few pieces of shrimp with minimal flavor. Service was also sub par
LOVE this place.  I have been there twice and the food has been outstanding.  Try the catfish - it is yummy.

Ever go out to eat and order the condiments you want with your meal order? THE CONDIMENTS CAME OUT BEFORE THE MEAL!!!!    BOOM!    (Biggest pet peeve ever! I didn't ask for lemons and butter because I plan to gargle with it after dinner, I want it to put on my hot steak or fish or whatever I am eating that evening) 
Kudos to the bar staff and Melissa for excellent service.  Perfect dining experience minus the hot date but that wasn't Cajun Queens fault.   Cheers!

Etoufeé is still the best in charlotte.

Great restaurant.  Service and food are always consistently good.  Heres a few pics of our dinner last night: chicken diane, shrimp scampi, fried green tomatoes. Also, love the rolls they start you with. Use the valet parking too.

Love the atmosphere, great staff, drinks were amazing and the food was delicious. The 7th Street Gator Band was really cool & they brought that Nawlins flare. Thanks again to staff Aaron for being attentive and welcoming. I will return soon.

Honestly I'd give it a 3.75. Food was good but not amazing. HUGE portions for food - which is good except the tables are a little small. We had 3 people at a 4 person table and it was cramped - 4 people would've been too much. Table clothes would help a lot I think. I wouldn't recommend the specialty drinks. Andouille sausage was not andouille but it was good. Overall I'd go back but it wouldn't be first on my list.
The food and service was excellent. it was hard to believe I was in Charlotte and not New Orleans.

I'm so glad I gave Cajun Queen another try! I had a really bad first experience, so I didn't have high hopes when I returned for my second visit. 

We came here with my parents on a Saturday. Make sure you make a reservation because they were super busy. I started my meal with a hurricane, which was awesome and extra strong! 

For dinner I got the creole Cajun rice with chicken, shrimp and crawfish. It had the perfect amount of spice, but you can ask for more spice on the side! Most importantly, there was a huge amount of seafood in it and the chicken included two breast! It was so much food! My parents got the catfish and the chicken Diane. Can't go wrong with the Diane. My husband got it on our first visit and I thought it was delicious. 

They also always have a Groupon. Make sure to check that out before you head here!

I'm glad I gave them a second chance!
I thought it was a good time..food was good..music was good..space was a little tighter than I expected...staff was very nice and on point..all n all I'd do it again
Got the crawfish ettuofe.  It was the best Cajun food I have ever had. Absolutely fantastic. Spicy and extremely flavorful. A must go for any traveler.

I do not understand the hype about this place. Everything is incredibly overpriced and the food is less than mediocre. I did enjoy the bbq shrimp app but the entrees were miserable. I got the shrimp Diane which I'm pretty sure was just shrimp, mushrooms, white rice and chicken broth. Thank God I only went bc I had a groupon.
Awesome restaurant great atmosphere and the Cajun food was delicious. I would highly recommend this restaurant especially for a date night.

Being from New Orleans myself, I must say...THE FOOD IS AMAZING AND VERY AUTHENTIC! Great Atmosphere and superb customer service. Food comes out pretty fast as well. I was torn between the Blacken Chicken and Diane...I'm coming back to try the Diane next time. I know it will be just as good as the Blacken Chicken pasta! I have been living in Charlotte for 7 months now and literally live 2 mins away from this restaurant. I always get disappointed when trying true New Orleans dishes. I'm glad I finally stopped to eat. I was not let down! My new favorite place

We came for my sister's birthday dinner and had aN excellent time! They have complimentary valet, great service, good food, and the live jazz music was a nice touch! 

For appetizers we tried the fried green tomatoes, fried pickles, BBQ shrimp, and crawfish. All of it was amazing!! 

The filet was on point and the Caesar salad and garlic mash were good, too! Literally have no complaints!

This place was great! My bf and I went on a Monday night. There was live jazz that was very nice. We both got the ettouffe, mine was crawfish and his was chicken and shrimp. We both loved it and the drinks as well. What attracted us was a deal on groupon but we will definitely be returning! The only negative I would say was the close proximity of the seating in the upstairs room--we were literally right next to another couple and heard their entire (and very awkward) conversation.

I went to college in New Orleans, and so I think I am fairly qualified to judge cajun food.  That being said, the food here was not all that great.  The fried dishes I tried, including fried green tomatoes and some fried seafood, were delicious and accompanied by great sauces.  The typical Nola food didn't fair as well.  The gumbo was heavy on the tomato, and poorly seasoned, and the red beans and rice was virtually flavor-free.  I enjoyed eating here, but I wouldn't return for cajun food (I would return for the fried food, it was delish).  I might have been more forgiving with the food if it hadn't been so expensive (about $20 per person).  Oh, and the tea was instant or nestea or something.

Very dissatisfied and disappointed.  Will not go back.  Went over year ago and was disappointed in the shrimp and grits.  This time,  gave another shot and tried oysters and shrimp.  They were good but the only options to come with it was mashed potatoes and coleslaw and broccoli.   The very bland potatoes were cold, the slaw my husband got was not good, & the broccoli was just a giant tree on the plate.   The side house salad we ordered for an additional $4 was awful.   There were romaine core in the salad and one slice of cucumber.  The leaves were so huge that it looked like it was just thrown on the plate without thought.  The waiter was loud and annoying and our drinks ran out several times.   Having to ask someone to refill drinks.....the "complimentary" valet was not something I want forced on us either but we had no choice.  When it was time to retrieve our car, it was raining and we had to get it ourselves because the drivers were too busy parking other cars to get ours.  Do not go here if you want good food and a nice evening.

Nice ambiance,  music was jazzy and not too loud.
Parking is a bit nerve wracking but valet parking helps. 

Attentive servers. New Orleans fried platter and etoufee was tasty. Gumbo seemed to be missing a bit of seasoning. Hurricane was nice but not as strong as expected.

We enjoyed our first visit.
Excellent food the price is comparable especially on the creole dishes. You have to make reservations if you want to get a good seat otherwise come before six o'clock.

Nice lil spot. I went right at 5 so I can avoid a crowd because I didn't know packed it gets. My only problem was the parking. Can't find a spot to save my life. But the valet guy was cool. I gave him a tip to park my car because I just got tired of looking. Seafood was good. But the menu is pretty steep but if u get a living social voucher like I did, it pretty much evens out.

Good quality food, but lacking the full flavor of Louisiana  seasoning and spice.  We had BBQ shrimp, red beans & rice, fried and blackened shrimp and catfish which were all good, but do not compare to restaurants in New Orleans.  Prompt service and nice atmosphere.
Great food!  awesome place - I love restaurants in hold houses.  Parking was a little strange, until you figure out only valet is available.
Great food. Hurricane wasn't boozey enough, but hey, it's not actually NOLA. Go with the fried oysters for sure!!

I love the Cajun Queen - the food is great and spicy, the live band is awesome and jazzy and it is fun to celebrate and dine with close friends in this bourbon street atmosphere on the second floor (minus the flashing of course)

I have been here many times over 20 years and will keep coming back as long as I'm around.

The food was awesome! The Shrimp and grits was superb and the fried green tomatoes were awesome. It's so hard to find such good southern food in Boston and to come down to Charlotte to visit this beautiful city is well worth it.

I really like Cajun Queen. I have been several times now, and the food has always been great. 
The decor is unique and interesting and really helps in conveying a whimsical mood. 
Portion sizes are generous and it is hard not to fill up on the main dishes. Dessert, especially the bread pudding is worth saving room for. 
The service has always been friendly, although it can be a little slow at time. This is not a place for a quick bite to eat and more of a restaurant for a leisurely 2-3 hour dinner. 
Noise levels can get a little high depending on where you are seated. 

Overall highly recommended.
This is hands down my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. I've tried almost everything and have never once been disappointed. Great staff and even better environment. Nothing beats Cajun Queen!!
I visited Charlotte and  I must admit this was the highlight of my stay. Some of the best food I have ever tasted. Authentic food at its best.

3 people sat down...
Interesting old house feel to the place. 
#1 - Etouffee shrimp - good shrimp, pretty good spice to it, nothing special that would bring me back
#2 - Etouffee crawfish -  good crawfish but just like any other (customer 2 preferred this over the shrimp)
#3 - Wash Day Blues - red beans and rice were blander than usual and the sausage was not cut up, hot sauce only can do so much

Fried Green Tomatoes appetizer was a hit with the whole table. 
Dixie Blackened voodoo was delicious.

Great experience!  Fantastic food and service!  Fernando was our waiter and was very pleasant and attentive.  We had the crawfish scampi, gumbo, and étouffee (with chicken, shrimp, crawfish, and sausage.  Thumbs up on everything!  I made reservations via Yelp and we were running late due to traffic and called ahead and they let us change our time to a half hour later (1:15 min drive turned into an 1:45 min drive).  When I made reservations I stated in the comments that it was our fist time there and we were celebrating our 1 yr anniversary and the gave us complimentary key lime cake to mark the occasion.  We will be going back for sure and hope to get Fernando again.

This place you have to make RSVP on the weekend.. o have to make our RSVP for Sunday morning..
I did not get the pleasure of the live Jazz but when I am back in ty City I will experience the jazz..
Fernando was amazing.. I mean amazing..

So our RSVP was at 12:30 and we did not leave until
5. Our waiters was nothing but kind... the Good was all ALL delicious every sing thing that the four of us orders.
My oysters were perfectly fried.... my first time there and every time I am in Charlotte I will be here..
You will not be disappointed at...
Throughly enjoyed the crawfish Diane. Wonderfully flavored and a large plate of yummy. Plenty left for lunch. Nice atmosphere too. Felt like being in Nawlins.

Cajun / Nola in the Charlotte, Yes please. 

This place has many traditional New Orleans options in a cool looking old house made into a restaurant. All kinds of meat, seafood, and good grub. 

I had the New Orleans B.B.Q. Shrimp (sautéed with butter, garlic, beer and a variety of Cajun/Creole spices. Served over rice). This dish was top notch and made me very happy.

Taking down one star because the service could have been better and more friendly.

They have live music upstairs but since I was here to catchup with old co-workers, we took the first floor so we could talk.

Will be back during a future CLT trip.

I am a big fan of Cajun Queen and always try to stop by when in Charlotte.  The food is good. the atmosphere is very quaint.  The catfish was delish, the gumbo was good.  The waiter was less than attentive.... he did not bring our drinks we had to ask /remind multiple times.  I asked that my entrée not have carbs /mashed potatoes and instead do a salad.   This was totally forgotten and my plate had to go back to the kitchen.   Other than that unfortunate experience the evening was great

Highly disappointed in the level of customer service provided to my friend & her partner by the manager. I recommended Cajun Queen for my friend & her partner to visit during their time in Charlotte. While sitting on the outside patio this past Saturday (May 5), the manager on duty was attentive & courteous to another couple; asking about the quality of their meal, if they had any additional needs, etc. but totally disregarded my friend & her partner. Both couples were sitting in close proximity so this was not an oversight by the manager, he intentionally chose to completely ignore & disregard other patrons. Disappointing. I will no longer recommend Cajun Queen.

We were in town for my job this past weekend and decided we were in the mood for Cajun food.  This place is in a super cute purple house in a neighborhood.  The place was packed and I was so glad I had a reservation!  We got there around 7:15 and people kept coming after us.

TIP: there is complementary valet parking so bring some cash so you can tip these guys on the way out.

I started with a Bell's Two Hearted from a nice little beer menu.  At only $4 a bottle this is a great value.  Then we split an appetizer of fried green tomatoes.  I was so glad we decide to split since it was 5 very thick slices of tomato breaded and fried.  The presentation could've been a bit better - they were placed on a bed of greens, but the sauce was just dumped over two of the slices and you had to figure out how to get it onto the other three.  It was just OK.  I've had better at The Roosevelt in RVA.
