My entree was stellar.  I had the crawfish etouffee which was nicely spicy and had a HUGE AMOUNT of crawfish.  I am often disappointed with the level of heat and this was just the way I like it.

The cajun here is fairly original...considering.  The atmosphere is unique in this old home as you can sit downstairs or up.  I've only been once, but will return if I get back in the area.  They had a live dixie band upstairs so that's where we dined...loud but entertaining!

Amazing Fried Green Tomatoes and Blackened Pork Tenderloin.  I will order both of these next time I go back.  Very cool atmosphere in a cozy old house.  Live bands play upstairs and it can be loud, so sit downstairs if you want to enjoy your conversation.

Very tasty with big portions to leave you satisfied. We loved the fried oysters (forewarning: the texture is a bit different), the etouffe, and the blackened chicken pasta, as well as the blackened salmon with shrimp on top. Each meal came with a cup of gumbo and free bread was brought out before anything. To say the least, we were stuffed leaving with full bellies and doggy bags of leftovers. Very flavorful food within a cool, renovated old home.

This place is pretty good. It's more of an upscale cajun joint. If you are looking for fancy cajun - this is your place. I prefer a good dive (there was one down the street from this place - Bayou Kitchen - it deserves honorable mention - it was a better example of real cajun food). The food is good - the location - also nice. I took one star away because it's not as good as the place that was just down the street.

We came here for Sunday Brunch at around 11:45am.  The ambience  inside and outside is cool.  Nice place to go to drink eat and chat with a friends.

~Service was just ok.  waiter seemed bothered...maybe he had a hard night.  (We will try the Pineville location next time....lol)

-Fried Green Tomatoes were delicious (will order again)
-Eggs Benedict on Crab Cakes was very tasty. (will order again)
-Key Lime Pie was good but its more of a white cream mouse filling style than a yellow custard filling style. ( I prefer the custard style).

The food and atmosphere are great. I would have not gone here based on the name but so glad I went. Also used a Groupon and the service was stellar. I'd recommend this place for a date in a minute. The live band did a great job and made the dining experience a plus. Make sure to make reservations so you can get a seat near the live band.

Visited at the end of December and it was our first time. We were a large group together for a work function. The food was hands down the best- I had the Cajun pasta, the cream sauce was perfection. The owner let us in a bit early and the service was excellent. Such great food and definitely will be taking my family back.

Charming restaurant that literally makes you feel at home. Great ambiance. Feels like you're having dinner at a friends house. The seating was cozy and intimate. The food is delicious and flavorful. I ordered the blackened catfish and it was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. My date had the shrimp diane, which he said was wonderful. We had the bread pudding for dessert. It was good. I never had bread pudding with peaches in it. It was unique. Our waiter was friendly and took good care of us. We had a great time at Cajun Queen and we can't wait to go back again soon.

We waited an hour and a half on a Saturday night for a table.  Bar area super crowded with one bartender and the speaker system screaming out reservation last names every few minutes at deafening decibels. No place to sit--and tarot card reader girl took up a whole table in the bar. Mediocre wine by the glass and only four rubbery shrimp (although the sauce was great--but we had to ask for bread after they brought the dish )in the $9 BBQ shrimp appetizer.  Finally seated in the room with music (which we requested and they honored) and the music was very average and too loud. We asked for water with no ice and the waiter actually rolled his eyes at us.  5 minutes later the waitress came and asked what we wanted with her order pad out, and we said, "menus". She finally brought some for us and the table next to us and left.  Another waitress came by and we asked if there was any way to turn the air-conditioning down since it was blowing directly on us, and she walked away without saying anything. First waitress came back and took the order of the table next to us which was seated after us and walked away without taking our order.  We had to call someone over to say we wanted to order.  They found our waitress and conveyed our request to her, and we saw her roll her eyes too. So, we decided to leave without eating since the charm of the Cajun Queen had long since left before we got there.....hard to park, noisy, and apathetic service.  Next Saturday, we are saying bye to the bayou by staying away from 7th Ave......

I want to love Cajun Queen, I really do. I try to give restaurants the benefit of the doubt when they fall short, understanding that things happen sometimes outside of their control. That said, Cajun Queen has continually failed to provide a satisfactory dining experience for us on 3 consecutive visits. The food alone would earn 4 stars for the advertised menu prices - although they do offer special discount deals fairly often. The customer service however is consistently dissapointing, to the point where I am convinced that the management staff needs to be changed. The attitude toward customers is not one of "How can I help make your experience better?" it instead seems to me that all of the workers are more into talking to eachother while dropping items at tables without saying a word. This is not just one bad egg, it seems to be everyone from the water boy to the manager. A friendly restaurant employee is the exception to the rule at Cajun Queen. In my opinion the lack of customer service ability is a direct result of the management failing to instill those abilities in their employees. 

If you get seated at the two person table in a hallway between the kitchen and 2 dining rooms just ask to be moved. That table is terrible and does not belong in any restaurant that has any respect for its customers. And that's just it, there seems to be a lack of respect amongst the staff for their customers here. The hostess at the door stares at her computer while talking to you without ever making eye contact, the bread boy just drops the bread at your table without a word. Water boy, same thing. Server doesn't exchange pleasantries, just straight to drinks and apps. Manager walks by and talks to his buddy about the game but doesn't acknowledge the guest at the table as his conversation is overpowering ours. Workers come barelling through with a table they are moving without saying 'pardon me' or anything at all. On the way out the door the manager guy just stands there staring at the hostess' computer screen without so much as saying thanks have a good night...

We have kept returning to Cajun Queen always hoping our next experience would prove to be better, but sadly I think we have now given up. The food earns a 4 star recomendation and it is worth experiencing, but the service is 2 star at best.

Christian is the best server of all time! Yummy delicious food as well! Went to celebrate birthday, bar seemed a little backed up, but wonderful food. Christian. Pork tenderloin! Oh, and Christian the server. A

We come here every year after the Heroes Con. I think this is our 5th or so year. It's a damn shame we only get to come once a year since we don't live in Charlotte. We ordered the shrimp and grits, the etouffe, the Diane- party of 8. Everyone looks forward to this meal and we were not disappointed this year. Lovely loaf of bread as well. Service was friendly and efficient (started a tiny bit rough but corrected quickly) 

It was Fathers Day but the place was empty. I'm worried! Hope it was just a slow night for them. I don't know why it's not packed every night. They solved the parking issue with Valet parking so you have no excuses.

I hadn't been here for dinner in years. Brunch in a few years as well. I don't know why I haven't been here more recently. Great service and the food was fantastic. I had the shrimp/chicken Diane with a salad. I think what would have made the dish even better was a little char on the chicken/shrimp. We sat on the outside patio and it was a perfect night for this weather wise. The servers were attentive and did a great job with the flow of our dinner.

We started off with what everyone suggested, yes the Fried Green Tomatoes and the Cajun Popcorn (Fried Crawfish). It was awesome. The green tomatoes were not sour and it came with a sauce that made it tangy. This sauce also came with the fried crawfish and it complemented with it well.

I ordered the Diane with all three (chicken, shrimp, and crawfish) my mother ordered the chicken, my father ordered the pork chop, and my brother followed with everyone's recommendation of the BBQ shrimp.

The Diane: absolutely to die for. It wasn't extremely spicy, the spice and kick came from the use of pepper and maybe a dash of cayenne pepper. But it was creamy, and with the mushrooms, chicken, crawfish, and shrimp it was amazing. I have to personally say that this was probably the best dish, or tied with the pork chop at least.

The chicken was probably the worse of the 4 dishes there, but on the bright side we did order the 3 good dishes. Next, the Pork Chop:
This was awesome as well. The flavor was just off the chain! It wasn't spicy, but that sauce they added to the pork chop had a tangy flavor and then it was sweet as well. The meat was also well cooked, juices just coming out of it. Delicious.

The last dish BBQ Shrimp:
If you're a spicy dish lover, this is the dish you should get. My father as well as brother found it pretty spicy (I did too), but whoa. The flavor on the shrimp as well as the rice was absolutely delicious (before the kick of the spiciness of course). It had a tangy sweet taste to it at first, then it just kicks back. 

Parking was kinda crappy, but it goes well with the environment and ambiance of the restaurant. A house/restaurant gives it a homey feel, as well as a high class dining experience. But, parking and getting out of that parking lot is a pain. *Note, there is an exit/entrance at the back of the parking lot as well as the front to 7th street.* (But I would recommend to enter from 7th street)

I hope I have stirred your taste buds in trying something new and unique from Charlotte. Because mine was!

Cajun Queen is great for Charlotte but it's not the best cajun/creole I've had.  In my opinion, their food is good but leave's something to be desired if you've had great cajun/creole food. The apps here are good and the etouffee is alright.  Definitely make reservations when you come, as they only serve dinner (brunch on Sundays) and always have a crowd. They have "complimentary" valet service, and I would definitely recommend using it since they don't have an assigned lot. The live band is great and the service is very attentive. Solid restaurant if you want something different from the norm in the QC.

This was a pleasant surprise to find in Charlotte. Thank goodness for the valets because parking is a bear in that area.

I ordered the crawfish etoufee and the waiter suggested adding some andouille sausage. Great choice. The roux was spiced just right and was as smooth as silk. Too many places either scorch the roux or make it too watery. These folks nailed it.

Would have loved some French bread garlic toast with it but the dinner rolls were very good.

Cajun Queen is a really quaint restaurant. It has an old Southern feel to it. The wait staff is PHENOMENAL, very hands on and attentive. Now lets get to the food...AMAZING. Sampled a few items from others and it was delicious. The table was thoroughly pleased. I didn't know they offered Brunch. It was a welcoming surprise. Will be back

Went during restaurant week and can say that I wasn't impressed. Food tasted rather bland. The parking is a headache, parked in a spot but was told to move. Didn't  know they had complimentary parking until at the front door. They parked vehicles in no parking areas. Overall I wasn't impressed, but glad I tried it for myself. But try it for yourself.
If you want crawfish, this is the place. The etouffee is to die for. I look forward to coming back and trying out brunch.

Instant classic! Can't believe we haven't tried this place before. My wife and I ate here this evening for the first time. We had the BBQ shrimp and the pan seared duck, per the recommendation of our waiter, Joey. We highly recommend both! They provide complementary valet parking for dinner, which is necessary due to limited parking nearby, so plan accordingly to tip your valet.

Good food and cool atmosphere.  If you have a craving for cajun food and you are in Charlotte, then this is the place for you.  There's live jazz music and a bar upstairs.  The etoufee with chicken, shrimp, and crawfish makes for a delicious meal.  The seafood gumbo is pretty good, but nothing exceptional.  There are times when the parking is kind of a hassle there; the private parking area is often full.

Had a great dinner here last night in part because of the great deal we got from groupon and the fact that they have a good selection of Abita beers.  

The shrimp étouffée and shrimp diane that we got were both quite good, and the service was pretty decent as well.  They forgot a few things, but were nice people at least.   The location is pretty nice and we were able to take a walk around the block afterwards to help digest (why the hell is 7th street totally paved over into some 5 lane highway... slow down people).

Having just gone to New Orleans a few months ago, I'm glad that Charlotte has a place to get  this type of food, although it's still not perfectly on point.

Live Jazz never hurts (but if you sit downstairs you won't be able to see it and probably can't hear it too well either).

Once again the food is great, and atmosphere is awesome! However, the server and food runner or the guy refill drinks are so so....

We tried the crawfish popcorn, dinner special sirloin steak with crawfish étouffée, and crawfish and shrimp creole. They are very good, especially the dinner special.

I came  to charolette on 11/ 20 for my birthday weekend. My  friend made reservations for us to come to this restaurant. When you walk in, it looks like a house that was converted into a restaraunt which was awesome!  It definitely has a new orleans feel. We ordered drinks & appetizers. The  waiter also gave us a side of red beans and rice. I had a hurricane and fried green tomatoes. For my entrée,  I ordered fried catfish,  steamed broccoli and coleslaw and it was amazing!! The catfish filets were huge and plentiful! The  prices are very reasonable for the amount of food you get. The fish was seasoned and fried to perfection. The service, and ambience was amazing! My friend & I were celebrating our birthday,  the waiter gave us both a piece of pie of our choice on the house.  If your looking for a Cajun restaraunt, with a new orleans feel, please go to Cajun Queen you won't be disappointed!
Great food, nice location, complimentary valet, awesome service AND there's typically a Groupon; $25 for $40 worth of food...what more can you ask for ?!

What a wonderful experience. Had not been here for many years but it seems to get better with age. It is the best Cajun food I have ever and outside of New Orleans. We had the gumbo and étouffée and Both were outstanding. Service was also top notch.

Food was very good! Certainly not a creole expert, but felt very authentic.  Certainly beats any others Cajun places in Charlotte. 

Service was friendly, was in a cute little Elizabeth house. 

Only complaint was the seating was tight. Put four tables where three should have gone. 

Overall, I would go back and recommend it to a friend!

Why haven't I ever been here before, it was so good. My family has been here Numerous times but for some reason I've never been. We started out with fried pickles and crawfish scampi. It was to die for.. then we all got different main course I have the special salmon with a crawfish, artichoke heart and sun-dried tomato sauce over rice. It was the best thing I've ever had. Most of my family got fried shrimp and oysters, they loved it. We ended with three desserts cheesecake , bread pudding and key lime pie, all were delicious. I'll definitely be back. This place really is that good! We had awesome customer service! There was nothing wrong with this meal.
Second time was amazing!!! Diane is the best i ever had. Don't forget to start with the bbq shrimp

I went here for NYE dinner. The atmosphere is super cozy being in a old house. I split the Diane w/chicken, crawfish and shrimp with my boyfriend, and it took about 10 minutes to come out after we ordered it. The dish was really yummy. I'm not a huge cajun fan, but if this is how traditional cajun is done, then I'd say it's growing on me. 

All in all, our experience was great! The nightly jazz band was a pleasant surprise.

I consider Cajun Queen one of Charlotte's original gems. I have been coming here for years and they have never disappointed me. This is definitely your place if you feel the New Orleans' Blues. 

The BBQ shrimp appetizer is a great way to start. The sauce is so good and with the perfect kick. 
My favorite was absolutely the Blackened Mahi Mahi served over rice from the special menu.

I've been here a ton of times and am just now reviewing it, shame on me! It's usually pretty easy to get a table without a reservation. I would recommend getting the groupon or living social deal ($20 for $40). 

Service: Can be slow to nonexistent at times. I almost always find myself searching for the wait staff. This is especially true if you're seated upstairs. Takes forever to get your check. 

Ambiance: The restaurant is in an old 2 story house. Tables are really tight. The "booths" are even tighter.  Lots of nice photography from Nola on the walls. A huge porch style dining area off the back. Live band upstairs. About upstairs....seating is sardines in a can. The tables are almost touching along the window. Upstairs is usually very loud. I'm sitting here listening to a woman scream over the music about how many times a day she pumps to feed her baby.  Along with a guy making jokes about his penis....sigh! The bar is also upstairs  FYI. 

Food: Great food. It makes up for the loud people and so so service.  My go to is the diane, a mushroom based dish with either chicken, shrimp, crawfish or all three.  Because I'm difficult I get it with blackened chicken and crawfish over mashed potatoes rather than white rice. My other faves are the fried catfish and the bbq shrimp. Too dang good! They also makea decent hurricane.  I've heard Sunday brunch is good, haven't been yet though.

They also offer complimentary valet on the side street next to the restaurant.

Awesome etouffee.  It actually isn't as spicy as I thought it'd be.  I got the shrimp, chicken, and crawfish combo.  Actually wish i didn't get the chicken (even though it was super tender), I just didn't get as much rice...which probably would have been really good with the sauces.  Other than that....pretty cool music by local musicians....great ambiance and good times.  =)

If work sends me back out here again, I wouldn't mind coming back...
Celebration dinner for my niece...wedding dress shopping was successful that day.  The drinks were great...the food was amazing...

Average gumbo. Our main meal was better. Very rushed service. Basically, one meal out before we'd put down our spoons on the last. Staff friendly enough. But very rushed. We were done in less than 45 mins with 3 courses. Probably won't go back as if I want fast food - I can get it and for a lot less cost.

It never fails that every time we come to Cajun Queen we leave extremely satisfied! I recommend sitting upstairs to hear the jazz band but their rooftop patio is super nice as well! Try the Diane chicken and add andouille sausage to it! You will devour the whole plate!

Food is okay, I really love Cajun food and travel often to New Orleans, maybe I'm too spoiled by that.
I expected a more authentic experience.
Nice ambient.

Decided to try this place out based on a recommendation from my roommate. We went for food week so were presented with a three course menu and wine pairings for a good price. The gumbo starter was good but not amazing. The second course was a salmon in white wine sauce and the salmon absolutely perfect. It was a very generous piece of fish and somehow it was perfectly cooked all the way through. The third course was a key lime pie and was a nice finish to a delicious meal. The atmosphere was excellent and the wait staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. I will definitely be bringing family here when they come to visit.
Amazing dinner! Fantastic Service!  The food was one of the best we've had in Charlotte!  The spices, heat and flavors were great and finished by homemade dessert was the best finish.

Elizabeth is one of my favorite parts of town; I love how old houses have been remade into restaurants and offices.  Too often charming old buildings are paved over and replaces with concrete boxes.  The Cajun Queen is in one of these old homes, and this lends it a very intimate and warm atmosphere.

Of course, atmosphere isn't everything when it comes to restaurants, but the food at the Cajun Queen was fortunately spot-on as well.  Our tables started with the fried oyster appetizer, and it was a hit: emarkably light for a fried dish, it was like eating little oyster clouds.  For my main course, I ordered etouffee with all three (chicken, shrimp, and crawfish).  It was creamy and deeply, darkly spicy.  I was a little worried about the protein aspect, since those three items have different cooking times, but all were perfectly done.

The Cajun Queen provided us with a delicious dinner.  I knock a single star off only because the service, while not bad, wasn't great either.  The place isn't exactly cheap, so our waiter earned a nice tip.  He could've paid just slightly more attention to our table.  Oh well, everyone has an off day.
Beautiful old house.  Classic and well presented NOLA type favorites.  Great drinks.  Do not miss the music upstairs and the deck.  Made the trip a vacation.

I decided to take my guy Mark out since he works way too much and he needed a night out.  The Cajun Queen did not disappoint.  Our waiter Bob was very friendly.  We started the evening with a bowl of seafood gumbo and a side of andouille sausage.  The gumbo was delicious and the andouille was grilled to perfection.  Mark ordered the crawfish etouffee and I ordered the blackened shrimp 'n grits.  Both dishes were amazing and paired well with our Legion beer.  Well done Cajun Queen, well done!
Awesome Bbq shrimp appetizer! Shrimp and grits with sausage was ol so good! Coming from new Orleans this restaurant was great with a flavor of a nice jazz performance from the 7th street gator band!

If your in Charlotte definitely make your way to Cajun Queen, highly recommend making a reservation you will be seated quickly and highly recommend using there complimentary valet parking you just have to tip the guys, great New Orleans Cajun/creole style food in Charlotte, their Sunday brunch is awesome as well!!!!
Didn't really care too much for the food. The wait was long for overpriced, bland, food.

Service: Our server was nice enough - nothing amazing, but was attentive and we never found ourselves lacking for anything.

Atmosphere: While I felt it's a little run-down on the inside, it didn't bother me on a cold, winter day because it was warm and inviting. There is a fireplace in the front room that I wish we could have been seated near. Instead, we were seated in a back room that felt like an enclosed patio that had parking lot lights streaming in. Oh well. Live music upstairs would have been too loud for our group to sit near it and talk. Valet parkers were friendly and quick.

Beverages: Thumbs-up for some fun beverages. I had the good ol' Hurricane (didn't seem too strong to me) and a fellow diner had the "Seventh Street Stumbler." Both of us enjoyed our drinks. While I don't usually order those types of beverages, it seemed appropriate at a cajun restaurant and I was pleased.

Food: I don't know about everyone else, but I was blown away by my Shrimp Julienne (?) - it was light, but plenty of food and DELICIOUS. I would highly recommend to others and would order it again myself. The bread is a waste of carbohydrates, so ask them to skip that. The fried pickles were pretty delicious and I don't usually like fried pickles.

Overall: I would return here on a date or with friends who were ready to have some drinks.

We took our daughter there for her birthday a while ago, per her request.  We had a good group with us, but unfortunately they sat us upstairs right next to the band, which made it very difficult for conversation among all of us.  We've eaten our way through New Orleans a couple of times, but this, to me, was not quite up to par.  Especially at $15-$20 a plate.  I've been here twice, and unfortunately, I don't think I'll be back.  Fun atmosphere, great service, and yes, it would be a good date night.  But not a good group night.

We had heard a lot about this place and decided to dine in here during the Charlotte Restaurant Week. We have been to this place only once so far. Just to be safe we made reservations. I will say this place has a beautiful ambiance. It looks like a house which is converted to a beautiful restaurant. There is valet parking available. The receptionist at the front gave us a nice seat on the second floor. It was just our luck because there was live jazz music being played that night. During the restaurant week, this place does have a very good choice of Entrees. You will be served with a 3 course meal with the addition of a glass wine of your choice. We had the cup of seafood gumbo to begin with. The soup served was the right quantity. Not too much or too less. Soup was warm enough. The contained scallops, shrimp, vegetables. For the entree, we had Diane with Chicken and Fresh Fish (blackened Tilapia). Both the chicken as well as fish we cooked well. The topping on the fresh fish were great. The diane chicken had a variety of vegetables on it along with rice. You can also have shrimp and chicken together in it. The food was warm. The third and final course is a dessert of your choice. We chose to have the Key Lime Pie. I cant remember much but I don't think a Key Lime Pie can go wrong at all. The server was definitely very polite and nice to us. She was checking on us at regular intervals and the food was served in a timely manner. During restaurant week, I would say the price of the meal is $$. However if you decided to go some other time, then it would be $$$. The restrooms were clean and tidy.

Not sure if it was just an off night but we had a rough dining experience last night. We called and made a reservation for 8:45pm and were told this would be plenty of time to dine before their closing time of 10pm. As soon as we sat down we were rushed to order because the kitchen was closing at 9:15. Our plates were cleared before we were even able to finish our meals and when we told the waiter he replied with, "I already put the dishes in the kitchen but I can bring them back out." The staff was turning off lights and locking up before we even got up to leave. We felt like we were intruding on the staff and an inconvenience so this made it difficult to enjoy ourselves.

Had a great dinner here a few weeks ago with our friends who love the place! The hurricanes were on point! My wife had a special with fish and a shrimp sauce on top, and she really enjoyed it. I had the bayou platter and the catfish AND chicken were both cooked to perfection! The intimacy atmosphere can feel a little overly formal or stuffy when you first sit down, but see right past it and get yourself a hurricane, it's totally worth it!
I had dinner here last night for the first time.  I ordered the Bayou Platter it was amazing.  I will definitely go back for the good and the jazz.

We arrived at 7pm on Friday  for our reservation and was seated immediately.  We were seated upstairs where the jazz band plays.  The music was good but was extremely loud because it's a small area.  It was very hard to have a conversation with my husband without yelling and/or repeating myself.  The food was good not great.  The Cajun Popcorn was a good appetizer, but next time I would ask for the sauce on the side (some pieces were drenched).  We both had the blackened catfish with garlic mashed potatoes and broccoli.  I added the extra topping of Diane sauce.  The catfish had very good flavor and we received two nice sized pieces.  We each only had 2-3 small pieces of broccoli with thick stalks and they could have been steamed maybe a minute or two longer.  

I had read previous reviews about parking, so we used the valet service.  When it was time to leave, the attendants seemed overwhelmed.  After waiting about 5 minutes, we decided to get our own car....the attendant just handed us the keys, no apologies or anything.  When we got to the car, the drivers side window was down.  Luckily, it was a very light drizzle of rain that evening and nothing valuable was in the car! 

Overall,  very festive atmosphere, food was good, and wait service was good.  We were never without water or tea. It got extremely crowded  around 7:45 so we recommend reservations.  The Valet Service was disappointing.  The guys need to be trained on basic customer service.  Get a Groupon if possible.

Brunch with the family. It was great! Spicy Tassos biscuits, an omelet and shrimp and grits. All shared and all delicious! Service is friendly, fast and suoer-clean. One of our favorite places. The back porch is right and inviting.

Excellent food and excellent service. Blackened fish of any variety is great tasting I had the mahi-mahi. Very authentic and NOLA like atmosphere. Only negative is no beignets at dinner only during the brunch.

We visited Cajun Queen for the second time tonight & I'm updating my review from 4 to 5 stars. The upgrade is largely due to the fact that this time we sat upstairs & enjoyed some great live jazz! Also, my husband got the same dish as last time (crawfish & shrimp étouffée) & called it one of his "favorite dishes ever" & I tried something new (shrimp creole) & loved it just as much as the dish I got the first time (shrimp Diane). The walls are adorned with great photos of NOLA, the home where the restaurant lives is beautiful, & the service is good. The free valet is a nice touch as street parking in at a premium in the neighborhood. Check out Cajun Queen!

The food has gone BLAND! I've always enjoyed Cajun Queen for the food, atmosphere and service. This time the food just didn't cut it. My 3 way etoufee had the heat but lacked flavor as did my New Orleans BBQ shrimp appetizer which looked considerably small for the large portion I ordered. My cajun martini was a bad choice as it was not chilled enough and too hot to enjoy. I'll chalk that up as my fault for trying something different. I think I'll wait awhile before returning here.

We are so lucky to have this place in Charlotte!! It is by far one of my favorite restaurants in town (more of a special occasion place for us.) Listen up, they give you a basket of bread but DO NOT immediately dive into it!! Order the barbecue shrimp for an appetizer which has all of this delicious sauce that you must then DIP the bread into. Do it, you will thank me. Everything I've had is fabulous but we always end up going to the "Diane" style with chicken, shrimp and crawfish. The flavors cannot be beat. I have never been to New Orleans, but people I know who have been many times says this is even better than some restaurants in NO, for what it's worth.

Excellent authentic Cajun menu with great apps. Can't go wrong with the etouffee or shrimp and grits. The live music is 10/10. Great place to take someone while they're visiting Charlotte. It's been around for forever. Reservations and valet parking will make life easier when dining here.

"A very flavorful New Orleans' experience without burning your tongue"
The restaurant is an old house in a very nice area of town an area called Elizabeth. Open every night for dinner, and they have a Live Jazz band every night.
Tried the Abita Beers (Amber, and Fruity) both good. In the second floor of the house is the bar, and in a room next to it is the Jazz Band. Nice art in the walls that is for sale without price meaning - if you have to ask you can not afford it. For appetizers we tried the New Orleans BBQ Shrimp (4.5) - the right amount of spiciness, with layers of flavor. You will want to use the bread to soak all that wonderful juiciness. We also ordered the Craw-fish Scampi (3), it was lemony and not as complex as the shrimp. The Blackened new York steak was nice but uneventful (3)  the Mahi-Mahi with Diane sauce on top of mashed potatoes (4)was very good. I tried the special of the day - Pan Seared Duck Breast ( medium) on top of garlic fried potatoes w Craw-fish Etouffe (4.5) really nice combination. It had the best flavors of Cajun/Creole cuisine but it was not spicy or heavy. The only weak note was the Seafood Gumbo (2.5) it was just OK a bit bland, I added some drops of the hot sauce and it was better.  In conclusion, it was a very nice experience and definitely a high end New Orleans experience.  They do not offer espresso =(. But the Bourbon Bread Pudding hit a perfect mark, it was unexpected light and fluffy, not too sweet. We also had a very good Pecan Pie (3.5).

When I found out we were going here for brunch while I was in town, I was excited.  I had not had beignets since I was in Nola in April and I was craving them.  When we arrived at 10 to 11 (brunch begins at 11), there was already a line of people waiting outside.  The doors opened and people walked in like they had not ate in years, we knew we were in for a treat.  The restaurant is within what appears to be a house.  The dining rooms are where a living room and a den would typically be.  We were seated by the fireplace, which was running since it was 45 degrees outside.  The decor is very quaint and welcoming, almost like you're visiting a relative's house.

The dinner menu is also available all day but you truly go to this place for brunch.  I originally asked for a coffee with amaretto but they don't serve alcohol before noon (I'm spoiled from NY brunches) but their regular coffee was just as good.  We started off with an order of beignets.  6 perfectly sized fried balls of dough were presented with the most delicious strawberry compote in the middle for dipping.  The beignets were perfect and light and that compote made my day.  

For our entrees, we each got something different and decided to pick and choose from the other plates.  I got the bacon, egg, and cheese omelet.  This omelet was thick with a whole layer of bacon going through the center.  It also came with a side of cheesy grits, which were also delicious, and fresh fruit.  My friend got the bananas foster French toast.  The bananas were sweet but good and the toast itself was fluffy and delicious.  My other friend got the rice and beans, which yes becomes an entire meal since sausage is also included.  These were some of the best rice and beans the three of us have ever tasted.  And this is coming from a Puerto Rican, who also confirmed their tastiness.

Overall, this is a fantastic place for brunch.  Get there early, and try a little bit of everything.

In no way do I feel like I'm a New Orleans style food expert, but I have been to a few restaurants in the past with similar style food, and I have to say, Cajun Queen is pretty much amazing!

I bought a Groupon for this place on a whim- and it was about to expire so I rounded up a friend and headed over there to treat him for a night out.  

I have a favorite meal from a restaurant at home that they call Louisiana Shrimp and Scallops- and it is JUST like the "Diane."  The sauce that it is in is DELICIOUS!  A little bit of kick, I asked for it extra spicy.  I had it with all three proteins- chicken, shrimp and crawfish.  It was excellent!!!  I can't wait to go back and get it again.

My friend got blackened Cat fish.  It was good.....pretty similar to most blackened food....not exactly signature like I would compare my dish to!  His meal came with a salad or soup, mine did not.

They started our meal with rolls and butter.....I wish I got to try the bread and oil dip that I saw a few other people wrote about!

THe price point was close to $20 per person.  I do believe it's priced parallel to the meal, but I would save it for a slighty more special occasion.  I did not get to see a lot of the building- we were seated downstairs to the right in a section that was a bit less intimate and was kind of patio-like.  The other dining area downstairs did look a bit fancier and we never went upstairs, which sounded like it was the bar area.

All in all, it was a great meal and great spot!

Host sat us right next to drums so we couldn't hear to have conversation. Waited without getting acknowledged by a server for about 15 min before walking back downstairs to tell host we needed to sit elsewhere. Fernando wasn't a bad waitor, just didn't smile or give us silverware and napkins until we asked for them after our apps had arrived so he wasn't great either. Drinks were completely empty before refilled. Shrimp app was okay, gumbo was not so yummy. Fried pickles were good, Mahi special was really good, Diane was good and will be good as a leftover. Valet was nice and definitely needed with location we were likely to not find parking on our own.

My husband and I always have a good time, good meals, and good drinks when we go to the Cajun Queen!  Love the Jazz and make sure we sit near the stage!  Just celebrated my birthday there in January...superb meal and service!  Yay!

I agree with Lindsey R. that this area of 7th Street has some of Charlotte's cutest restaurants. Fig Tree, Jackelope's, and a few others along this way are all located in re-vamped houses, and it makes the dining experience much more intimate and exciting. 

I usually go for the red beans and rice and the fried green tomatoes appetizer, as there's not a lot in the way of veggie-friendly food...but I'm ok with what I get, as it's really, really good. 

And, since I don't eat too heavy on the entree part of the meal, I have room for the key lime pie. The key lime pie is worth the trip by itself. It's just the right tangy and just the right sweet. It's incredible.

Love this place. I always order the blackened catfish with the shrimp topping in sauce. Stupendous!!! The Oreo cheesecake is mouth watering goodness!! I especially like sitting upstairs near the band after 6 pm!! My 4 year old needs entertainment at restaurants and he loves it!!

WOW - NOLA in CLT. This was a great choice for dinner on a Saturday night. We tried to get a reservation through the website but there was no availability. We decided to ride over and take our chances because the menu was so tempting. We did alright. We opted for bar seating to get service sooner rather than later (40 minute wait).  We ordered fried green tomato appetizer, an appetizer shrimp fried instead of BBQ style to go along with the chicken Etouffee, the Wash Day Blues (red beans and rice with andouille sausage) and we finished up with the bourbon Bread pudding. Every morsel that touched our mouths was delicious. The fried green tomatoes cooked perfect, nice crunchy flavorful coating and gently firm inside. The tomato remoulade had just enough flavor to not over power the breading. The fried shrimp were perfectly seasoned no need for the Cajun tartar sauce that Bo promised but never delivered to my sister. The Etouffee with chicken was New Orleans spicy and hit the spot. The chicken was tender enough to break with a fork. The portions were huge. There were two large chicken breasts in the Etouffee. The Wash Day Blues was a large bowl of Red beans and rice with 4 half andouille sausages. The flavor was authentic and not over spicy. I only wished that I had cornbread instead of the sour dough roll. Although, the roll was really good as well. Did I mention, we were sitting at the bar.  We were glad that Bo came over to take care of us. He did a FANTASTIC job! I will not to mention delicious bourbon bread pudding. We were lucky enough to get a piece fresh out of the oven, the peaches and raisin with the caramel sauce just made my taste buds SING!!!. I will definitely go back to the Cajun Queen and I recommend it to anyone in the city and craving some authentic NOLA fair.

My girlfriend and I tried this out on a whim based on reviews from Yelp and it was very tasty! I feel like the quality of food and the presentation, don't quite match the prices that they are charging, but they had a great crowd and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves! I would definitely go there again.

Everytime we drive down 7th Street and I see that Crocodile standing in front of Cajun Queen felt I had to go.  I love a good jazz place!!  Well finally after 10 years in Charlotte and thanks to a Groupon we finally went to Cajun Queen on a Saturday night, at 5:00 pm mind you.  Not even the dinner crowd, but the senior crowd.

We arrive before 5:00 only to be confused with the parking lot.  Directly behind the Cajun Queen there must be MAYBE 8 spots and next to the Cajun Queen is a hair salon with an empty parking lot that doesn't want to allow people to park there while they are clearly closed...ahem, I digress.  The Cajun Queen valet did run over to us before we sealed our fate with the eternal fate of a parking boot (I think the hair dresser has a camera watching from a remote area...just saying).  We ending up parking across the street.  Not too bad, luckily there wasn't heavy traffic because my slow poke kid was with us.
It was super crowded, even at 5:00 pm.  Luckily we made a reservation.  

They seated us upstairs which I thought :WOW !!That's neat, it's going to lovely up there."  Well, not so much.  There are too many tables for too small of a space.  I was butt up against the buffett where the servers were clearly trying to maneuver around me to get their extra plates, water, etc. I think if they would get rid of 3 or 4 tables it would have been a better atmosphere.  The servers were always trying their best to get around the crowded room. The tables are small and wobbly.  Just for a joint like this, I expect better. 

Being such a small place it was extra noisey, not from the jazz band, but just from people laughing extra hard, or talking super loud, or what have you.  No close intimate dinners for you!

Our poor server was a bit slow on getting our order and taking care of us.  I just think Cajun Queen tries to do too much with too little.  

On to the food!  Well after several minutes of "I don't like anything and I don't want shrimp", our pickiest of eaters chose mashed potatoes and sausage (two sides) as his meal.  Guess what folks?  He actually liked it and ate half of it.  He was trying to convince us of getting a 16 ounce steak. We laughed at that one...well my husband and I anyway, picky eater was convinced he could eat a whole steak.  HHAHAHA.  I had the gumbo and house salad, my husband and other kid had shrimp diane.  All which were pretty darn good.   

The jazz band came after we had dessert.  They were cute and not too loud which amazed me because we were one table away from the stage.  So meh, we won't be back.  For a family of four it came to around $80.00 including 2 sodas, and 2 desserts, but not including the Groupon.

The food was underwhelming and predominately salty. The service was pushy. We were served bread before we had any silverware. As soon as my girlfriend received her entree a bus-boy came and asked if she was finished (no joke). I still hadn't received my entree and when it finally arrived I was served the Chicken Diane (I had ordered the etoufee). They quickly corrected it. However, without the Groupon this restaurant's service and quality do not match up to the price on the menu. Additionally, there was no live music (which is mentioned as a drawing card in most reviews). We visited on a Saturday night at 9pm.
Good service, good food, and great place for family dinner. Weekends are very busy for them so we don't plan dinners there on weekends.

I love this place. The pork chop is to die for when cooked properly. I've only had one unsatisfactory chop. I got the blackened chicken caesar salad (on a better eating program) and there was so much chicken I had to bring it home. The chicken was absolutely delish, well seasoned and moist. I always get the bread pudding, regardless...another delish...yum!!!

The band is cute, 3 mature gentlemen and they have a new singer. I always sit upstairs. The band starts at 7:30.
Great meal with live jazz. Had the Mahi with a topping of garlic, butter, artichoke, and Crawfish...wife had the creole pasta. Both were excellent.
These guys need to be open more. The food was good and our waiter was nice. Plan to park a block away and walk.
Food was excellent, service was great! I ordered the BBQ shrimp and Cajun Pasta. I used my living social coupon because I like to save.

Step into a little bit of the Cajun lifestyle at the queen! Went for a friends birthday and they were able to accommodate 12 of us decently. There is definitely an old school charm to the restaurant, probably because it's inside a retrofitted house.

They have a surprisingly extensive booze menu. Didn't try the cocktails but they looked good coming out. You have to get the traditional étouffée... Shrimp or crawfish. It's the right amount of spice and heat to go along your heaping pile of rice. The surprise of the night was the bourbon bread pudding, warm and delicious.

Service was good. No complaints and everything came out as expected.

They Lack favor in their food. I ordered the gumbo it lacked favor and good ingredients. it was not good. The popcorn crawfish were so delicious but covered in a mayo based sauce that should be served on the side. I didn't like seeing the stations for busing dishes right as you got to the top of stairs. It has potential but think the chef needs to take a hard look at his food. 

I want to love this place but the food is not executed well at this time.

Cajun Queen is pretty much always good. What's not to like about Cajun food? All of the classics are here. The restaurant is located right in the Elizabeth area in a converted house. There are lots of fun legends about the house being haunted. I know they also do live jazz, though I'm unsure of what night. Regardless, you may want to make a reservation before visiting. It's always busy.

Last night, we ordered fried green tomatoes, fried oysters, Cajun pasta, and the steak special. (It was a make-up Father's Day dinner.) All were fabulous. The oysters and the pasta were my favorites and the tomatoes were my least - though, still decent. My only gripe is that it is a little over priced. The portions are large and the quality is good so it's probably justified. 

Parking blows.

This place is great. It looks small on the outside but it's gigantic on the inside. Very quaint and reminiscent of an abode in the French quarter. I had the popcorn crawfish and the red beans and rice here. Both dishes were awesome. The pop corn crawfish was meaty and had a slight hint of spice to it not salty or anything. Let's not talk about the sweet tea. That was just marvelous. Not too sweet. It was just right.

Always love this place.  I've eaten here for at least 18 years, and never have never written about the awesome food and service.  Hubby and I went to celebrate our 18th wedding anniversary.  We arrived at 6:30 and was seated immediately.  I had a key lime martini, which was delicious!  We shared the BBQ shrimp,  a little spicy for me but I love the flavors.  Hubby had the blackened Mahi with crawfish artichoke topping.  I ordered blackened pork tenderloin.  Somehow my order was messed up and the server brought out pork chop.  It looked so delicious, I told him I would take it.  Not a bad choice at all.  The gravy was to die for.  The only thing missing were the plantains that came with the tenderloin, which our server brought out, on the house. Did I mention the service is grea.t here?  The portions are generous; easily two meals.  We were stuffed but still got the bread pudding to go. I have always had a great experience, delicious food and excellent service at this place.

We always love this place it is always spot on and the cajun/creole tastes are true to the origin. Shrimp app is incredible, we really have not every had anything bad here. I recommend you try this place even if you are not a cajun fan.
SUCH good food! Traditional Cajun, so rich and flavorful!  Also the bananas foster french toast for brunch is one of my boyfriends favorite dishes he has ever had!

Maybe it's because I've been to New Orleans or have friends from Louisiana but I don't know what the big to do about Cajun Queen is.  Maybe it's because people have never had real Cajun cuisine before.

The fried green tomatoes were blah.  The batter wasn't tasty at all.  My entree was the combo etouffee with shrimp, chicken and crawfish.  The seasoning was weak.  I must say that the shrimp and chicken were cooked really well.  I just didn't expect a whole chicken breast to be laid over my plate.  The portions were good.

Neither one of my two friends finished their plates.  One said her shrimp and grits were just okay.  My other friend said her fried oysters were fresh.

I will not be going back.  Parking was hard to find and it was loud inside.

Food was tasty but the seating could be more comfortable to a point of wanting to hang out for a bit to listen to music and have some drinks. Wait staff are very nice a knowledgable about the menu. Highly recommend the "Shrimp and Crawfish" app to start and "7th St. Stumbler" as you drink. Do the complimentary valet parking sons not to have parking issues.

I came to Cajun Queen on a whim Friday evening to try their restaurant week servings. Of course we didn't have reservations, but luckily were able to sit right away after grabbing two stools in their bar area upstairs. It turned out to be a great little spot overlooking the valet area so there were plenty of people watching opportunities :)

I got the 4 course pre fixe - glass of chardonnay, cup of gumbo, crawfish etouffee, and bread pudding - for $30. For the quantity and quality of food, I was impressed. The only thing I didn't like of my meal was the chardonnay - but I almost consider that a freebie since most restaurant week menus don't include alcohol. 

I really liked that both the gumbo and etouffee were spicy and flavorful, but not drowning in salt. I love cajun food, and really appreciated that Cajun Queen could satisfy the Bayou flavor and seasonings without being overly buttery or overly salty (think Zatarain's).

While we were there, a live jazz band was playing downstairs. Great spot for date night.

Fantastic place with fantastic food, seriously loved the sevice, the ambiance and especially the dishes. Its a nice setting too.

I had the shrimp and the ettouffe, and I will seriously visit this place everytime i'm in Charlotte

Well well well. I hate to be a negative Nancy here but the food has seriously declined in every aspect since last year when it was fairly good. Once upon a time it was decent.

My group had crawfish Ettoufee, fried green tomatos, seafood gumbo, crawfish tails with sherry remoulade, barbecue shrimp. 

My Ettoufee was very old. There was no attempt on presentation whatsoever as they usually did, and it was served it a different bowl. It was literally slopped over loke a pig trough. I didn't eat it.

The gumbo was very soupy, and tasted like instant tomato soup; not reminiscent of any authentic new Orleans version in any way whatsoever.

Fried green tomatoes were good.
BBQ shrimp were fine.

I'm not sure, at this point, if they can ever get it together again. They're so far off the deep end now that I have officially given up. I'll never return again. 

Good luck to you if you decide to book a reservation based on the positive reviews, you're going to need it.
LOVE the Etouffee! The chicken with rice and beans is amazing. I can't wait to go back. I love the casual feel and the food is just down right good.
Loved everything about this place, great vibe, amazing food! Huge portions, the leftovers were an entirely new meal! I'll definitely be back

The food and service was excellent! We loved the ambiance and the live band was a bonus. Husband ordered the shrimp and grits, only complaint was the shrimp were a little tough. I had the chicken Diane. It was wonderfully flavored without too much spice. We loved the BBQ shrimp appetizer! We will be back!

Had dinner here in the upstairs dining room near the live band.  The food was excellent and the portions were generous/filling.  The BBQ shrimp appetizer is tremendous.  An excellent way to start your meal.  

The food is prepared well and in a timely manner.  I had blackened catfish with veggies (very well prepared and large portion) and thought it was phenomenal.  I thought the gumbo could be a bit better, but overall, the meal was really good.

Service was solid as well.  Can be tough to converse if you dine in the room with the band...they are really good but, as expected, it is pretty loud.  Overall a very good place to have a meal.

Best brunch I've had in Charlotte so far. I got shrimp and grits and my boyfriend got the French toast. Best shrimp and grits I've ever had and he literally said "if I'm on death row, this would be my last meal" about the French toast. Go here!
Fabulous  restaurant...the food is amazing. The mahi mahi special excellent restaurant we go down here every year when we go to North Carolina to visit family

So GOOD! My boss is from Charlotte and he told me I had to come here on my vacation. I did and I loved it! I ordered the Diane with everything and omg it was spectacular... 

The bartenders and waitresses were very friendly and resourceful although the hostess needs to check her attitude. either way, I didn't mind because I'm still daydreaming about that food! Nom city!

There were 10 of us here for a work dinner on a Wednesday night. The place wasn't too crowded but our table was right in front of the band upstairs and I was a little worried it was going to be crazy loud. Luckily it ended up being the best spot we could've gotten.

The table started with fried oysters and fried crawfish which you aren't going to go wrong with.  I ordered the ribeye and broccoli with a cup of gumbo. I wasn't crazy about the gumbo, and I thought it was a little thin and lacked any substance. Everyone else seemed to like it though. My ribeye was cooked and seasoned very well though with all that fried food in the beginning I couldn't finish it all. Two guys ordered some bread pudding for dessert and I tried some and it was awesome.

As for the music, they would play a few songs and then take a break so we could have conversations if we wanted. We had some Portuguese guys with us and someone asked them to play some Portuguese songs which apparently they did. You could tell the guy on the keyboards knew what he was doing and seemed to enter another world when he started playing. Overall it was a fun night with good food and everyone there seemed to enjoy themselves.

So about 10 years ago I was taken to Cajun Queen by some friends when I moved here to Charlotte from Chicago. Remembering that I was not crazy about it, I still was open to going again to re try it. I searched through all the Yelp reviews to see what to order and what was the best. 
First...this old House or Restaurant should be updated..obviously with the amount of people in it  at the time I left...they have the money. Stair case is wiggley..and it is just plain old..Not quaint and old ..just old.
We were a big party and we had a good server named IVY, but the food left lots to be desired. We were kindly treated by our hosts to almost ever single one of the appetizers to begin with. This started with Fried Oysters that were for sure fried a couple of days ago and then reheated in a microwave! ..Fried Green tomatoes were straight out of frozen bag and not fried..just barely baked..still cold in the middle..very bland. The New Orleans style Barbequed Shrimp....tiny little salad size and in the same sauce that everything including the gumbo had. 
I am going to spare you anymore..but to tell you It will for sure be another 10 years before I go back...thank goodness the company was fantastic!!

This is a cool place in a historic home in Elizabeth.  We loved the appetizers and atmosphere (five stars for those), but found the entrees pulled down our overall rating.  The spicy shrimp app and fried oysters app were awesome!!  The shrimp app was super spicy and full-of-flavor...save some bread to sop up the sauce!!  The oyster app was perfectly fried and came with a delicious dipping sauce.  We ordered the fried oyster entree (which was overcooked) and chicken, shrimp, and crawfish etoufee (which lacked salt and spices).  For dessert we enjoyed a slice of key lime pie (not as tart as we like but also not too sweet).  You can enjoy live music upstairs in the bar area or sit downstairs for a quieter meal.  This place is definitely worth a visit, especially if you're looking to share some yummy appetizers!
Evening was great!!!! Food was delicious!! Live music!!! Atmosphere for great conversations!!! And a shout out to the bartender Harrison who took such great care of us!!!!
Food was delicious!   Service was great!  Table was too small for a party of four; at best, two customers.

Popped in here for a dinner date with the girlfriend a few days ago.  I was tasked with picking a place we haven't tried and this place came to mind.  In addition to that I actually had a coupon which actually sweetened the deal even more.

We got there and headed upstairs to the bar to give our appetites a chance to ramp up.  The bar is small but doable and the furnishings are a little dated looking.  Not sure if that's the look they are going for but it is what it is.  Not horrible, just not as fancy as one might expect.

We then were seated outside and I actually preferred the outdoor seating.  It's on a low roof area so it's kind of nice with the view.  The food came out and it was fine, nothing I would shout about but also not terrible. 

I think the issue is I just don't think the dollars to dishes ratio is in tact here.  Things just seemed a bit too pricey for what you got.  I'd come back but not without that coupon.

The lady bartender, i think her name starts with an M is truly an angel. I watched her serve all 20+ people at her bar, and serve the waitstaff their drinks in a very timely manner. We ordered 4 courses + drinks and had no issues with time or food quality. It was completely packed and she kept her whole bar happy! I love her! Food was on point.
Great cajun creole. Lovely wait staff. My family and I are definitely coming back soon.

I felt like I came to New Orlean's all of a sudden (except for fact that we could find parking pretty fast, not so in New Orleans, in fact, there is no parking there in French Quarter, but that's another story).

There is a bar on the upper level with New Orleans music playing while you wait for someone. Note that you will have to pay for drinks if you have any right there upstairs, can't put it on your meal bill. Just FYI.
Downstairs, there is a nice gas fireplace that keeps the place warm and cozy.

I was apprehensive at first because of the cuisine type, not a fan of spicy foods, however, the menu has got variety for every taste: seafood, steaks, pasta, grains, potatoes, soups, salads and even the fried green tomato. No kidding. It was actually pretty good, reminded me of fried eggplant. Unusual.

Portions are humongous! I don't usually leave food on my plate, however, here, it was just humanly impossible for me to finish the buttery blackened chicken over Aveoulle pasta. 

Solid four stars for bringing New Orleans to Charlotte. 

Take the Cajun Queen steam boat Mississippi tour when you are in New Orleans!

Great food here.  Had fried crawfish appetizer and the crawfish were incredibly sweet.  Gumbo was spectacularly fresh tasting.  Portion was just right to accompany the meal.  I also had the New Orleans platter that consisted of fried catfish, oysters shrimp and scallops.  The seafood was so fresh and sweet tasting.  If you are looking for Cajun in Charlotte, you won't go wrong with Cajun Queen.

Was able to get a 9:00 pm reservation on short notice and was excited to try this restaurant! The band played in the other room but we were able to hear the music just fine. The server was very professional and the food was delicious. I recommend the 3 meat Diane, delectable! Would highly recommend going!

This was a little taste of New Orleans in the Carolinas. The food was excellent and full of flavor. They have a live band on sunday morning for brunch which wad a nice little addition to the ambiance. It is a small restaurants that looks like it was a house. This adds to the down home feel and warmth of cajun food.

My friends and I had the Crawfish Scampi with grits, BBQ Shrimp, the gumbo and the blackened chicken. It was all very good, but the gumbo didn't have as much flavor as the other dishes.

I DEFINITELY plan to go back again!
The food & service was amazing! The waiter was very helpful. The food came out quick & was properly cook. Definitely will be coming back soon!
This quaint spot is a MUST if you are in Charlotte. Excellent food, great service and nice entertainment.

Found this place via Groupon and I am glad I did. Great food, great service, and a live jazz band. We had the Cajun popcorn, BBQ shrimp, seafood gumbo and shrimp and grits. All excellent! If you happen to be in Charlotte as we were then check them out they will not disappoint!

Mmmm-mmm! I definitely picked the right place for my birthday dinner. We showed up slightly early and got to mingle in the bar for a few minutes- what a fun bar! I'm going to have to go back just for that alone. Then we were seated in the downstairs porch/sun room, or as my grandmother would say, "on the veranda."

We had some trouble communicating with our server- one guest was late, and I think he was waiting on her to get there before we ordered drinks, but I can't hold that against him as he was just triple-sat. Next time I'll be clearer- alcohol now!

They have a great drink selection, including creatively-named specialty cocktails. I was tempted to order the "Seventh Street Stumbler" and see if it held up to it's name, but in the end, a glass (um, or three) of white wine went well with my dinner.

The food was out of this world! We had the fried green tomato appetizer and devoured it. For entrees, I had the blackened salmon special with crawfish and artichokes, and my friends had the catfish, the chicken Diane, and the shrimp and grits, and we were all so busy making yummy noises no one could talk. I think we planned to try each others but they all disappeared so quickly we never got around to it. 

We were too stuffed for dessert but that bourbon bread pudding is calling my name for next time. And there will be a next time.

The atmosphere at cajun queen was very relaxed! Its also amazing how so many people can fit in an remodeled historic home. Great and intimate feel along with very good cajun cuisine equals a satisfying dinner or even a well planned out date night. Either way you can't lose

Nightly live jazz music on the second floor, but you have to ask to be seated in that room. Food was good. The options we wanted to order all had a 1/2 portion, which was great as we could try more dishes! Ordered the Crawfish Scampi, etouffee, BBQ shrimp, wash day (rice, beans and andouille) and fried green tomatoes. Environment was happy, music was great, and food was delicious!

Recommend coming for a girls night out on the town type of evening!

I love this place and can't wait to go back. The food was really good and reminded of my fave creole restaurant that closed down back home. Now that I've been, I know that I have found my replacement.  There was a jazz band playing upstairs that sounded really nica and added to the experience. The only thing I didn't really like was the parking and the dirty glasses. The wait staff did give us clean glasses, so it wasn't a problem for long.

I want to like Cajun Queen, because I love New Orleans and everything about it. I want to go somewhere and be reminded of the hospitality and the spectacular food of one of my favorite cities -- but Cajun Queen is not it.

I took my folks out for Sunday brunch. Our reservations were for 11am, which is right when they open. We got there a few minutes early and sat in the parking lot waiting for someone to open the door. As we walked in -- clearly the only patrons there -- we were walked through the quaint dining room with the fireplace and onto the enclosed back porch, all the way in the corner. The only people there, and they put us as far away as they could possibly put us. There was some sort of heating unit on and chugging over one of the windows. It buzzed and whined through our entire meal. Once someone turned on the music, it mostly obstructed the sound, but it came on so abruptly and loudly that the three of us jumped in our seats. 

The food was fine. My omelet was dry on the outside and undercooked on the inside. The andouille sausage inside my omelet was gray and sad looking, but the same sausage in my mother's shrimp and grits was brightly colored and appetizing. Did I get the leftovers? 

I've been with my parents a handful of times, and they're always pleased, but Cajun Queen just doesn't live up to my standards. The service, food, and prices are all acceptable, but I can't find anything about this restaurant that shines.

Went here because all the reviews are 4 stars and up but Yelp fooled me this time. Gumbo was tomato based and very acidic, not crazy about it. Etoufee had a nice roux but what ruined both of these was the SHRIMP! Farm raised, flavorless, they had the texture of a cheese puffs. The food would have been ten times better if they just used a little bit of fresh seafood. I tried my friends etoufee with chicken and I wish I had ordered that. I can't take a Cajun restaurant seriously that won't use  decent seafood products.

I only hear great reviews for this restaurant. So I knew it was time to go when I saw there was a Groupon. They offer free valet which makes it a lot easier since I had no clue where to park and they will tow your car if you  park else where. The manager immediately opens the door for us as we approach and we got seated right away. We did make reservations in advance though. I was shocked to see a live band playing on a Wednesday night but apparently they are there 7 days a week! I enjoyed the live music and fireplace that adds on the ambiance. Our server was okay, he gave us bread and provided enough time for us to look through our menu. We decided to go with the Etouffee and Diane. Both had chicken, shrimp and crawfish. I liked the Etouffee but man... I miss the Diane already. I've been starring hard at the Cajun Queen groupon again because I'm already carving for another dish. My boyfriend just recently told me they are $4 cheaper if you get the voucher on living social. You won't be disappointed if you're looking for a new restaurant to try in Charlotte. We can't wait to come back.

This place is great! The setting is wonderful-- the restaurant is in a nice, big colorful house and its filled with lots of vibrant paintings--one of the rooms even has a fireplace which adds a lot of character.  The food is also very solid--lots of New Orleans specialties served by a very friendly staff. I had the blackened catfish which was very good and came with some nice steamed broccoli and yummy mashed potatoes. I also tried the fried oysters and the gumbo which were also both very tasty. Also, another highlight was the bread which came warm and fresh.  Would definitely recommend this place for a Nawlins meal in a fun, warm setting.

I've heard a lot of great reviews about this restaurant. Sad to say it was only mediocre to me. I ordered the seafood gumbo bowl which taste as if it came out of a can, which was very unpleasant. My friend ordered the barbecue shrimp as an appetizer which I tasted and it was great!!! For my entree, I ordered the shrimp creole and I enjoyed it but it wasn't anything fantastic. I'm not sure if I would go back again but the scenery is nice and the waitstaff was very nice and engaging.

I mainly visit the bar at CQ and I can only come up with positive comments. Bo, the bartender, is great. He remembers my name and drink choices. That is very wonderful. I highly recommend either dining upstairs or taking out. Very fine.

Wow.. this place is incredible. Everything from the atmosphere, the service and the food. I've eaten at some real authentic places in New Orleans and Cajun Queen is right up there with some of them. This is the best Cajun restaurant in Charlotte. We ordered the BBQ shrimp, fried seafood platter and the etouffee. Highly recommend all three. We'll certainly be back
Best Cajun that I have had outside New Orleans.  Service was fabulous,  Eat on the second floor for the smooth jazz.

The friendly staff was very professional and always attentive to our needs. Loved the very relaxed atmosphere. The food portions were amazing, you definitely will not leave hungry. The food was absolutely perfect. So much flavor......delicious!!! You must try the Bread Pudding for dessert. Complimentary Car Valet was a nice touch too.

I just LOVE this place.  Best experience is sitting upstairs at the bar.  Order the NOLA BBQ Shrimp; Crawfish Etouffe; fish specials (seems like these never change, come to think of it....); blackened pork tenderloin with plantains and black bean mash.  PLUS live jazz every darn night.  What's not to love?

The BEST, BEST little known secret place in Charlotte! The food is amazing. Please, please check them out. If necessary or unsure purchase a Groupon .. I promise you, YOU will NEVER be disappointed. The staff is friendly, professional and all around joyful. If you're coming to Charlotte, I'm taking you to Cajun Queen!

My husband and I went for dinner and ate upstairs, enjoying the bar area first.  We popped outside with our drinks and ran into members of the house band. Had a wonderful time talking to the musicians.  The food was delicious, and the menu has  gluten free options too.   If  you want to enjoy the jazz, reserve a table upstairs, preferably when there isn't a wedding party. Really loved the music!

The best fried oysters I've ever had(huge portion) on top of Caesar salad. Too much aioli on the fried green tomatoes but fried very well. Gumbo was tasty but nothing to brag about. The real star of the show is the oyster!

No such thing as a bad meal here. A nice cozy place to grab some of the best New Orleans Cuisine in Charlotte. I had the Blackened Catfish covered in a shrimp based sauce with peppers and it was served over mashed potatoes and a side of steamed Broccoli. I could not even finish my meal. Washed it down with a local beer and slept like a baby afterwards. Our server was friendly and engaging but I would highly suggest reservations because they stay busy.

Service is good. Gumbo was a bit watery and a pinch of salt wouldn't have hurt. Gumbo was fresh. The same tomatoe soupy water they use in the gumbo they also add to my shrimp and grits. Shrimp and andoui sausage  was good but grits its self were under seasoned i.e pinch of salt.

I'm a regular here and the food and service is always excellent. Many thanks to the management and staff. Exceptional entrees and apps. Only recommendation- which is minor, would be to change up the dessert selections
My family goes here every year on my mom's birthday. Every time it's the same: excellent food, excellent service, excellent atmosphere. Keep up the good work Cajun Queen!

Went on the last day of Restaurant Week. I had been here once before but that was 21 years ago. Wow! They've been around a long time. I didn't realize how small this place is. All of the tables are quite close together. Didn't like that. Felt like I couldn't have a private conversation. Our server was good. But he seemed a bit rushed to me. The biggest complaint I had is that my food was not hot. I ordered the Cajun pasta dish and it came out lukewarm AND it wasn't very flavorful. My husband enjoyed his shrimp and grits.  I have a $25 groupon I want to use (couldn't use during RW) so I'll be giving this place another try. Oh! Love the valet parking!

We knew it would be crowded but never expected how loud it was. OSHA would have require hearing protection if it was called there. Absolutely out of controlled. Clear example of how to take a great restaurant with great food with large (even too large) servings and add it with a server who could care less, and you get a rotten time. Front of the house is a mess while the back of the house purrs. Do not ever, ever sit in the back right room with tile floors - it will leave you deaf. We quickly ate and ask for the deserts to go. Ownership needs to solve this problem because frankly, it's not worth it to go there, great food or not.

One of my favorite local restaurant in Charlotte. Very eclectic and the hurricanes are strong and good. Now that we got drinks out the way.  During your visit. Get the bbq shrimp for the appetizer and it won't disappoint. For dinner i got the étouffée. It was so savory and spicy. This place is one of Charlotte's best kept secret.
It was ok not as good as i remembered. I was excited to drive up to Charlotte just for Cajun Queen.

The bar/patio is crowded and drinks are good, but the seafood is just not fresh enough. The etouffee wasn't spicy, and a friend's fried fish was that mushy consistency of something that's been frozen too long. I was with a party of 11 and no one was particularly pleased with the food or the wait time. The best part of the experience was the wonderful jazz group that performed in the crowded dining room with verve and style.
I don't think I've ever gone here without a Groupon. I always get the Chicken Diane. There is usually a 3-piece jazz band playing upstairs when it starts getting dark.

Love Love Love Cajun Queen. The food is always on point. The service is pretty good as well. My favorite thing here is the Salmon with the Shrimp and ham topping. So so so good. They also have amazing desserts. The one thing I don't like is their choice of rolls. They're way too hard for me. But the food is amazing, atmosphere and service as well! Will always come back.

We eat at the Cajun Queen regularly...there are always Groupons!  My dad is from Louisiana so he knows his cajun/creole food, and this place has fantastic food.  Amazing atmosphere!!  One of my favorite restaurants ever.

We went to the Cajun Queen for Sunday brunch. We had an 11:00 reservation so we were the first ones in the restaurant. We were greeted by our hostess and two servers who were smiling, friendly, and ready to go. 
We ordered the beignets with homemade strawberry jam for starters, warm, light, sprinkled with powdered sugar, yummy! 
We had the tasso biscuits and gravy, an omelet, the crab cake eggs benedict, and chicken strips with French fries from the kids menu.  Everything was great including the service and unsweetened iced tea.  The serving size was large, but not excessive.  When we were finished, we were too full to try the Key Lime pie which we were told was to die for. 
If I had any complaint, it would be that the tables are a little too small for the generously sized plates, but this is a small place, so the small tables are a necessary requirement. The jazz music is a little loud, but not obnoxious, and is appropriate for the New Orleans Cajun and creole menu. 
All in all, a very pleasant experience. We will be going back for dinner to try the regular entrees.

I have been dying to try Cajun Queen for a while. I originally heard about it from my sister who was going to meet a friend out there.  I was SERIOUSLY planning to third wheel it and she didn't mind (b/c in her mind it wasn't a date)  .. but when she asked him about me tagging along he responded with a "you mean she comes on our date" Welp... at that point she realized it was a date (duh) and his ego was a bit bruised ... medium story short I never made it out there. 

Cajun Queen is in an interesting location I haven't explored this part of Charlotte much.... only in passing. It's a tight space inside , we went at an off time so we had ample room but I wonder about dinner time how crowded it can be. Our waiter was super nice and explained the menu to us as well as made some recommendations on the spicy and not so spicy. I am a huge shrimp fan so I had the Diane with Shrimp. It was pretty tasty and spicy to me, and had me stuffed! It appears that they give you huge portions for your entrée which is nice. I also had a side of gumbo , which  honestly tasted a bit like chili. This was my first gumbo experience so I'm not really sure what to think in terms of taste but I have heard from a friend who lives in NO that it's not supposed to taste like chili. 

I came on a Sunday afternoon so there was no live band , and it was super cold so we couldn't sit on the patio. Overall I thought it was a nice meal and nice place with reasonable prices for the amount of food you receive. The parking is a bit annoying but I guess you can always park on the street! 

Oh it seems that they run on reservations so I would recommend one!
Went here for dinner and was very happy. The restaurant had a lot of character, our waiter was excellent and the food was delicious. I would highly recommend you giving it a try.

Came here craving Cajun food and am glad we did. Restaurant has about 8 parking spots in the rear. Service was very subpar especially since it wasn't busy. Had to ask 3 times for more butter. Waiter didn't come back to check on us. First cup of coffee was lukewarm. 

But this place makes it up with good food EXCEPT the seafood gumbo. It was more on the watery side and bland to taste. We expected they would have good gumbo but it was not satisfying. Started with the fried oyster appetizer and found it weird to be at market price. The half order was so small and costs $13. It was good but not worth the money. The crawfish etouffee, however, was mind blowing. Maybe the best I had? So much flavor and many pieces of crawfish. Ended the meal with pecan pie and wowwwww! We licked the plate! Definitely coming back!

Very nice place!  Recommended as a good date night place by a coworker. Our bill plus 3 drinks was about $87 including tip. They accept reservations and offer valet parking. The wait staff was very friendly.  Our waiter suggested a few nice bars in the area - which we appreciated because we are not familiar with the Charlotte area.
