We enjoyed the food and the ambiance.  My wife ordered the blackened chicken and she thought it was great...great flavor and juicy.  The portions were perfect.  We also enjoyed their pecan pie and key lime pie...both quite tasty. 

The meal was excellent the server was excellent also!  

We will definitely visit again...
Five star service from all of the staff. Five star food served in a vintage setting with low ambience. OMG I've  been to New Orleans & their food qualifies as authentic Cajun food.
One oft favorite joints in Charlotte. Between the jazz band, etoufee, and shrimp& grits this place takes the cake.
This place was amazing, a small hole in the wall gem! Great customer service and clean. Will definitely be back when in Charlotte area.

I took my mom and grandmother for a Mother's Day brunch. The food is excellent and service was fast (especially for a holiday). Our server wasn't very engaging, but that could have been a fluke. All in all, great choice!

My fiance and I spent our anniversary in New Orleans. Fell in love with thefood. Always trying to track down good Cajun. Prices are up there but the seasoning and flavors brought me back down to the french quarter. There was a woops on the doneness off the steak quickly fixed and removed from the bill. Only thing I could ask for is boudan.
Great food and love that they have a band so you get the entertainment as you dine. The only issue is parking... I'm not big on valet so I would prefer to park my own car.
I went to Cajun Queen to celebrate my birthday. My entire dinner party was very satisfied with their meal. Plus the service was excellent!

Coming from the northeast, me and Cajun anything were not acquainted until I came to the Cajun Queen. Most Cajun food is not vegan friendly, but the chef at Cajun Queen went the extra mile and created me a veg-friendly dish! I had a Creole sauce mixed with a TON of veggies and served with rice on the side.

The atmosphere is what sells me on the Cajun Queen, an intimate setting that is laid out in a big house. Upstairs has jazz music, while downstairs has a bunch of little tables for small parties.

I'll definitely be back! Cajun/Creole is definitely a different type of food than what I usually grab.

So I know we're not exactly in Cajun country, but this place is still awesome and, as far as I can tell, super authentic. It's an amazing venue for food--really cool, old house--you feel like you're eating at an actual home--a nice one--on the Bayou or something. Or at least that's how it felt to a transplanted Yankee like myself. 

Great southern style cocktails here, so make sure you try at least one before dinner. I'm talking Souther Comfort mixed with all sorts of stuff--just amazing. And they're strong, so go easy. 

I had the catfish dish, and it was incredible. Hard to describe, but it was blackened with an amazing tangy sauce and came with mashed potatoes and greens. Their menu is really different, so make sure to check out all that's available. I'll definitely be back do so.

My daughter and I had dinner at Cajun Queen tonight and ordered the sirloin special. It was not very good so the manager, Tim, came over and offered something else. We ordered the tilapia special and it was delicious. We also had the crawfish etoufee, gumbo and keylime pie. All were yummy.
The service was excellent and the food was amazing!!!  The jazz band added such a great feel and fun experience.
Everyone in our party of 3 thoroughly enjoyed their meal. Sat on their outdoor patio which was very pleasant should the weather permit. Would definitely return.

All around this place was great! Atmosphere is one of a kind and when they had the band upstairs, it's a different feel. The food was very good and plenty. Staff was very friendly and informative. Very close to where we live and we will definitely be back.

Awesome food and just as amazing wait staff. Highly recommend the Diane with Shrimp. Also dont forget to look at the daily specials. I had a Groupon for todays visit but have gone before on others recommendations. Will be going back for sure.

The fried oysters are to die for.

The crayfish scampi looks great but a bit too garlicky.

The BBQ shrimp is just a-ok.

Real cool how they turned an old house into CQ.

Can you believe it took me 20 years of living in Charlotte before I tried the Cajun Queen?  I guess i have preconceived notions as to what Cajun food is like crawfish, beans, rice which are typically things I don't go for.

Yeah, I was wrong.  Not everything has all that including what I had last night.  The Blackend pork tenderloin was truly amazing.  Just the right level of spice and it was served with crispy fried plantains.  I'm still trying to figure out what the covering on the plantains were.  Also served with a black been puree which was tasty.  The side salad had a spicy vinagrette.  The only disappointment with the salad is that the carrot strips looked like they were right out of the bag you get at Harris Teeter.

Another flaw is that this dinner was with the dinner group.  I called a week in advance to reserve space for 12.  When we got there, they weren't ready for us.  We waited for a tables to be pushed together after being told the patio was full by one person when there was only one table in use.  After waiting a short time at the bar, we asked another person if we could sit outside and she said that would be easier on her.  So why couldn't we go out there to begin with.  

Oh well.  That's my only complaint.  Otherwise, the service was spot on.  Water and other drinks were refilled promptly and plates were taken away quickly.

Yes, this is a place I must come back to.  

Word of warning...parking is a bear here.  It might be easier parking across the street.
Love this place!  One of my wife's favorite places for special occasions.  Seafood etouffee is outstanding and so is the shrimp creole.  Highly recommend!

This is a really solid brunch spot.  I haven't dined here other than that, so keep that in mind.

We started with an order of beignets as well as a fried green tomatoes app.  The beignets were exactly what you want in a deep fried confection: pillowy, soft but not doughy, with a tender outer crumb and a sprinkling of powdered sugar.  The compote that it comes with is also very tasty.

The fried green tomatoes were very good, as well.  They come on a bed of mixed greens with a remoulade over the top.  The remoulade was delicious and the tomatoes themselves were fried well.  My only wish was for a bit more salt in the batter; otherwise a bite of tomato without any remoulade was a bit lacking.

For our entrees I got the spicy tasso biscuits and gravy.  Holy goodness, was this dish rich.  The gravy was probably 50% fat (that's a good thing).  The tasso wasn't really spicy but it was tasty.  It came with a couple eggs scrambled over the top that were a nice textural contrast.  The biscuits themselves were world-class.  Extremely tender, perfectly baked, and an excellent accompaniment for the other components of the dish.  I was practically licking my plate after I'd eaten all the food.

My wife got fried green tomatoes eggs benedict.  I didn't try hers but the eggs were perfectly poached and I know from the app we had that the tomatoes were good.  She also had a little fruit salad on the side from which I nabbed a couple grapes.

Service was prompt, plates were cleared in a timely manner, and our table was in a porch area to the side that allowed us to get a glimpse of the beautiful weather outdoors.  We were stuffed to the gills so Independence Park being right across the street allowed us to take a lovely stroll immediately after.

Definitely worth a repeat visit, maybe for dinner next time.
I visited twice in-town as a flight attendant. Incredible food, music, atmosphere, and service. I'll be back whenever I'm in Charlotte!
One of the best restaurants in Charlotte. We had the Cajun fried oysters for the appetizer and i had the New Orleans Platter as my entree. All of it was amazing.

I had a great dinner here tonight! My party dined on the fried pickle chips, the chicken étouffée, the chicken creole, the bourbon pecan pie, and the oreo cookie cheesecake. Oh we also had the Peach Aloha and Hurricane to drink. Everything was great! We cleaned all of our plates and enjoyed the atmosphere. The set up was nice, albeit a tad cramped upstairs. At times it was a little hard to talk amongst ourselves with the band playing, but this was not a deal breaker because the band took plenty of breaks so that everyone could eat, talk, and relax in peace. I can't wait to go back!

most excellent dinner. Our table enjoyed shrimp and grits immensely,  as well as the pork tenderloin, and the dianes.   seating is tight,  but I guess popular restaurants try to squeeze everyone in best they can:-)
My fiance had the blackened filet, the mixed etouffee, crayfish appetizer, BBQ shrimp appetizer, and bread pudding for dessert. Everything was perfectly cooked and seasoned. Totally delicious!

I really liked this place! This restaurant is located in a very old house, so it's got a lot of character and ambience. We ate outside, which was nice, although we missed hearing the live jazz band. 

Lengthy cocktail menu with lots of great New Orleans favorites like hurricanes, swamp water, and such. 

We had the fried green tomatoes, gumbo, and etoufee. Very delicious! 

Our waitress was really attentive and nice. Excellent server. 

Parking seemed a little daunting at first, but luckily, we scrounged up some cash (we're usually a debit card-only household) so we could tip the valet guys. Valet itself is free. 

We will be back!
The amount of food received for $18 was not pleasing. Packaged was a handful of rice and 12 oz  cup of shrimp and spices as my entree for the new orleans bbq shrimp. I probably wont order again.

I've been to Cajun Queen a few times now and I've been extremely satisfied with both the high level of customer service and also the food quality.  First, I showed up about 20 minutes late for my reservation (I know, I'm that guy) and they were able to seat us right away on a Friday night.  No questions, no hassle, they simply sent us to an open table as if we had showed up right on time for our reservation.  We had our 3 year old son with us so we each breathed a sigh of relief once seated.

Initially I wasn't sure what to order, until I started leafing through pictures on Yelp.  While it all looked good, the Shrimp and Grits stopped me in my tracks.  It wasn't your everyday Shrimp and Grits as they've given it a nice Cajun twist by adding a tasty creole sauce.  The shrimp had a distinct smokey flavor that worked really well with the dish.  The Andouille sausage also packed a nice punch that really pulled the whole meal together.  

For dessert we ordered the Tollhouse Cookie Pie.  I had never had anything quite like it before.  It was really good; however, we both felt as though it could have had more chocolate chips.  The walnuts added a nice dimension too.

Review for Brunch! 
*Hidden gem for brunch in Charlotte 
*Menu is light, but food and service are incredible 

We visited Cajun Queen for Easter Brunch. I wasn't sure what to expect since it was Easter. I don't think CQ did anything different to their menu- it was one page of items but the offerings were so compelling that we did not mind. 

I had the fried green tomatoes Benedict and my boyfriend had the bourbon french toast. We also ordered the beignet. The beignets were devoured in 0.5 seconds. The jam they serve it with is absolutely incredible. 

This was my first time at CQ. What stood out to me was the service. We ate around 11, so it was right when they opened on Sunday, but the servers were constantly asking us if we needed any additional coffee or anything else. 

Only reason why it gets 4 stars was because of the limited options (not sure how often they change up the menu) and because they only serve plain coffee. Sometimes I like to spice it up and get a latte or cappuccino with brunch. 

They did have a drink menu (including hurricanes!) for brunch but we stuck to coffee this time. 

I was impressed with the quality of food and pricing. We will be back!
Great food nice atmosphere, service was great. There was a mix up with our food, manager came without requesting and comp our meal. Will definately return!

First time in Charlotte and went to Cajun Queen with my partner. The ambiance was great, our server was perfect and the food was amazing! I promise we will visit Cajun Queen for date night every time we visit Charlotte! :)

My husband and I flew into and out of Charlotte for a wedding about 4 weeks ago and were lucky enough to spot this place for lunch over the weekend. We shared Chicken Diane (Mushrooms, garlic, butter, green onions, parsley and our Queen's magic spices - all sautéed together. Moderately spiced and served over rice) and some Bignets for dessert (on the brunch menu). We loved the food we ordered so much- and one plate was definitely enough to share. The service was friendly and fast. If we are ever in the Charlotte area, we definitely plan to come back!

So incredibly let down by this dining experience. Our waiter was simultaneously overbearing and absent-minded. Half of our table got their meals 10-15 mins before the other half and the waiter forgot to bring two of us our desserts. Meanwhile, the food was terrible. The fried green tomatoes lacked any kind of seasoning and the crawfish etouffee was bland and not at all spicy. The tollhouse cookie pie was also a travesty. How does one mess up a cookie pie?! At least the key lime pie was good, but not worth the $250 dollar bill :(

Bro's and Holesome ladies, this place is phenomenal!! See my Mahi Mahi dish below, but we also crushed some bbq skrimps that were also amazing. Used the juice to dip bread in and almost asked for a straw! Come by, completely worth it!

I cannot say enough good things about Cajun Queen! The food is delicious and the atmosphere is so pleasant. Dress it up or be totally casual, you will feel right at home. The servers are knowledgeable and friendly. Did I mention the food is delicious?

I've been to Cajun Queen a couple times, once for a work meeting and once on a date with my boyfriend. The meeting was definitely the better experience solely in terms of food, everything was spot on and delicious - I especially loved the crawfish scampi! For my entree I went with tilapia which tasted very good. 

The last time we went service was slow (it was a weekday), and the food surprisingly forgettable. We split the calamari appetizer which was pretty standard and each had the steak Diane. I am a rare girl but found the meat a bit tough- usually filet should be easy to cut through, this wasn't the case. 

I'd say stick to your seafood options, give yourself some extra time to dine, and enjoy!
Food was amazing. I had the Dianne and it was everything I imagined it would be. We had a seat next to the fireplace which set the mood perfect!

Tonight we went here for dinner. The food was pretty good. I had the shrimp and grits the shrimp had a very fishy after taste. Considering that I eat shrimp often I couldn't really shake the after taste. The sausage was burnt. Making it very disappointing. The grits however were solid. My boyfriend got the platter and he said it was good. And my son got chicken tenders. At 4, those are always good. I'm willing to give the place another chance in hopes of it being better next time. We definitely want to try brunch for the live jazz. It wasn't bad however it left much to be desired.

I usually LOVE Cajun Queen's food. It's been one of my favorite places to eat in the Queen City, but not this particular time. I'm not sure if all the groupons have made them cut back on providing quality food, or if there's someone new in the kitchen, but everything was off. The steak which usually melts in your mouth, was very tough and quite fatty for a ribeye. It was hard to dig through it for an edible piece. The broccoli on both of the dishes my boyfriend and I ordered was very tough as well. In a failed attempt to course out our meal, our waitress left us feeling like an afterthought when we couldn't find her for simple things like refilled glasses or clean silverware. The only plus to our experience was the hostess staff at the door. They were very inviting & seated us quickly right where we would be most comfortable. I really appreciated the extra effort to give us an option. But overall, despite the awesome deal, I doubt I will be back to Cajun Queen any time soon.

We ate here for breakfast, as we were in the mood for beignets. The beignets were more crisp than soft, which isn't to my taste, so that was a miss, but the omelette was very good and the Elvis Presley French toast was appropriately over-the-top rich. The service was friendly and attentive, so we will be back again.
So delicious! Must try the étouffée and bread pudding! The restaurant offers complimentary valet and the staff is quite friendly.

I'm a huge fan of the seafood gumbo and the crawfish creole. When we weren't able to spare the time to have a sit down dinner, I would sometimes have the limousine drive me here just to pick up dinner. Sigh, if only it delivered...

My friend  from New York came to visit. Read the reviews were good so we decided to go.  We arrived about 940pm Saturday night....it was a bit crowded, noisy and somewhat of an unfriendly environment.  Once greeted by the host,  she proceeded to take us to a crowded room with children and loud conversations.  We asked to move to the other side of the restaurant,  but she stated the server wasn't taken anymore tables. (hence they were closing soon).....once seated in the upstairs sectio. We were quiet happy with our table sevtion ...our server Taylor was superb gave great recommendations and was honest about the menu items.....  The food was not as  good as expected ....I ordered the crawfish  etouffe half order. It had no taste as though they scrapped the bottom of the barrel with a somewhat burnt taste......my friend ordered the fried oysters for an appetizer which she said was extremely good.  She also order a signature cocktail which I tasted and agree it was strong and good......I would give this restaurant  another try and however; I would definitely arrive before  closing hiurs....great location and nice abeyance

This is one of the few spots in Charlotte that I constantly find myself going back to. I like trying different things at restaurants, but every time I go in I can't help but get the Crawfish Scampi to start off and the Chicken Diane as an entree. The flavors and seasoning are unbelievable and the atmosphere is great upstairs with a Jazz band playing every night.

Rolled up to the complimentary valet on the coldest Friday in several years with a cute chick and no reservations. Got a little concerned when a group left out complaining about the wait but we were seated almost immediately at a table in the lounge (it pays to travel with a cute chick!) Not too noisy, good mix of hot and cool jazz that pairs well with the foods.
Beau showed right up, introduced himelf and got to recommending dinners which was great for me since I know precious little about Cajun. We started with shrimp something; half-dozen shrimps hot off the broiler swimming around a sculpted lemon in a boat of crazy good hot barbeque juice. Lovely bride was quite pleased with the zippiness (flavory spicing, not just heat) of the sauce and got a togo cup for the left over bit.
Moved on to Chicken Etouffee while my lovely bride had shrimp-n-grits. Well yeah it was good!! (as if i have a clue how it's supposed to taste) Moist tender chickens sauced up in a warm lingering mellow sort of mood enhancer over a mound of very ricey rice. 
MLB was quite pleased with her dinner, thanks to y'all Yelpers who recommended!! Said it was most enjoyable especially as she had missed the bit about the andouilles.
Finished the night with a delightful bourboned bread pudding. Yea bread pudding!

havent been there since i was a kid with my parents and after last night i will not go back. who's ever heard of bland cajun food, well somehow they pulled it off. i can make far better cajun food that at least has taste. the gumbo was terrible and the grits from the shrimp and grits were even worse, thank goodness they had habanero sauce to add some taste to this miserably bland dish. they did have dixie lager and dixIes blackened voodoo lager which is the only reason theyre not getting one star. the bartender was not pleasant either she obviously did not want to be there and it showed, when there are only 3 people in front of you, you should keep their water glasses full and beers a-comin' .  the band was nice and the place itself is nice but im never going back, hotel charlotte, danny's too and especially boudreaux's are all much better with regards to cajun creole cuisine

Best creole place in Charlotte we have ordered a number of different items and they are all good.  Had the fried oysters and BBQ shrimp as an appetizer last time and they were really good.  We sat upstairs and listened to the band in the next room.  Not too loud and an overall great experience.

I think there is something special about a place that has been able to make it through the changing landscape of Charlotte, Elizabeth in particular. This place is a step back in time, you can tell they haven't changed much with the exterior/interior. It's a place you can take your grandparents to (like I did), or go for a date night or with friends. They have a nice beer and cocktail list. I had the BBQ shrimp and absolutely loved the spicy sauce. Let me warn you, it is spicy! Perfect for dipping bread and butter in though. My grandma got the salt and pepper catfish and it was melt in your mouth! Service was excellent as well!

We've been to the Pineville location before, and I have to say that the experience there is many times better than this one (at least on this night).  While everything was decent, nothing really came together.  

The jazz band was decent, just don't make the mistake of sitting in the same room if you actually want to enjoy your meal, talk with your companions, that sort of thing.  If you're going for the music, that's fine, but for a quiet evening, it is not the room to sit in!

Everyone appeared as if they were extremely busy so rubbed off as rude hostess and servers. My server never gave me the Valentine's Day special nor did he recommend or discuss the menu. It was me and my husband first time going and based off the poor service and probably just wrong choice of dishes due to no guidance from server,  we will not be going back. Our bill was $100 and we didn't enjoy our food or service.

I take everyone that comes to visit me to Cajun Queen!  From the great food (my favorite is the bbq shrimp and bread to dip into the sauce), to the live jazz and great service, this is a restaurant not to be missed!

Came with a friend and the house is really cute. It's a plus that they also have valet parking when you pull up. Inside is nice. Atmosphere is warm and cozy. We sat by the fireplace. I ordered the etouffee with chicken, shrimp and crawfish. It was good. Very flavorful, I didn't even have to put tobacco sauce in it because the spices were on point. I wasn't crazy about their bread, it was really hard. My friend had the gumbo soup and I tried it and it was delicious. They were pretty busy on a weekday. We saw the waiter maybe 3 times-When he greeted us, when he took our order and dropped off the check. He never came by in between to check on us or fill up our drinks.Service wasn't that great but I will definitely give it another try. Other than that, food was good!

If you like your appetizers before your drinks....this is your place. Table had empty salt and pepper shakers. The hot sauce bottles were empty and dirty. This is NOT authentic Cajun food! The Champagne was flat.....horrible experience. Waiter was aloof.

We had a reservation via Yelp and were seated immediately on the first floor. We were provided the menu and the waiter pointed out the daily specials. I wish he spent more time to acclimate us to the menu and what Cajun Queen was known for. I really wanted to be on the level where the Jazz was, but that wasn't offered.
My husband got the New Orleans platter and I had the fried shrimp and oysters. Our food was cooked perfectly and my topper of crawfish and artichoke hearts was delicious.
We will be back.
This was a wonderful place! The food was so good . I took my wife for a birthday dinner.  I will give you some advice ..please make a resveration

Stopped in yesterday to eat dinner. Food and service top notch again. Our servers name was Kevin, he did a good job!!  However, if you go and try to park near the restaurant......BEWARE OF THE VALETS!! One ran up on me yesterday and told me that I can't park where I was parking. I asked him why and he told me its for valet service. VALETS CANNOT STOP PEOPLE FROM PARKING ON PUBLIC STREETS !!!!!!! Or block public parking spots!!!!!

I was excited about eating tasty, authentic Cajun food.  Really confused about the reason our experience and food did not match up to the other reviews that I read before booking my reservation.

We came here to celebrate a successful event at work. We were a party of five very diverse diners but we all left food on our plates because it was average.  The men actually left seafood and meat in the portions they left on the table because the tastes were so bland.

Watery gumbo started off our meals. It was similar to the consistency of Progresso soups, we could have saved these calories and yes it has shrimp, sausage but why is gumbo so transparent and without a hint a peppers, garlic, etc. We pressed on.

Our party's entree choices were all different some had Diane,  Creole and a few combined appetizers to make an entree. No one finished their meal. Only one person even bothered to take home their leftovers.

The hostess was wonderful, the waiter was okay - he was not happy very curt with all his answers, he looked annoyed by our inquiries about menu items.  He should have just said if you don't know about our menu then you should not be here-boom!  The valet staff was pleasant, quick  and accommodating - Bravo!


We will go back because all the other reviews indicate that we had an unusual visit. I will update my review when I return.

What a surprising gem of a restaurant! Each dish reminded us of our many enjoyable meals in NOLA, with a beautiful layering of flavors. The 7th Street Gator band played toe-tapping Jazz to finish a wonderful evening. Thanks!
Amazing place with great food and impeccable service. Order the catfish or the shrimp and grits, Hell, order anything. You won't be disappointed!

The closest to New Orleans cuisine I've had outside of New Orleans.  Great atmosphere and reasonable prices.  The BBQ Shrimp and Red Beans & Rice entrees are very good.  I will definitely be going back.

With out a doubt my favorite restaurant!! Most constant service and food everytime. The best  ever. The chicken diane and bbq shrimp are the best. But don't sleep on the salt and pepper fried catfish. Yummy.

Each entree came with the choice of salad or soup (GUMBO)! Shrimp and Grits w/sausage and New Orleans Platter was tasty. Downstairs women's bathroom lock broken so unless you are ok with someone walking in on you you may want to go upstairs to use the women's bathroom.

Had an excellent meal here last night with friends and family. The blackened catfish was delicious and so was the cajun  scampi appetizer!  My husband said his pork etouffe' was amazing and he had a large, delicious drink to take him through the entire meal.  I will make this place a regular when visiting Charlotte.

This place is amazing! I always begin with the fried popcorn- crawfish! Amazing! The fried green tomatoes are a hit as well! All dishes are great. If you don't like spicy- steer clear of the gumbo....I love spicy so it's great-not too tomatoes favor, but a good consistency. My favorite dish is the New Orleans Platter. The pork chop or other platters are great too!

I must update my review with some favorite dishes...this is Cajun deliciousness: 

Barbecue shrimp: Nom nom nom. The sauce on these shrimp is outstanding and the little crustaceans are perfectly cooked! I could easily make a meal out of these tasty creatures of the sea. 

Shrimp grits: Seriously creamy and dreamy. The shrimp are sizeable and plump! You'll want to live in these grits...you know, make a home in the bowl. 

Bread pudding: I'm not even a huge bread pudding person and their peach bread pudding is outstanding - the perfect amount of sweet and savory. It's love reincarnated.

Cajun Queen can great really crowded so be aware of that when you plan your evening. And, be sure to catch the Cajun Queen band when you can...those guys are amazing!

I will start with the positives, the atmosphere is very nice and our waiter Alex was very nice and helpful. They have live music in the evenings which was nice as well. What I didn't like was the food. The food had hardly any flavor in my opinion. When I think of Cajun or new Orleans style food I think of tons of flavor. Also, the prices were a bit steep for something I could have made at home. I did enjoy my french quarter coffee! I would return just to sit on the rooftop deck and have a drink but the food was mediocre. Once again the service was great everyone was friendly who worked there. If you want good service and a great atmosphere to hear some live jazz/blues this is a good spot. If you are looking for delicious food you may want to try elsewhere.

The Cajun Queen is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. I have lived in Charlotte for 7 years and been to 4 birthday dinners at Cajun! The Creole with shrimp, crawfish and chicken is my go-to meal. I always get the gumbo as an appetizer and my wife loves the bbq shrimp. I probably eat a load of bread every visit, because the sauces are so good and I dip the bread in the gumbo, creole and bbq shrimp sauces! The atmosphere is very New Orleans and feels like the Big Easy, especially if you sit upstairs by the bar when Jazz is playing.

Well.. I was expecting to listen to a band while eating my food... The waiter forgot my mashed potatos lol....I really wanted it... The food was ok I had the chicken diane my husband had the shrimp and grits. I can say you will leave full and will have to take a to go box.. Oh the gumbo was very under seasoned.

Had a reservation and was seated on time ordered shrimp scampi and they came out with shrimp diane, took it back and i waited finally brought right dish out but my husband was wlmost done with his meal so he watched me eat, it was good but didnt enjoy my experience because i felt bad for my husband watching me so i ate fast they did give a free desert that was incredible
Have been there a few times and they never disappoint!  The Jambalaya is second to none.  Perfectly spiced and portioned.  The New Orleans BBQ is also excellent.  Great atmosphere and service.
Great service.  Great setting, Great food. Great value. Its a part of our regular rotation.

Cute lil house that was bigger than it looked from the outside was very spacious and big windows there was 4 of us table should have been a lil bigger we had to keep having the waiter take things away for space aT the table but that wasn't a big deal the dishes was great great we really enjoyed our meals I was a lil bummed that the staff didn't mention the band playing on the upper level and they posted on flyers that it was restaurant week no Groupon accepted that should be stated during reservations booking other than that everything was good
Best Cajun food I've ever had. I should know, I've been to Mardi Gras 4 times. Recommend throwing a dart at the menu, everything is good. Bo was very nice and very patient with us.

This establishment always has all the goods to impress and satisfy my palette over and over again. Last time I had a 14oz pork chop with BBQ sauce and potatoes that just looked and tasted like one of the best meals I ever had. The dessert Tollhouse cookie pie finished off the night with pure bliss.
Amazing service and the best NOLA inspired dishes in the city. The atmosphere of this place makes me feel like I'm sitting in New Orleans.

I ordered salmon with shrimp sauce and mashed potatoes. It was seasoned well and the portion was sufficient. My friend ordered shrimp and grits and she wasn't impressed. There was a small amount off red sauce, possibly a tomato based sauce, that covered a small portion of the grits. My friend did not like the sauce. The grits seemed to be a little runny and the portion size seemed small. Both entrees were served with a choice of gumbo or a side salad.
I was impressed by the waitress's concern that my friend didn't like the shrimp and grits. She offered to provide a different dish And when the offer wasn't accepted, she removed the entree from our bill without being asked to do so,which tells me that Cajun Queen values their patrons.

LOVE me some Cajun Queen.  Love it.  Love the intimate atmosphere, love the jazz band upstairs... and the hubster loves the 7th Street Stumbler (have you ever seen a 6'4, 300lb man stumble? It's not pretty).

FGT's are to DIE for.  I'm a northerner, so I don't really have a ton of iterations to compare them to, but they are pretty damn good.

Crawfish. Etoufee. 'Nuff said.  So flavorful and delicious.

This is one of our top 10 restaurants in the QC.  Worth a visit, fo sho!

Unexpected surprise. And a pleasant one.
Cute part of the city (Elizabeth) with other historic homes around it, Cajun Queen has been around since 1985 in this hundred year old house 

They have nightly jazz which on cool fall evenings fills the breeze flowing through the southern charm of the house 

There are tables on the first floor and a full bar upstairs.
They also have complimentary valet.

I tried the 'Cajun popcorn' as an appetizer (they also give you bread rolls and butter). This is fried battered crawfish. A bit rich, couldn't finish all of it.
The etouffé  was also reliably authentic and somewhat on the rich side (I chose the etouffé with all three {shrimp, crawfish, shrimp}) although I think the chicken is best left out altogether.

This place is one of the charlotte landmarks I'd say. Five stars for ambience, three for food, four for service. Four overall.

Good Cajun food is sometime hard to find, so bookmark this place.
If you are in the Charlotte, NC are make sure you plan a dinner stop at this establishment.

The best Cajun Cookin' I've had outside of Louisiana.

The Étouffée was delicious, I had it with Chicken, Shrimp, Crawfish, and Andouille Sausage, and its was perfect. All the protines were cooked perfectly. The spice and flavour was outstanding.

Food is spicy and a reservation is ideal. My daughter & I visited on a Friday night around 9 was nervous assuming we would feel out of place but the staff was friendly...gave my daughter mardy gras beads very unpretentious..food was excellent

NOT my favorite Cajun food I've eaten. I wanted GUMBALAYA, which the waiter INSULTED as not REAL Cajun food AND he said was like the McDonalds of Cajun food. I wasn't mad at that at all because that may ACTUALLY be TRUE. So I ordered something else that wasn't what I wanted. IT WAS MEH. 

THE DESSERT was amazing though. OREO CHEESECAKE nom nom.

Pretty good food, and I say this as a person who frequents N'awlins and loves the food there.  I will say the portions are large and fillling. So keep that in mind when ordering appetizers etc.  The Diane was good and the fried crawfish is a new fave.  The gumbo...well I've had better but others may like it. Everything though good during my visit was very under seasoned-but easily adjusted with a couple of salt and pepper shakes-maybe that's on purpose to make it more mainstream.  But regardless worth a try and I would probably come back.

Probably a 3.5 overall for me. 

I met my BIL here for dinner - he said it's insanely popular, so we arrived pretty much as they opened. Be aware that parking in the area is a huge challenge but there is valet service available. They've got signs everywhere warning that if you park in other business lots you'll be booted and towed. 

I love that they're in an old house - the room we sat in had a beautifully preserved tile fireplace and I'm told the upstairs has a great bar. 

The menu is a nice rundown of classics - jambalaya, blackened this-and-that, etc. we started with a small order of blackened shrimp, which arrived swimming in a wonderfully spicy broth. Pro tip - save those bread rolls they give you to soak up this juice. 

Entree wise, I had shrimp and grits which netted me a huge amount of coarse ground grits with a decent amount of shrimp, in s nicely spiced sauce. A few of my shrimp were over cooked but the flavor was there. 

We had no issues getting seated since we arrived at opening but it seems like reservations are the way to go. Cajun Queen isn't near as good as real NOLA cooking but it's way better than what most serve.

The service is very casual as is the entire restaurant. Service is great.

The food is ok, nothing special. The shrimp crab gumbo was pretty good but not hot (as in temp.) enough. The blackened catfish was a huge portion but disappointing, all paprika & chill powder no other seasoning! The veg served was thumbs down, room temp. Broccoli and flavorless over boiled mash potato's! One of the few times I left the starch on the plate.

The meal wasn't bad but acceptable at best!

As most foodies know, a large part of the dining experience is the service.  If the food is magnificent, you can get away with slightly lesser service, but Cajun Queen wasn't tasty enough (but it was good!) to counter the experience of bad service.

The free valet is a nice touch, because parking is a beast around there.  The hostess was busy but seated us kindly.  Then the waiter showed up.  He seemed put out with us, but as the night progressed, it became clear that he might have been irritated with a loud party behind us, because he became slightly less aggravated when they left.  The second bummer of the night was where we were sitting seemed to be a hugely traveled path for people coming and going all night long.  I was bumped every few seconds all night long.  Tiresome.

Seafood Gumbo should have been blowing my doors off with flavor, but instead it was just okay.  I was a little disappointed with the mildness of it.  Needed something.

I had the Crawfish Etouffee and it was really too similar to the gumbo.  I should have made a better choice.  But, it had the same problems as the Gumbo, being too bland.  I guess I just expected more.

My friend had Chicken Diane.  It's a sautéed breast of chicken with mushrooms, green onions, Cajun spices, garlic, butter and parsley.  All served over rice.  Though it was pretty rich, it was a solid dish.

Dessert was again, fine.  There really weren't that many choices, so I chose pecan pie.  It was fine, presentation was pretty lame.  I know, what can you do with a slice of pie.  But 3 or 4 puffs of whip cream from a can has to be one of the least fancy ways to dress it.

We may try it again, perhaps we were there on an off night?  I do like to give a few chances before writing a place off, but this night was not a good showing for this landmark Charlotte restaurant.

(This review from my personal blog)

Albeit they were a little slow in getting us to our table despite a reservation, the quality of the food and the service made up for the late start.  An appetizer of Barbecued Shrimp kicked off the evening awaking the taste buds and preparing them for the main course.   Of course you cannot let the waiter take any of the broth way from the table remaining from the BBQ shrimp.  That would just be wrong. My wife had the crawfish Diane, a delightful dish with ample spices, but not too much, lots of crawfish and fresh mushrooms. I had the New Orleans platter offering fried catfish, oyster, scallops and shrimp along with red beans and dirty rice. The scallops were huge, the catfish cooked and seasoned to perfection and well everything was just great. Our only negative to post is the noise level in the restaurant. It is very difficult to have a conversation at a table without staining your voice. The beer, wine and mixed drink selections were good although they were out of fresh mint so no mojitos that evening.  I recommend trying the place on a week night when It may not be so crowded and noises. You won't go wrong with the food.

I'm so happy that we found this gem. This is the best food I've had in my 3 years living in Charlotte. Very relaxed atmosphere. The Cajun BBQ Shrimp Entree is delicious. Also, the Crawfish Scampie is yummy. They have live Jazz upstairs 7 nights a week. Make sure to reserve a table if you'd like to sit upstairs for the jazz. The servers are all kind and friendly. If your tired of the regular chain restaurants in Charlotte, this is the place to go eat.

Selection of "lighter" healthier Options is limited, so I just gonwith the fried seafood and Diane. Yummm. Only complaint would be side selection  cole slaw is like mayo drowned slop and I have found worms in the streamed broccoli!   It can happen as they are grown in dirt... but the staff didn't handle it appropriately. No suggestion of bringing another option. Just sorry. Again what can you do, half the staff looks like college kids who may not know how to deal w worms in the food. Lol.

I found a living social deal $20 for $40. Cajun food is a personal favorite of mine, especially eating the real deal in New Orleans.

The place is very cute an has a very jazzy,  New Orleans ambiance which I loved. Our server was very helpful by giving us his recommendations. I was very happy they had Abita beer and other great selections from Bird Song Brewery (which I thoroughly indulged in).

We ordered the BBQ shrimp and fried oysters as appetizers. The BBQ was amazing and full of flavor. The only downside was it was a little too garlicy. Oysters aren't my favorite but my boyfriend thought they were great. 

I got the étouffée and it was delicious. Generous amounts of meat and the flavor was great. It just sucked at the end of the meal when we realized it was Easter and our coupon couldn't be redeemed :( an excuse for us to go again, which we did!

Ok, So here we go... The place was beautiful! Great valet parking, great atmosphere. We even got there just in time to hear the 7th street Gator Band play in the first row. The food was immaculate. Now the service... the service was HORRIBLE. The waiter (a tall white male with dark brown hair with a beard) did not good service at all. He hardly smile, or made friendly conversation. He seemed as though he could not be bother with our small requests, such as "hey whats in this drink...what would you recommend to eat ", since it was our first time visiting this restaurant.  Yes, we were two African American women, so I really hope that was not the case. So instead of tipping the waiter, we tip the beautiful band that played live music generously.
We order Shrimp Diane and Ettoufe dish.
2 DRINKS (NEW ORLEANS ICE TEA)- Which was a small let down ..it tasted like juice.  I
Great experience. I wish I was hungier when I visited. Everything I tasted was delicious. The atmosphere was fabulous and everyone was friendly. A must do in Charlotte.

Wanted to give this place 3 stars, but the waitress was weird.  The bill hadn't even arrived and my date offered to pay by handing the waitress her credit card.  Being old-fashioned, I wanted to pay for dinner.  The waitress was adamant on charging dinner to whoever was the first person to give a card.  I tried in vain, but she refused which was perplexing.  It might get difficult with diners trying to make the waitress take their payment, but they have to deal with it.  Feel it out, be a little patient if need be.  Part of being a good server is being able to adjust and stuff.

Food was average - nothing special.  Three stars because the ambiance is just astounding - live jazz music and restaurant is a house, literally.

dmo out

First time dining at Cajun last night. We had a birthday party of around 12. The service was fantastic and 100% accommodating. The food was excellent! I have a shellfish allergy, so I went with the Etouffee with chicken. The dish had just the right amount of spice for my taste. Very cool atmosphere. Upstairs has a full bar and live music. I will definitely be going back soon.
The food was ok, but not great! The service and ambiance were excellent. We would go again, but are in no hurry.

Loved loved loved this place! I had the Bayou blackened fish, chicken, rice and beans and my husband had the Etouffee. We also had the fried green tomatoes. Everything was so delicious! We were there for new years eve and the service was great! Our favorite restaurant. We can't wait to go back.

I'm a transplant from Mississippi so I'm serious about Cajun food and pretty much anything Louisiana(where I spent most of my summers). I went to Cajun Queen on a rainy Saturday night with friends and had gumbo, a delicious cocktail, and a fried catfish platter. Everything was prepared perfectly. I could almost hear the Acadian and Zydeco music playing while I ate my food! I'm a fan.

Let me preface my review by saying I'm a Louisiana native. 

I booked a last minute reservation via yelp and thank goodness I did because they were quite busy.  The Parking situation is a bit crazy but they do have a complimentary valet! The ambiance is very casual and the restaurant is a bit overcrowded.  

I ordered a cup of gumbo and the New Orleans platter. Our food came so fast... impressive! The gumbo was very bland. I don't recommend ordering it! The New Orleans platter was very big and they offer an option to split it with two people for a small up charge and slightly more food!! This was a great option. I split it with my boyfriend and we each received a huge serving of catfish, a couple shrimp, a scallop and a few oysters. I asked that the oysters be fried hard however they weren't ....so we didn't eat them. The shrimp were fine but they weren't really battered ... weird. The fried catfish was the real star of the show... no complaints. The platter also comes with a serving of red beans and rice. Traditionally red beans and rice is thick. Instead, I received a small serving of watery red beans over a lot of rice! 

In total, all this was about $40 which is very reasonable. It could be that I had really high hopes but I found this place to be disappointing.  

They do not split checks or accept groupons dated the same day of service. I suggest making a reservation to be safe and bring cash to tip valet.

What a pleasant surprise!! The fried oysters are the best ever and so is the Diane! I had it with the crawfish and shrimp. Even the garden salad was good to be pretty simple! Definitely a great value! My family and I will be returning:)

It was one of those unanticipated nights, where a coming together of long unseen friends and everyday acquaintances coalesces into something magical. It was supposed to be a mens night for the men and a ladies night for the ladies, but before we could go our separate ways the men realized they loved the ladies and the ladies too loved their men and so all together we decided not to deny ourselves the company of the other sex. Unanimously, we wanted Cajun Queen.
We were all already lit up from our daylight binging, so by the time we stumbled in we were ready for a good time. A milk-skinned hostess in a golf-green blazer and a white and peach paisley blouse batted at us with hazel eyes beneath a mop of perfectly tussled and pasted curls. "We have eight," I said. She glowered. Before she could reply, I little-white-lied her: "We called ahead... they told us to come right now."  
Green blazer took off to see what she could manage; we loitered in the foyer, teetering drunk, glazed eyes reeling under the light of the antique chandelier. Green blazer came back and told us it'd be a bit of wait and recommended we hit the upstairs bar. We were already halfway up the steps. 
Cajun Queen is one of those big old Elizabeth houses, southern gothic, eclectically arranged and echoing blindly with voices from some other era. It's a chatterbox of ancient heritage and white-hot with flickering, inconsistent lights that make you want to trim your mustache pencil thin and drink only from a snifter. Aroma suffused our consciousness and we all just became mindless, visceral things.
At the upstairs bar, this long swan of a bartendress was commanding the room, elegantly and fluidly fetching glasses from the overhead rack, snatching mixers from the under-counter cooler, upturning bottles and dispensing drafts, all motions in succession, all so swift and natural, like something perfectly choreographed and rehearsed. She doled out a trayful of Olde Meck Coppers and we set ourselves to achieving the night.
We were led to a corner table near the glassed wall of the little balcony at the back. I took a chair at the end, sat, leaned back, and rapped my knuckles against the abrasive texture of the mud-red stucco. Our very knowledgeable, upright waiter prattled off a series of specials and toppings of the day with juicy detail, but I all heard was 'something unbelievably amazing' followed by 'something else equally amazing'. I requested a couple batches of fried oysters for the table, and then we went in rounds, ordering our blackened catfishes and our crawfish etouffees and our obscene platters of shrimp and fish and sausage and delight.
Without needing to ask, our upright waiter returned with another round of beers and a handful of waters. "Good man," I said with an acknowledging nod. Huxley was sitting at the opposite end of the table. We had subconsciously retained the man-woman divide throughout the evening. I looked her way until she felt my gaze and when she glanced back I shot her a clever wink. She smiled. I swooned. 
Our food arrived and we all collectively lost our minds. Remoulade-dipped oysters, creamy clumps of spicy rice, mouth-searing fish and peppery shrimp, beer and wine, more wine, and life and love and faces flush and hearts racing. We ate ourselves full, but couldn't stop. Flavors were assaulting us in such unmitigable ways, we were powerless to refuse their beckoning call of mouth-flaming, heart-swelling, eye-watering release. Ryan, at one point, shoved his seat back, sat up straight with hands on thighs, neck rigid like a scout-dog, let out a billowing exhale, momentarily composed himself, then jumped back in for another oyster and few more forkfuls of rice. 
At the table behind us, a prim blond let out a squelch of a cry, half-stood, leaned forward, grabbed her man behind his fuzzy dark ears, and kissed him hard on the mouth. She held that embrace for some time, and all the lights and sounds in the room imploded in upon them. When her lips broke free from his, all the noise and clarity rushed back upon us in a crash. She sat down and knuckled a tear from her eye.
 I clapped my hands and beamed across the room. "This is the greatest night ever!" I shouted out to the dining area. 
Kathryn, a steadying force in our group, narrowed one eye and nodded at me placatively. "You really enjoy the hyperbole, don't you?"
"Get up for it, Kathryn!" I threw my hands wildly about in the air above me. "If it isn't the greatest night... then tell yourself it is, believe it, and make everyone else believe it too! Then it really will be!"
The prim blond and her man giggled, and a few tables around us applauded. I ceremoniously forked the last fried oyster from our appetizer tray, held it high like a chalice, like a triumph, angled my neck, opened my jaw wide, and brought it down mightily into my mouth.
Kathryn looked around, a touch embarrassed, and then began furiously laughing. "Oh, I believe it," she said. "I believe it."

We were a loud table of 8 in the front left room for a day party. I visited Nawlins and thoroughly enjoyed the native drinks. Sooooo I ordered 5 cocktails at Cajun Queen and they were ALL AMAAAAAAAZING. The Etoufee 3 ways was spicy as hell and delish. THE ENTIRE EXPERIENCE was fun and LOUD and fresh, and friendly and just a great night out. Parking was a bit tricky so get a ride there if you don't want the hassle to mess up the evening. Cheers!

I had a wonderful dinner here tonight of the most delectable bbq shrimp! Mmm,  mmm, mmm!  The crawfish scampi was also great. The service was awesome as well! This place is a must if you get to Charlotte! FYI the items I had were from the appetizer menu and were entree size much to my surprise!

Two recommendations.  1. Get the Duck.  2. Order one of the fish specials and pick your toppings.  Oh wait three recommendations---eat it upstairs with the Gator Band.  The guys are as funny as they are old.

Warning:  By far the best dish on the menu is the BBQ shrimp.  My mouth is watering just typing the name (no kidding).  But it will give you some "special" breath.  Bring mints.

Tip: The Étouffée, Diane and Creole travel well and are good for catering.  We actually had a sampling for our Christmas party years back. Yum.

If you can handle the calories the BANANA FOSTERS french toast is crazy good.  I mean crazy crazy good.  It's a good thing I think they only do breakfast once a week.

I was checking my photo's only to find out that I have not made a review of this place. 

Me and Mine went here a few weeks ago for Brunch. 
She had the shrimp & grits
I had had the gumbo.. Everything was nice and neat, served hot (We were the 1st there so no wait)

It was close to 12noon, we had finished our food and basically waiting for the clock to strike 12 so we could order a cocktail before leaving. Well it was was sooooooo close, (maybe 5mins or so) that the waiter placed our order. 

I asked about the bloody marry (Muddy Waters), never really had one (Bloody Mary). The waiter asked.. ARE YOU SURE (with a devilish grin).... (see picture). Well after a 20 bet.. I reluctantly pulled the oyster out only to find it looks like some bull nuts (sorry for the graphic) But thats what made the bet worth wild. 

Trust and Believe, I have video of me taking the "shot" (its really too much drink and biggggg oyster to be a shot).

Everything went well, the waiter found it hill-arry-us.

Cheer's

Cajun Queen is the best place in the world!!! I've been coming here since my parents brought me as a baby. We always order the barbecue shrimp appetizer and then I STILL usually order the barbecue shrimp entree after that hehe. Last time we were here the kitchen was nice enough to serve me pasta with the entree rather than rice. Cajun Queen has a special place in my heart and childhood and always will.

I wasn't much impressed with Cajun Queen during my first visit, mostly because of the indifferent service and average food. The food was just ok -- nothing was really bad or good. The seafood gumbo was pretty tasteless and was probably the worst thing we tried all night. The blackened pork tenderloin was the best, but the meat was slightly overcooked. The fried green tomatoes and Cajun crawfish poppers were both just so-so. They were both lathered in a heavy cream sauce that would have been better served on the side. The crawfish etoufee was very spicy and the crawfish were plentiful and well-cooked, but the meal just did not wow me. Service, by far, was the worst we have experienced at ANY restaurant in Charlotte. Our server was very rushed and hardly gave our table any attention. Not once did he ask if I wanted another cocktail, even though i gulped the first one down in about ten minutes. I guess he figured that people would keep coming to this place (as evidenced by the long waits, even with reservations), and he did not have to do much to keep them coming back. The nicest part of this restaurant is the atmosphere - it is located in an old house and has quite a bit of charm. They also have a live band on Saturdays (and I think other days of the week as well).  I just don't think these things are good enough to make me want to return.

After hearing rave reviews of this restaurant, I was really looking forward to eating here.  Some things were very good and others were not.  For appetizers, our group ordered the Fried Green Tomatoes and the BBQ Shrimp, which were both delicious.  The BBQ shrimp is probably what they are best known for and it is the best thing we ate all night.  It is quite spicy though so, if heat in what you eat isn't your thing, you will want to skip this dish!  I have tried Fried Green Tomatoes several times at other restaurants and just hadn't found any that I liked.  These were absolutely delicious though and I highly recommend them!  For my entrée, I ordered the shrimp and grits.  I am a huge fan of grits and cook them often at home.  I prefer grits to be creamy.  These were more watery and it seemed like they were cooked in chicken broth.  They were also not quite done enough to my liking.  The shrimp and sausage included with the grits were both dry and I just didn't care for this dish at all. For dessert, I ordered pecan pie and my husband got the bourbon bread pudding.  His was MUCH better.  The pecan pie was lacking something in the flavor department where the bread pudding just hit the mark on every level.

Overall, I would go back here again but would stick to the tomatoes and the bbq shrimp!
What a great place. Great building, live music, and service. Had the fried green tomatoes (yum) followed by the Chicken tortellini and the sirloin.  Will be back again
Always good food. Rustic Cajun feel inside. Love the live music. Staff is always friendly. Menu is good but does not change often.
I had a very nice meal and the entertainment was great.  This place is a Charlotte classic and always a fun time.

It was a great experience. The service was great, as all the servers check on you as they're passing by to ensure you are doing okay with your appetizers, drinks, and entrees. My family and I had dinner here for Mother's Day and we were not disappointed. We had Cajun fried oysters, yummy, Diane Chicken and Shrimp, Cajun pasta, and shrimp scampi. Delicious

My wife and I love the bar upstairs. The BBQ shrimp app is amazing. Save the sauce from it to and dip your bread in it. Bartenders are great and mingle well socially with customers. Makes it feel like home.

This is a place that has earned my business for a long time to come after just one visit.  I will be back next time I pass through Charlotte.  Two friends had recommended this place for a business dinner and it did not disappoint.

I brought a potential client here for a laid back, quiet dinner where we could talk and enjoy ourselves and it did not disappoint.  The staff was very patient while we waited for our guest to arrive.

We started with the New Orleans bbq shrimp which were expertly prepared in a not too sweet but slightly spicy sauce.  My party devoured this dish and raved about it.  I then had a bowl of gumbo which came with my meal.  I ordered it sans rice and again, an award winning dish.  Spicy and loaded with seafood, veggies, and sausage.  I could have eaten an entire bowl of this for my meal alone!  Next was the blackened, 14 oz. NY strip steak.  Simply stated, this was HEAVEN!  By far the best NY strip I've had in years!  Perfectly seasoned, cooked, and very, very tender.  I'd eat this meal a million times over.

Now to the staff.  Very attentive and paitent and they gave us plenty of time to talk and relax over coffee at the end of the night.  We talked so long they restaurant had closed and the staff had begun their cleanup duties yet never once asked for us to leave, not even subtle hints like raising the lights.  They let us just sit and talk and talk and talk.

The dress in my opinion varies.  We were in jeans and button downs while some others had sport coats on.  A really good vibe and I'd feel just as comfortable dressed either way.  You will not be disappointed if you spend a nice evening here for your next meal!

We are in shock. This place is the best hidden gem in Charlotte. I found the Groupon and thought, why not... WE WILL NOW BE REGULARS! I truly can not get over how fantastic the food was. The signature drinks were also phenomenal but this place is a must visit. It is located in a quaint house in Elizabeth and is truly the most unique atmosphere. Great photos of New Orleans on the walls and the staff is extremely attentive. We unfortunately did not get to sit upstairs and experience the live music but we will definitely be requesting a seat upstairs next time. 

The meal was great. The fried oysters were fresh, delicious, flaky, not over battered and truly perfect. I then had the cesear salad and my guy had the gumbo. They were both gone in minutes. The cesear dressing is definitely made in house, great flavor, and the gumbo was perfectly spiced and delicious. Our meals were also phenomenal... I had the duck over crawfish etoufee and holy cow was the duck perfect. We also ordered the chicken etoufee... I truly can not stress enough how perfectly spiced these dishes were. I grew up in a large Cajun household and this was honestly better than the etoufee my grandmother made. 

Unreal. We will be back AND SOON!

Thank you for a lovely and unexpectedly delicious meal.

Went last night for my birthday. Really good food - got the cajun pasta which was a special that day. Great atmosphere... we sat downstairs as there's a band upstairs. Seems like there was a disconnect between the hostess and the waitress as my mom called ahead asking what they did for birthdays and the hostess said "you get the bourbon bread pudding with a candle brought to you after you're done with your dinner (for free". But the waitress asked us well after we were done eating and boxed up our food what dessert we wanted... besides that it was a great time. Definitely worth going to for a special occasion.
The only thing I get here is the pork tenderloin which I LOVE every time. Very consistent! Prices are expensive and service is not very friendly.  Environment is charming! Love the old house.

So I had the bayou platter with fish, oysters, shrimp, scallops, and beans and rice. It was really good. The only thing I didn't like was that they put my fish directly on top of the beans which made it soggy on the bottom. The service was really great also. I had a cherry margarita which was super tasty. I'd definitely try this place again and recommend it to anyone looking for some cajun cuisine.

While parking can be scarce, the food, atmosphere and service easily make up for any trouble. The fried oysters are amazing! The Frieda Rita is my favorite margarita. And the Diane, etoufee, and creole are my favorite menu options. One of my top 5 favorite restaurants in Charlotte!
Authentic New Orleans flavor and great family atmosphere.  Not pricey, and the portions are huge.  The fish is fresh, and the service is friendly.  Live music some nights.

You know, I contemplated giving Cajun Queen 5 stars but it just doesn't hold up to some of the best meals of my life in New Orleans.  I don't know if that's even fair, considering I grew up in Pensacola - 2 hrs outside NOLA - and Cajun Queen is better than any place there.  I also lived in Texas - another border state - and never found anything at NOLA's level.

Cajun Queen is a classy spot without being too expensive, and has a few items I really like.  

The complimentary french bread with olive oil and herbs is better than you'd expect.  Take this tip - get the "New Orleans B.B.Q. Shrimp" as an appetizer.  The bread is phenomenal dipped in the shrimp sauce.  As far as entrees are concerned I recommend the crawfish etouffée, creole chicken, or the blackened ribeye.

Went during the restaurant week and wasn't disappointed. I had the shrimp and grits with andouille sausage and a small bowl of gumbo.  The gumbo was a little hot (seasoning hot) but not too much.  The Shrimp & Grits were excellent as well.  The live jazz by the 3 senior citizens was excellent as well.  Overall everything was great and we'll go back again.

Cajun Queen is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. Not only is their food super delicious, in a quaint neighborhood with lots of charm, but their prices are incredibly reasonable. It is located in a beautiful house and always filled with diners. Make a reservation Friday and Saturday evenings! I love their Diane and Etoufee. It is good with any of their meat choices, but I like it with all four. Their is chicken...two good sized pieces, shrimp, crawfish, and andouille sausage. For me, that is enough for at least two meals. The shrimp appetizer is really good too! The servers are really nice and charming, and your glass will never go empty. Cajun Queen is a winner!

Good New Orleans food but a little bit over priced.  I would definitely try it once. Make reservations and ask for upstairs seating near the live music...which they have playing each day of the week. The drinks were excellent and the fried fish made the trip worth it.
Food is always great and service is good! Best brunch in Charlotte. My son loves the beignets and they sell out quick...

Reservations at 5:30 on a Saturday and it was packed. Somewhat slow on the intro and our hipster server pretty much asked our drink, appetizers and entrees at once. 

Fried pickles were great as were the fried green tomatoes and fried oysters (get a half portion). 

Entrees were just ... Blah. Creole tasted like a can of crushed tomatoes. Étouffée was bland as well as the pasta special. I swear they must have ran out of salt and spice. It was just embarrassing to New Orleans. We ate there some time ago but they just threw three strikes for us. 

The bread pudding was good. 

So, good going to the apps, smack the chef and kudos to the desserts.

This was my first time visiting this restaurant on 3/22/17. Cute little place.  I had the Fried New Orleans platter with the gumbo to start.  The gumbo smelled absolutely awesome! It had a little spicy kick but some how there was no flavor.  Very odd.  I received my entrees and it was beautifully presented. The smells were amazing. The fish looked like it was fried to perfection. The taste of everything was extremely disappointing.  No flavor what so ever.  The red beans from the red beans and rice were canned kidney beans with no not a sprinkle of seasoning. The catfish was beautiful. It looked like it was going to be crispy. It was not. One good thing is that you receive a good amount of food. But for the price, its definitely not worth it because the food isnt great at all. I will probably not return

The Cajun Queen is my goto restaurant for Cajun cuisine in Charlotte. The service is always friendly and helpful. I'm usually a Shrimp Etoufffee guy but also like the Washday Blues. My wife and duaghter prefer the Diane toppping to their shrim or chicken as they like a little less spice. Good brews in bottle or draft and a nice wine list. The key lime is my dessert of choice!

My family and I really enjoyed our visit. The atmosphere was perfect for a family gathering. I really like that there was reasonably priced options for the children. I had the Cajun pasta and enjoyed it very much. Service was great. I also like that tip was figured into the bill.
Very quaint location and decor! Just me on a Monday night. Sat upstairs at the bar and had a very nice experience with live music and a very friendly bartender.

Crawfish is always good. They open at 11am on Sunday for brunch. Price Avg $10-13. The only thing I don't like about Cajun Queen is their tables are too close to each other but they always have a full house that explain why they need so many tables. I hope they will move to a bigger place in the future.

A solid spot. This is one of my fiancé's favorite places in Charlotte. We've tried various things - BBQ shrimp, chicken diane, pork chop, fried fish... it's all been great! We often find the gumbo kinda bland but it's nothing that we can't spruce up with hot sauce, salt and pepper. Service is consistently good, as well. 

The only negative about this spot is how they seat people. There have been a few times when we've come when it hasn't been busy but they always seem to put us at tiny two people tables, crammed next to other couples. I get it - they want larger tables for larger parties but if it isn't crowded, why cram the customers who are there into small tables?!?

Note #1: we never come without the Groupon. It's a great deal. They have signs everywhere that say you must wait 24 hrs after purchasing the Groupon to use it so get it at least a day before you plan on coming.

Note #2: on an awkward date or don't really like the person you are with? Ask to eat upstairs - the band (which is awesome) is so loud that it's impossible to carry on a conversation. Me? I love talking to my fiancé (corny but true) so I prefer to sit downstairs. The music is so loud that we can still hear it but we can also hear each other.

I LOVE this restaurant. So far, I have only been twice, but boy I wish I could afford to go weekly! My boyfriend and I just went for Valentine's Day. Had a reservation, got there a little early, and were still seated immediately, and in the jazz room too! (Side note: the female singer they had on Valentine's was INCREDIBLE. Wish I got her name) My boyfriend and I absolutely LOVE the rolls they give everyone, possibly the best rolls I've had at any restaurant. For my drink, I ordered the chocolate martini, my favorite! Oh, and of course a Hurricane later, also delicious

For my entree I had the special Tilapia with the crawfish topping. OH! First, let me mention, the gumbo that comes before the entree is AMAZING. I don't care if it's not authentic! Who cares about authenticity when the food is THAT good. I ate that gumbo so fast my boyfriend was making comments like, "Slow down, it's not going anywhere!" It had a little bit of a kick to it, which I don't normally like, but the flavor was just too good! Now, back to the entree. Last time, I ordered the same thing, but I didn't even try the crawfish topping; I just gave it all to my mom. This time, however, I realized what a mistake that was! I've actually never had crawfish before, so I have nothing to compare theirs to, but it was delicious, and I'm already craving more! The tilapia, like the first time, was also to-die-for. I will admit I'm biased because I like tilapia pretty much anywhere I go as long as they cook it right, but my boyfriend seemed to like it as well. He also loved his salmon special with the shrimp topping (as did I!).

Unfortunately, neither of us were able to leave room for dessert, so I have nothing to say about that. Overall, this place is definitely in my top 3 restaurants in Charlotte now. The only problem is the parking, which is almost unavoidable whenever you go there. It's such a tiny place with barely any parking, but I'd rather deal with the parking than have them move to another location. The tiny old building, along with the jazz music playing, makes me feel like I've gone back in time. It's such a cozy, romantic restaurant. Definitely a great choice for Valentine's Day, and even my extremely picky, high-maintenance boyfriend (I love him, but he is!) agreed. Believe me, he wasn't lying. He wouldn't hesitate to tell me if I picked a bad restaurant! lol.

A litle more upscale Cajun joint, but good. They have live music during the weekend upstairs and their bar is nice. On a beautiful day you can sit out on one of their 2 decks. One on the main floor and the other on the 2Nd floor. 

The steaks are great here, but make sure you try the BBQ shrimp appetizers and fried oysters. The BBQ shrimp is not your typical BBQ. It is hot and more of a broth base that is perfect to dip with the hot rolls. 

Oysters are also lightly fried and not greasy, so enjoy without worrying about your waist.

Best upscale restaurant in charlotte in my opinion for a few reason. 1. Live Jazz 2. Friendly and consistent servers 3. Food is to DIE for if you don't get the crawfish scampi appetizer your crazy it has about 75 crawfish tails. BBQ shrimp is also referred to as Crack due to how addictive they are 4. Food never changes same dishes for years now. Only complaint is sitting close to one another due to relatively packed seating but I can't blame them for maximizing profits. It's a little pricey but will turn into your anniversary/birthday go to place

Enjoyed the food for Sunday brunch. We had the Fried Green Tomatoes, shrimp and grits and the omelet. Then had the bourbon pecan pie. Everything can out quickly and the service was great. Definitely will be back.

We liked it enough to bring friends on our second visit.

Ambiance: 3 stars 
First off, I find this place to be unique as its in an old home that's been converted to a restaurant.  The space between tables and the table tops are small and the noise level is load. I suggest a reservation if you don't want to wait along time to be seated.  It's quaint.

Food: 4 stars 
The four of us had three rounds of Shrimp and grits and one dish of the vegetarian plate (not on the menu, special request).  We all agreed, the grits had a very good taste with the cheese and creole sauce but they were a little runny this time around.  We all enjoyed the andouille sausages, but the blackened grilled shrimp had a taste to it that we couldn't make out, and didn't enjoy.  I ate 3 of 8 and left the rest, same for my wife.  Our guest ate his but kept making a comment that he couldn't identify the odd taste. 

Service: 5 stars 
Our waiter was friendly but distant, apologized if he had to interrupt our conversation and was quick to keep our drinks filled.  Plates were quickly cleared and food came to us hot.  

Extras:
Valet parking is free, but bring a few bucks tip.

Had dinner here on the night of Feb 28th. The restaurant is in a converted old house. We tied a few of the appetizers. All very good. I had the Etouffee with all 3 options, Chicken, Shrimp and Crawfish. Very good. I am looking forward to the chance to go here again.

Doesn't get much better... great cajun food, great staff, fun locale, and voodoo beer. Throw in some live music and it makes a fun summer night dinner! Been around forever... that should tell you something!

Cajun Queen is in a beautiful location. The large house is very quaint with windows so clean they appear transparent. The hostess was well dressed, helpful and charming. It was a Friday night and the place was packed with families as well as couples on a date night.Free valet parking is awesome. But unfortunately, that is were it ends. I write this in hopes of spurring change. The food was painfully bland and the rolls were cold. My husband and I tried the gumbo first. While the taste of the herbs rang through, it just didn't have that, " started with the heads and tails of the shrimp to make my own home made broth taste", that I would expect from a restaurant that markets like an authentic Cajun restaurant and charges the prices that you do. Same with the Shrimp and Grits-bland. The lack of salt would be understandable, if you were living in a nursing home. The mashed potatoes were over cooked and tasted like they had been whipped with water and the Diane sauce was runny. Sad. I feel cheated. I was my birthday and I picked the restaurant and was there with my entire family and everyone had that, " I wish we had went somewhere else look," as the food started to arrive and I can not blame them.  The only saving grace to the entire meal was the pork chops and the fact that the veggies were fresh. When I pay these prices I want to taste the balance of flavors in what I am eating. I want it to taste like home cooked and the food needs to be hot not warm. It is like the food is being cooked with fear-like you might offend the elderly or someone who doesn't like garlic or a little heat. Why have a Cajun restaurant? Yes, I have high standards. You are what you eat and there are tons of other restaurants in Charlotte. The quality for the price is just not there.

Food:  
Fried Oysters were nice and crispy on the outside and delightfully gooey on the inside.. The perfect spice for both the oysters and the shrimp.  On the main course... Lay down a bed of rice, throw some "jerk like" chicken and two different kinds of red bean delicousness and BAM... You are set!   Now, I like my food to have a KICK but this was, what I would call, a controlled KICK.  Just enough spice to get the tongue and mouth salivating and begging for more.  You could always add some more Louisiana hot sauce if you wanted.  Then, to top it off.... bread pudding.. Oh Lordy Lord Lord, the bread pudding.. SOOOOOooo good.  I would go back just for the bread pudding.  

Atmosphere/Staff:  
Bo, the bartender made a mean Hurricane and had extensive knowledge of the shrimp apps that proved to be very helpful.  Everything about the two story restaurant was uniquely decorated and made you feel comfortable and relaxed.  The upstairs outdoor patio was quaint and cozy with a classy touch.  Overall, simply wonderful.  

Please give it a try.. You wont regret it.   

Enjoy

-Ian M.

Very disappointing!!! I don't recommend it and I would never go back. The barbecue shrimp and the etouffee were way over spiced, I don't mean spicy hot, it tasted like some one made a mistake and put too much herbs. The same goes for the gumbo. The pecan pie was absolutely terrible, it was nuked and soggy, the crust was wet with no taste and the pecans were ruined because the pie had been nuked. The fried green tomatoes tasted like they were previously frozen. The service was okay, it was clear they wanted us out as soon as possible. Trust me, don't waste your money, there are better places in Charlotte.

I planned a brunch for my future daughter-in-law, and it turned out perfect having it here. The food was great, the staff was very accommodating and friendly. Couldn't have asked for a better experience!

The fried platter was amazing.  The seasoning in the batter was very tasty and the batter was light and crispy at the same time.  The catfish was tender and juicy.  We also had the grilled salmon with the crawfish sauce and it was good not great that's the reason for the 4 stars instead of 5.  The salmon was a little over cooked.  But in their defense, the salmon is usually blackened and we asked for grilled in order to cut back on the spicy ness.  But overall the food was great.

We came here because we found a Groupon for it and were very impressed. The restaurant is in an old house and is really unique. We ate upstairs on a balcony which was really nice. We got BBQ Shrimp as an appetizer and Shrimp Creole and Shrimp/Chicken/Crawfish Diane for our entrees. The servings were huge and we ended up having enough for lunch the next day. Everything was delicious and I would highly recommend it!

Anything but impressed... food was ok.. But not great and comparing it to new orleans or louisiana is an insult.. im writing this review as i am actually in the restaurant!! Decided to eat at bar upstairs was not greeted.. flloor manager i guess didn't even say hello.. he just handed me menu.. on the other hand the bar tender was nice.. she spoke a few times and after i received my food.... nada!!  I had shrrimp scampi which i could tell the shrimp was fresh.. something was missing!! I think it was the garlic... had the crawfish etoufee and the roux was bitter!! Im like wth??
