With that being said i decided not to have the dessert.. oh and another thing the representation of new orleans or cajun was not present in the staff that works here.. people that are creole are naturally warm and welcoming!!  grade C

We hadn't been to Cajun Queen in years but returned yesterday. The building needs major renovations - I know it is in an old historical building, but some upkeep is expected. Upon parking in the back and approaching the building l was hit with an awful smell - much like you would expect from the alleys in New York. Upon entering the restaurant the interior needs to be gutted and redone. It smells musty and is very dark. The food and service were decent but nothing to write home about.
We really enjoyed this restaurant.  The creole was excellent, the Cajun shrimp and gumbo had a spicy kick to it but not overpowering.  We enjoyed the bread pudding for desert.

About me: I'm a foodie. I love New Orleans/Cajun/Creole cuisine. I've traveled all over the country and see food as an experience. 

Restaurant/Staff:
Awesome Experience! My boyfriend and I celebrated my birthday last night and the staff of Cajun Queen definitely made it a night to remember. We were greeted upon arrival. I wanted to enjoy the live jazz and asked if we could be seated upstairs, the hostess had no issue accommodating this request. Within minutes we were greeted by our waiter. He was so polite, sweet and attended to each of the guest with the same care. Service and music were superb. 
Before leaving the band/staff and guest sang Happy Birthday. 

Food: I honestly can't say enough about how good the food was. The Diane w/ all three meats (crawfish, shrimp and chicken) *dramatic pause*... is in my top 5 of incredible dishes. Honestly, the garlic butter sauce wrapped me like a warm blanket. The portion was appropriate for the price and I didn't feel slighted. My boyfriend had the shrimp and grits and really enjoyed that as well. 

Drink: 
I ordered the Hurricane and it was definitely worth the price. They didn't hold back on the alcohol. 

Parking: Do NOT park behind the salon!! Use the valet or park across the street.

I'm not from New Orleans, and I have no idea what good Cajun food is supposed to taste like. Having said that, what I do know is the difference between Bad food, So-so food, and Good food.. and the food at Cajun Queen is definitely in the Good food category. I was there over the weekend, and got to try the BBQ shrimp, seafood gumbo (appetizers) and the étouffée (entree). Yes, we got a little greedy and tried the étouffée not just with chicken or shrimp or crawfish, but with all three! Every dish was so full of flavor and spice - not the 'my mouth is on fire' kinda spice, but the kind that is enjoyable and goes perfectly with their sweet fruit punch rum cocktail - the hurricane. I could taste the heat in the food, and the basic, yet strong flavors of salt and black pepper, paprika,  herbs and onions, and if that's what Cajun/Creole food is supposed to taste like, I need to get down to New Orleans and indulge in some more of this amazing food! In addition to the food, the service was great and quick. The restaurant was packed, but we never found ourselves sitting around looking for our waiter. He was also kind enough to replace my cocktail when I wasn't pleased with my initial choice (I ordered a Cajun martini, and now I know that that's obviously not the kind of drink you want with spicy food :) )

This is a cute home that has been converted into a restaurant. Seating is limited so reservations are highly recommended. Upstairs they have a full service bar and often live music. Great place to enjoy some jazz, gumbo and good food.

This is the place that you can experience great southern comfort food! It is a New Orleans style. We ordered gumbo for an appetizer. Then shrimp and grits, crawl fish and shrimp etouffee for main dishes. The gumbo was as good as I tried in New Orleans before. A bit spicy and rich! The portion of main dishes was great and the taste was even better! My craw fish and shrimp eotuffee was perfectly spiced for an authentic southern food. Loved the sauce and crawl fish was already peeled to eat. Shrimp and grits was great too. The shrimp was well seasoned and grilled perfectly. 

The service was good and we enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant as well. Will Definitely go back when I have a craving  for southern comfort food.

Went here with friends, celebrating a birthday.  Made a reservation, but still had a small wait for our table.  We sat in the main dining room on the right as you enter the restaurant - right by the entrance.  The tables are extremely small, and with four people, there was not enough room for drinks, water, bread, etc.  I asked to have some of the items removed, as we were not sure where they would put the food.

The food and service were very good, actually excellent.  We all decided to order something different, and because the size of the table, they would bring each dish out separately, with clean bowl and silverware - we'd all share the one dish, and then they would bring out the next.  The waiter actually put thought to the order on how to present the dishes, due to heat/spice of each dish - very well thought out.  Our server was very tentative, and again good service.  Definitely will be back, as the New Orleans BBQ Shrimp was my favorite, and then followed by the Crawfish Etoufee. Definitely need to have a reservation.

Go here ! This place was delicious ,  had great service , and was a cool location . All the food that we ordered was so satisfying . We started with the fried crawfish  and it was great . Our entrees were the shrimp étouffée and the blackened  salmon with broccoli instead of potatoes . The étouffée was amazing , perfect blend of spices . If you're not one for spice , maybe stray away from this one . The blackened salmon and its toppings and sauce was much more mild , but still delicious. I also had the one of the spiked coffees and it was one of my favorites , tasted yummy and woke me up . This was a great date night spot .
Absolutely delicious. The fried green tomato app was my favorite! The salad starter wasn't anything special, definitely get the gumbo. Can't wait to go back.

The food was great, the service was on point, and the atmosphere is fun.
We started with the crawfish (Cajun popcorn). They were fantastic! Then my hubs got the chicken etouffee which was delicious with a kick of spicy. I had the blackened shrimp Caesar salad ..yum!
We finished the meal with bourbon pecan pie (would get again) and bread pudding (probably wouldn't get again...and note: I love bread pudding).
The complimentary valet is great for not trying to find your own parking.
All in all ...we'd go back again.

We went there, for the hundredth time, but this time armed with a Groupon. The process was seamless since hey now scan the coupon at the table with their handheld device.  

The food was great!  I had shrimp and grits!  Halfway through my meal, a bug flew into my food from the light over head.  The waiter quickly removed my plate, comped my meal, and gave me a fresh plate.  I was very impressed.  

I would def go back!  Their waitstaff have certainly improved their skills with dish removal during the meal. And, they are very friendly and professional.  

Great job!
The food was good,also the service, nice place to dine in but it is pricey!

This has got to be the most overrated restaurant in Charlotte. I've been 3 times and I have never been impressed.  But this last time was horrible. This is the McDonald's of Cajun cuisine. Every dish we had was completely flavorless. Fortunately it was only half price because of the Groupon that I used. And even at half off it was overpriced relative the to the exceptionally low quality of the food. I'll never go back.

Date night!  And where shall we go?  Cajun Queen of course.  This restaurant is located in a beautiful, old house on 7th Street.  Initially, we were seated in the very bright back room.  There also happened to be a ladies' holiday party, and, you know how we gals get when we are having fun.  Very loud.  
So, we asked to be moved.  We were told that there were no available tables in the other two dining rooms, but there was space on the rooftop patio.  Huh?  We didn't even know such a space existed.  It was an unseasonably warm December night, so here we go, upstairs to absolute delight!
The rooftop featured retro Christmas music, holiday lighting and a most splendiferous view.  We ordered a half order of the fried oysters to start.  They arrived crispy, with creamy Ranch dressing.  For our entrees, we both ordered the étouffée, his with crawfish, mine with vegetables.  Both needed a little salt, pepper and hot sauce, but, after a little doctoring up,  they were good.  As an aside, I have had their vegetable étouffée when it needed no adornment.  Awesome stuff.  
And now, we shall request the rooftop each time.  Weather permitting.
Sat upstairs with a live jazz band and had a wonderful time. Must order the BBQ shrimp (tip: dip your bread in the sauce!) and Diane style entree. Enjoy!

Update!  Just had my usual as discussed below- crawfish etouffee. Have to confirm my earlier review. It's just the best. Maybe my personal favorite meal in Charlotte. At least in the top 5. 

Earlier Review:
Fantastic and flavorful crawfish etouffee-  I like mine spicier than normal but it's just perfect.  Wonderfully satisfying.  A top meal to remember. 

Have been going to Cajun Queen off and on for 20 years, so it's about time for this review. Highest recommendation. Other dishes sampled and liked were the Shrimp Diane and a basic fried shrimp. 

Decent desserts too. Had the warm bourbon pecan pie (tasty but not much bourbon in it).
This place is absolutely amazing! Found it on Groupon and gave it a try. Drinks were perfect. Food was delicious. I will definitely be a returning customer :)

I really, really don't like leaving 1 star reviews. But man oh man, this was a bad experience. 

There is complimentary valet which is a huge perk. If you choose to self park, read the signs posted so you don't get booted. Tip the valet, they hustle hard.

Me and the boyfriend had a reservation for 7 on a Friday and were running late but we were still seated pretty quickly. I will also note that we had a groupon worth $40 worth of food. 

We ordered the New Orleans BBQ shrimp for the appetizer. I know that garlic is an ingredient but I almost died. The shrimp was well cooked but it seemed like they soaked the shrimp in garlic, sautéed it in garlic, used garlic powder- the whole nine. Thank goodness that they provide complimentary bread to negate some of the garlic.

For the entrees I ordered the Etouffle all 3 (chicken, shrimp, crawfish) and the boyfriend ordered the Creole all 3. Most disappointing entrees ever because there was no seasonings. The Etouffle had heat but no flavor. At a Cajun restaurant, I should be tasting at the minimum some Old Bay seasoning and some Lawry's. The boyfriends creole was the same- bland. Needless to say we used the hell out of the salt/pepper shaker on the table. It's actually pretty sad because the meats were properly cooked but so damn bland. 

I've been to the NOLA before and loved it. I've eaten Cajun food before and loved it. I've made Cajun style foods myself at home before and loved it. Thank goodness for Groupons because I would've had to hop in the kitchen myself to show them how it's done if we paid in full. 

Service was odd. Our server was perfect at first but then it just went downhill. I was almost done eating when I got a refill of water. We didn't get checked on until we were also almost done eating. We ordered beers in cool glasses. The boyfriend wanted a second beer and the server throws a bottled beer on the table and quickly walks away...Um okay. 

I'm glad I ate here because of all the rave reviews because I wanted to try it myself but I will NEVER return. This place is borderline insulting.
Sunday Brunch was great. Service was wonderful.  The Diane was AMAZING!  My daughter had shrimp and grits. She loved it. We all had dessert, pecan pie and bread pudding was phenomenal. Great place.
I had the shrimp scampi which was delicious! The service was fast and our waiter was attentive and gave great recommendations. It was our first time there and we will be back for a repeat.
The most expertly fried seafood that I can remember, and the absolute best fried oysters that I've ever had. If they only did Cajun as good a they do seafood, I would have given them five stars.
Good cajun restaurant in Charlotte.  The fried oysters are out of this world!

My wife and I went to this Restuarant with another couple, and we were pleasantly surprised. The environment with the social scene, jazz music , and the diverse make up of the crowd is what really liked. The service, food was also good we would recommend this Restuarant as a place to go.

Very loud, bad service, and the food doesn't met the expectations. We came w a party of 10 people, we didn't even get menus for a while, it was so loud we could hardly listen to our server. Dirty plates were sitting in our table for a long time. Super disappointed

Such a huge fan of this place. I visited once with a friend for her birthday, and we were both impressed. Their food is true, authentic Cajun food with the best flavors. My friend got etouffe, and it was the perfect consistency. I got cajun pasta and enjoyed every single bite. Don't forget to order a hurricane--in true New Orleans style, it was delicious. 

The restaurant itself is such a cozy environment. It's in an old house. If you're not bothered by walking around nooks and corners to get to your seat, it makes for a really comforting dining experience. It felt a little bit crowded (you sit closely to your "neighbors") but that doesn't bother me. Also, keep in mind that it is valet parking only. There's really nowhere else to park. Also, make a reservation if you can--it gets extremely crowded.  

Recommend this restaurant if you're looking for something unique.

When you first arrive, it's a quaint cute house. The ambiance was intimate yet lively. It felt divey yet, warm and upscale.

Our bartender Mel was life! She's social, has 18years of experience, and appropriate yet balances with giving you (the patron) space. The drinks were strong and compliments the vibe to enjoy the live band. 

My meal was one of those 'slap yo Mama and Grandma good! So that once they realize you've got them you force them to take a bite. Maybe it was just my meal - I probably wouldn't try this in real life, as it wouldn't end well. Leftovers wouldn't save the day either  

Digressing, I met a sweet couple who have become family friends. I witnessed a couple get engaged. I ate until I couldn't eat anymore and will be back for more!

Great Cajun food In Charlotte.

Live Jazz Band upstairs was good, but loud if your are sitting up stairs.  

The Creole spicy  was a nice tomato base, not to spicy.  Then I had the and Etouffee spice with all 3 meats (shrimp , crawfish, and chicken).   This had some nice heat and flavor.   I was really happy with my choice.

You are looking at about $20 per plate, but the quality is really good. 

I would visit again, I just hope they fix the alligator in the food of the building which seems to have fallen over.

I went here Friday night as my cheat night for the diet I'm on. This was a great cheat destination! We arrived for reservations at 8:30. The place was packed! They send you upstairs to the bar to wait until your table ready and I did not even try to get a drink it was so packed. However, our table was ready soon after we arrived. Cajun Queen is in an old house in the Elizabeth community (my community) and has great ambiance. We started off with a crawfish appetizer (not the fried one) and it was delicious! I will definitely get tit again! The cucumber gin drink that was featured was also great. I got the BBQ shrimp as my main course and it was also very good. My date got the salmon special and it was great (Maybe a little better than mine, I had to try a bite!) I ended the dinner with a slice of Oreo cheesecake - yum. Overall this was a great experience and will be my destination when I want some great, spicy Cajun cuisine. (sorry Bordeaux - I won't be visiting you anymore)

I haven't really had "cajun" food before, so when I saw an online deal for it I definitely wanted to check it out. We rarely venture outside Lake Norman and into Charlotte, but the thought of some spicy grub was enough to entice me. Man, I'm glad we went!

When we first arrived at 6pm the place was hopping. I highly recommend making reservations. As for parking, they have a complimentary valet service right next to the restaurant, so I recommend using them rather than driving around looking for street parking. The restaurant itself is a converted home, and has a great, quaint feel to it. However, the small rooms lead to tight quarters, and the neighboring tables will be in pretty close proximity to you. We ate upstairs, and if the close tables didn't make the room loud enough, the live band playing behind us aided in turning tableside conversation into a shouting match. Now this would really get on my nerves at other restaurants, but here it worked. I didn't mind the music, and had no problem forgoing conversation for a bit while enjoying the ambiance of the little room and smooth music. Also, they only played about four songs or so, and took a five minute break in between each, so it wasn't a constant barrage of noise.

Our server was quick and efficient, and our food was brought out in a timely manner despite the bustling customer count. For once I did have a cocktail rather than beer or wine, mainly because the mixed drinks were about the same price as a glass of wine. I ordered the Lynchwood Lemonade ($8) which consisted of Jack Daniels, Triple Sec and lemonade. It was a nice, strong drink and went great with the meal and music. The missus ordered a melon martini that she enjoyed quite a bit. It wasn't too sweet and still had a good kick to it.

After placing our orders some complimentary bread was brought over, which consisted of three rolls. These things might have well been hockey pucks based on how flavorless and hard they were. I think they might have fallen off the "bread pudding" rack and into the "fresh daily rolls" basket because there was no way these things should have been served as they were.

For dinner I ordered the steak special of the day ($24). It came with salad or gumbo, and I went with the salad. Big mistake, because all I got was a bowl with chunks of romaine, a slice of cucumber and some shredded carrot. The vinaigrette that came with it was extremely potent and way too strong. After picking at this salad the main course showed up, which was a 10oz sirloin, crawfish etouffee, mashed potatoes and broccoli. The steak was cooked to order, and despite it being a large (as in tall) cut of meat it was still tender. The blackened seasoning rub added a good deal of spice and flavor to the beef, and I was quite a fan. I was equally happy with the crawfish etouffee, especially since I've never had crawfish before. The etouffee consisted of peeled, small crawfish pieces (smaller than popcorn shrimp) tossed with veggies in a dark, spicy sauce. I really liked the crawfish, which tasted more like lobster than shrimp, and the spice level was perfect...not too much where I couldn't eat it but enough that I felt it after each bite. The mashed potatoes were decent, but nothing out of this world. The broccoli was done kind of poorly, as it was just some huge hunks of slightly steamed broccoli. While the sides and salad were nothing spectacular, the entree was one heck of a spicy, tastetacular bite.

The missus' went with the  Crawfish Diane ($18.95) and enjoyed it as well. The Diane was done in a lighter sauce that was not as spicy as the etouffee, so if you want something that's a little milder this would be the dish. This was her first bite of crawfish too and really enjoyed it. The Diane had a little more substance in that it added rice to the protein and veggie mixture, and there was so much that she had leftovers for lunch the following day. While it was tasty, I thought it was just a bit bland compared to the etouffee.

We ended up splurging for dessert when we saw they offered bread pudding, which has become something we can't pass up when dining out. Cajun Queen makes one heck of a Bourbon Bread Pudding (5), and if you are a fan of bread pudding you shouldn't pass this up. The dessert came in a decent-sized ramekin and was filled with this warm treat. The bread pudding had chunks of peach and raisen going through it, and they became hot and gooey from the heat of the bread pudding. It had great taste and texture, with a nice crust on top. There was also a pile of whipped cream and caramel drizzled across the crust, making the dessert a visual and edible offering. 

Cajun Queen dishes out some great grub. While some things can be improved upon (sides and rolls), the stuff that counts is pretty banging. Our entrees were delicious and the cocktails were done well. This is one of those places that we will definitely be bringing friends and family to when they visit from out of town.

We've been wanting to go to Cajun Queen for a long time.  The stars finally aligned, and we went - with great anticipation.  It was a letdown.  I could explain by making this a long review, but I'll sum it up this way:  The entrees are on one setting: smokin'.  I like it hot, so my etoufee was pretty good.  My wife doesn't, and she tried to play it safe with a "mild" one - the barbecue shrimp.  It was smokin'.  Further, it was identical to the etouffee, except it was more like just a soup with some rice - and the tails still on the shrimp.  With every facial orifice unexpectedly on fire, she sent it back.  They charged us for both the offending volcano and the replacement.  Really?  So I would recommend CQ as a decent place if all in your party like it hot.  If anyone is cayenne-intolerant, split up and send them elsewhere.  And if you send something back, don't expect them to take it off your bill.

I came here because I got a Groupon and I kept hearing about them so I finally got the chance to give them a try. When my niece and I came it was after the snow storm so it was a little bit slick outside and it was really cold. I love the fact that they have valet. When we walked in we were greeted and asked where we would like to sit either downstairs or upstairs with the band. I really wanted to sit by the band but once we got upstairs we realized how congested it was and quickly changed our mind and opted to sit downstairs. The ambiance was very nice and I liked the salt and pepper grinder. The fire place was lit and I could still hear the band playing upstairs but there was a draft coming in from the window. For appetizer I ordered the fried green tomatoes. They were okay just a little bit too firm for me. I ordered the all three Dianne with a side salad. I will say that the food was good but very under seasoned. I had to really season my food once I got home. My niece ordered the chicken, mashed potatoes and broccoli. She didn't say anything about the seasoning but I guess to each its own. I am still a fan and I would definitely come back and try some other things I would just ask them for extra seasoning on my food. Something that I definitely don't think that I should have to request at a place with Cajun in the name.

Date Night at Cajun Queen was delectable!  My husband had the shrimp 'n grits and I enjoyed the étouffée! We were running 5 mins behind, but we were still seated within 5 minutes of our arrival.  Highly recommend for date night!  If you're looking for the live jazz atmosphere, be sure to request this when making your reservation.  Thanks, Fernando!  Your service was just right.

The service is always impeccable, the excellent live jazz that's present upstairs daily, and obviously the most important part -- the never disappointing food which led me back to what may have been my 10th time dining at Cajun Queen. I moved to Washington D.C. about two years ago and every opportunity I have to come back to Charlotte, I make sure to include Cajun Queen on that itinerary. 

My buddy had the blackened catfish with garlic mashed potatoes and the seasonal topping of the day and I had to stick with my personal fav, the chicken based étouffée served over rice. It's so rich with flavors, a good amount of spice, and just the right size for a hearty meal. 

Thank you Cajun queen for never disappointing.
Good food usually very consistent....Great bbq shrimp. Seating can be tight.

Pro's - Great service. Great atmosphere. Good food. 

Cons: Poor parking and the seating is a bit cramped. My wife and I were sat in a corner against the wall & very close to another couple. They were very nice people but sitting that close to other people makes it tough to have a private conversation. The food was good but also a bit too spicy for my liking...even for Cajun food. My wife had the Cajun pasta and I had the crawfish étouffée. Both had GREAT flavor but were also VERY spicy.

The ambience and view from the first floor were nice. The New Orleans B.B.Q shrimp appetizer was very tasty and presented well. It is unfortunate this was by far the best part of our meal. My wife got the creole with chicken, shrimp and crawfish but it was average. I got the etouffe with chicken, shrimp and crawfish but it was not as flavorful as etouffes I had in the past. We also got the toll house cookie pie and it was not a chocolate chip cookie pie as we thought it would be. If we went back, it would only be for the appetizer.
Sat at the bar upstairs and had a delicious bowl of Crawfish Etouffee added shrimp and sausage which was an excellent combination. The bar tender was very attentive and friendly as well.

I have been in Charlotte for over three years and had never been to Cajun Queen, but I have been listening to Jazz a lot lately and got in the mood for some live Jazz. From what I have been able to find, this is the only place in Charlotte that even has live Jazz, so I booked a reservation (through OpenTable) for my girlfriend and I on a Saturday night.

No problems with the reservation or getting us seated as soon as we got there, but I was immediately disappointed to find out that the music was only upstairs and there would be a "20-30 minute wait" for seating upstairs. We were seated downstairs, right next to the entrance--it's not great seeing everyone come and go, as well as the staff milling about the hostess stand.

Our dinner started with no live Jazz (from downstairs it sounded like pots/pans being banged together) and less than ideal seating. Then came the food. It wasn't awful, but it wasn't anything special. Certainly not good enough to warrant all of the rave reviews here or the prices they charge. It was seasoned, but still tasted very bland to me, especially the crawfish, which I thought was overcooked. The seasoning certainly did not taste Cajun to me. (I got the crawfish Creole and my girlfriend had the chicken Etouffee.)

I was definitely not pleased with my first--and last--experience at Cajun Queen, and left $60 poorer and hungry for better food, although I was full. Given that "Live Jazz 7 nights a week" is prominently touted on their website header, they really need to specify that it is only upstairs. I would have requested upstairs seating when I made the reservation, if I had known that was the only place to hear the music. Either that, or they need to remodel that old, bland house to open it up more.

Bottom line: I will not be going back.

Tried to use Groupon, but it was denied due to way too small of a use window.  Food was OK, but very expensive.  Shame on Cajun Queen and shame on Groupon for not allowing a reasonable time window to use the coupon.  Not going back.  This was a real jerk move on their part.  This was our first visit after living in Charlotte for 20+ years.  I guess they didn't want a return visit.
Came here for my wife's birthday one year - had great food and the live jazz is a great plus.
Definitely one of my favs. Loved the gumbo, grits, and creole shrimp. Live jazz was the cherry on the sundae. Speaking of desserts, I remember being pleasantly surprised with the bourbon pecan pie.

So I have been putting Cajun Queen off for sometime now but after I kept hearing online others raving about how good the food was I said eh lets go. So myself and others headed out here yesterday. One thing I love is their is complimentary parking here we were panicking when we first arrived thinking we were not going to be able to find a park ,but to our surprise they had valet service. I feel Cajun Queen has a very intimate setting. Also if you looked around that's all we really seen was couples sitting around gazing in each others eyes and such. They did a very good job with bringing that New Orleans Vibes to Cajun Queen far as decorating goes, real laid back setting with Jazz music playing and mardi gras beads everywhere from outside in the grass to hanging over the ceiling fans I thought that part was pretty cool. Now I can't say the same about the food. Our food was okay, I was expecting so much more I feel like what I ordered wasn't that flavor filled as it should be. I ordered the Crawfish scampi with rice, my mother ordered the half half deal half fried shrimp and half fried oysters, she complained about her broccoli being pretty tough but she didn't want to make a fuss so she just left on the plate. What I will say is for an appetizer we ordered the fried green tomatoes and those were to die for !!!!! Not sure what type of sauce those tomatoes were drenched in but I'm definitely going back just for the green fried tomatoes I want to give them another try all in all .

Oh yeah.  I was there in the late 90s and loved it. 
My first trip back to Charlotte in 15 years and this place was my first stop. 
Excellent meal, especially the crawfish appetizer.  No way I wait that along again before getting back out there!

I love Cajun Queen!! I have been here several times and I will continue to go for the ambience, great cocktails, and fantastic food!!!
The fried green tomatoes are prob the best I have ever had.  The 7th street stumbler is an awesome cocktail!! Not to sweet, but still slightly fruity. I could have easily drank a few of these but I stuck to one. Ordered the Catfish, if you like spicy you would enjoy this...it's awesome.

The reason I give this place a 4 and not a 5 is because of the service we experienced last time we were there. Our waiter was AWFUL, extremely rude -- prob the worst service I have got in a restaurant in years.  He rarely came by to ask if we needed anything, didnt clear our appetizer plates and we were sitting at a small two top. When we were finished, we waiting around for 25 minutes for him to show up. When he did finally show up he threw our check back at us without saying a word.
The ONLY reason I left a tip was bc I use to be a server and even tho he was horrendous, I still can't bring myself to leave a person no tip.

Anyways, the bad service I experienced the one time I went here will not keep me from going here.  Love Cajun Queen!

We had a great experience at this restaurant. Its a unique atmosphere being in a old house. The place was packed the night we went. You definitely need a reservation here on the weekend. We arrived a few minutes early, and were directed upstairs to the bar area. This area was packed and there was a small band playing blues/jazz. It was a great vibe, great atmosphere. I hated to leave there, when our table was ready. But alas, we were called away to a downstairs table. Downstairs, I could no longer hear the band. However, we ordered the special for the night. They had several different kinds of fish, with several different cajun toppings. The food was plentiful and fantastic. This place just has a lot of character and thus it makes a great place for a date night. I probably wouldn't bring the kids here, because they wouldn't appreciate it. But a great place for a nice couples night out, or a dinner date with friends.

Cajun Queen is a must if you are in the Charlotte area. It came highly recommended. It is located in a old renovated home, there is a bar and live music to go along with the amazingly delicious cuisine. 

For starters, the drinks are strong, the fried pickles are awesome and the service was stellar. The staff is extremely friendly and peppy and service fast. I ordered the Diane with chicken, shrimp and crawfish and it was incredible, authentic and out of this world!

I wholeheartedly recommend Cajun Queen to anyone visiting Charlotte or any locals who are living under a rock. :)

We finally made our way to CQ after living down the road for nearly two years. Full disclosure, I'm not a huge fan of Cajun food, Let's say my stomach isn't a huge fan. With that said, I had bought a living social and few months back and we needed to use it. I made reservations for Sunday evening and we were seated right away. We were right next to the band and a Really large, loud group. That wasn't a problem, this isn't a quiet restaurant and the sever and party apologized for being so loud. If you sit downstairs it is not as loud, 

I got the shrimp and grits, Col got the BBQ shrimp both really good and they give you a lot of shrimp. We took two slices of pecan pie to go. Everything was great. Our Server Alex, was on top of it and friendly even when they were really busy. It's a nice spot to go for a fun evening or if you're in the mood for something a little different.

Delicious!

I've been here twice, once for brunch and once for dinner and I thought it was great both times.  At dinner I ordered the blackened chicken and tortellini special and it was great, only complaint was there werent enough tortelliini but it was made up by the overabundance of chicken.  My girlfriend ordered the chicken diane and it was amazing, I was torn as to which dish I enjoyed more.  Service was great and the food came out blazingly fast.

I have been telling my wife that we have to get back to New Orleans just for the food. I don't have to ask that anymore. This place is amazing!!! We were we in town for a panthers game and saw this place. My entire party loved it. The whole experience was amazing.  And the food was the star. Definitely coming back !!! Do urself a favor and stop by..you'll be glad u did

I haven't been to a lot of Cajun Restaurants (yet), but this has hands down been my favorite. Pulling up it looks like a old historic house. I'd never eaten in a restaurant like this so I was excited to get inside. When you pull in, they have complimentary valet. They work really hard so I always make sure I have cash to tip them. One weekends you have to have a reservation as they are normally booked to capacity. Immediately at the door they have someone waiting to seat you. And inside, the layout is just like a house! I love it!! Tables are spacious and the atmosphere is very nice. I've eaten upstairs once and I will never do it again. The reason is because they have a band upstairs every night. While the music is nice, it is loud. I left with a headache that one time from trying to yell over the music along with all the other conversations going on as the bar is upstairs as well. Downstairs you can still hear the music so I prefer to eat there. I've never had a rude server. They are always so nice. I've tried a little bit of everything here, and the only thing that I can say left me something to be desired was the BBQ Shrimp. Not that flavorful, wasn't really exciting, I'll pass on that from now on. The popcorn Crawfish is soooo good! So tender! They just melt in your mouth. I wasn't a fan of the shrimp scampi. While it was delicious!! It was pretty much shrimp served in a soup of oil and butter. Was wayyy too much! And the seafood Gumbo is really good. It has a small kick of heat and you'll get a couple shrimp in it if you're lucky. My favorite meals are the All 3 Diane and the Special where you pick your fish and either Shrimp or Crawfish topping. Just about everything is served over rice but I prefer Mashed Potatoes. And the hands down best dessert there is the Bourbon Pecan Pie!!! OMG!!!!!! Just think 21 Jump Street in my mouth!! So delicious! We thought the bread pudding was pretty bland though. Not much going on flavor wise, which was disappointing because I was excited to try it. Overall this place is awesome! Highly recommend!

It is in a cute house. The ambiance was intimate but the music adds some fun!  Definitely yummy food and talented Jazz band!  Do: order the cheesecake (we had oreo), to die for!!!  Don't: get a bloody mary unless you LOVE cocktail sauce!

Overall we will be dining there again!

We came in for brunch one weekend and the banana foster French toast was seriously to die for! Though the interior and decor left me expecting a bit more, the service was wonderful. I'm interested to try their dinner menu though

The setting of this restaurant is great. The food is great. The live band is great. My waiter, Alex, was great. All these things that contributed to the atmosphere of this restaurant which was amazing!

I'm giving Cajun Queen five stars because I have been dreaming of their pan seared duck breast over crawfish etouffee hitting my lips since the moment I left. This was indisputably the best duck I've ever eaten and the etouffee was an AMAZING accompaniment. The decor and ambiance aren't necessarily the glitz and glam you find in DC's five star restaurants but there was a true essence of NOLA permeating the air from the time we walked in. This was largely in part to their house band located on the second floor playin live music we absolutely loved. There are photos / paintings throughout the restaurant of New Orleans staples but honestly..... I enjoyed Cajun Queen's food better than most things I are while I was in NOLA. 

Fried green tomatoes were cooked and seasoned perfectly and we ate every morsel on the plate.
The Fried oysters tasted phenomenal.
My gumbo was better than any gumbo I had in NOLA but I like spicy food so I added a dash oh hot sauce and sprinkle of black pepper that took it to perfection. The barbecue shrimp was out of this world, delicious. The sauce is soooooo good to sop up with the complimentary bread. Then there was this Oreo cheesecake that was one of my favorite cheesecakes I've ever tasted. Hubby thought his shrimp and grits were just ok but since our server was also pretty great, I could not find cause to deduct a star for that. 

If you're looking for a unique dining experience in Charlotte that will make you feel like you've walked right into the French Quarter of NOLA without hopping on a plane or train, Cajun Queen is not to be missed. Sit upstairs to be close to the live band and utilize their complimentary valet.

Incredible food. We had the bbq shrimp, etouffee 3 ways, and the diane 3 ways. I had the leftovers for breakfast this morning, couldnt resist. Our waitress, Hannah, was awesome. Cant wait to try the rest of the menu!

Although I have passed this location on many trips to  Charlotte as well as when I lived her, today is my first time sampling the cuisine. I started with a very delicious key line Martini and the popcorn  crawfish both a sweet treat. The crawfish for sure should not be missed. Next course was a very fresh and impeccably spice cup of gumbo. For my main course I chose from the specials menu a piece of Mahi Mahi topped with shrimp taoso ham roasted red peppers and mushrooms served over garlic mashed potatoes.  The presentation was beautiful and the taste divine. All if the seafood was extremely fresh.   My husband chose this Resturant to celebrate our Anniversary and I am very pleased with his choice.

Best of the Best!   The Fried Oysters are to die for, and is always fried perfectly. The Shrimp & Crawfish Diane is AWESOME! The BBQ Shrimp w/ the bread is Out Of Bounds. They also have great cocktails, and a band of old guys playing some jazz on stage. The balcony is a nice place to sit.... You cannot go wrong at this place, It's A Must Visit!

I enjoy Cajun/Creole food as a change of pace and Cajun Queen has always delivered a good enough version of things to keep me happy.  Absolutely adore the BBQ shrimp with the only problem being the "gravy" is so good that I end up eating too much bread cause I can't stop sopping it up!

The gumbo is good though on my most recent visit it could have used a bit more salt.  Same for one of the specials we ordered which was blackened mahi with a crawfish, artichoke, tomato sauce.  It was flavorful with perfectly cooked fish and very lemony artichokes though.  Also got the Etouffee (secret... you can order it 4 way where they add andouille to it to go along with the 3 way version with shrimp, crawfish and chicken).  It was really good with a perfect dark roux and just enough spice to get my forehead sweating.  The shrimp in it could be better/bigger/fresher but that's a minor thing compared to the whole of the dish.

I've had the New Orleans's seafood platter before and it's deep fried goodness to be sure.  No matter what you get, portion sizes are more than adequate.

Overall this place is not New Orleans's good, if it were, it would be getting 5 stars but it's definitely good enough for me to make it a semi-regular stop when craving those flavors.

This place is worth a visit. My boyfriend and I went for Sunday Brunch. The Banana Foster French Toast and the eggs Benedict with the crab cakes were both excellent. We also got the shrimp and grits, but they were just ok.
